original: @1b # // 'phrog pa'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //

translated: The origin of the offense of stealing: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: dga' bo la lhan cig gnas pa dge slong chos zhes bya ba ngo tsha shes pa 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bsdams pa bslab pa 'dod pa zhig yod pa des ji srid du dga' bo gnas ngan len kun tu spyod par mi shes pa de srid du de
analyzed: dga' bo la lhan cig gnas pa dge slong chos zhes bya ba ngo tsha shes pa 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bsdams pa bslab pa 'dod pa zhig yod pa des ji srid du dga' bo gnas ngan len kun tu spyod par mi shes pa de srid du de
translated: Nanda had a fellow monk named Dharma who was ashamed, remorseful, restrained, and desirous of training. As long as he did not know that Nanda was engaging in negative conduct,

original: dang lhan cig gnas so //
analyzed: dang lhan cig gnas so //
translated: he stayed with him.

original: gang gi tshe des de gnas ngan len kun tu spyod par shes pa de'i tshe na de rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong rnams dang lhan cig gnas par brtsams te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe des de gnas ngan len kun tu spyod par shes pa de'i tshe na de rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong rnams dang lhan cig gnas par brtsams te /
translated: But when he did know that he was engaging in negative conduct, he began to stay with the monks who naturally abided in virtue,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' lung gis dus gsum du rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' lung gis dus gsum du rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig byed do //
translated: and by the Blessed One's order he went three times a day to bow at his feet.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,🔽“Ānanda, go and tell the monks,🔽‘The Tathāgata will travel through the country of Kosala.

original: kun dga' bo song la dge slong rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs kyi khyed chag las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dang thabs cig tu ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur 'gro bar spro ba @2a * //
analyzed: kun dga' bo song la dge slong rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs kyi khyed chag las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dang thabs cig tu ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur 'gro bar spro ba @2a * //
translated: If you are eager to travel through the country of Kosala with the Tathāgata,🔽then do your work on the Dharma robes.’”

original: des chos gos kyi las gyis shig ces sgo shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dge slong rnams la de skad ces bsgo ba dga' bos thos nas nye dga' la smras pa /
analyzed: des chos gos kyi las gyis shig ces sgo shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dge slong rnams la de skad ces bsgo ba dga' bos thos nas nye dga' la smras pa /
translated: When the venerable Ānanda heard the Blessed One’s words, he told Upasena,

original: gal te bdag cag 'di nyid du 'dug na ni sgo 'phar brgya dag 'das te ji nas kyang lho dgang ba bsgrub par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gal te bdag cag 'di nyid du 'dug na ni sgo 'phar brgya dag 'das te ji nas kyang lho dgang ba bsgrub par bya dgos so //
translated: “If we stay here, we will have to pass a hundred door bolts. We must somehow accomplish our southern rains residence.”

original: ji ste bcom ldan 'das kyi zhan 'bring du 'dong na ni sangs rgyas gshegs pa la phan yon bco brgyad yod par gsungs pas srog chags brgya stong phrag du ma dag kyang 'gro bar 'gyur bas bdag cag gis re zhig chu yang rnyog pa can dag btung dgos🔽par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ste bcom ldan 'das kyi zhan 'bring du 'dong na ni sangs rgyas gshegs pa la phan yon bco brgyad yod par gsungs pas srog chags brgya stong phrag du ma dag kyang 'gro bar 'gyur bas bdag cag gis re zhig chu yang rnyog pa can dag btung dgos par 'gyur la /
translated: If the Blessed One goes to the lower or middle Ganges, since it is said that the Buddha’s journey has eighteen benefits, many hundreds of thousands of living beings will go too, so we will have to drink muddy water for a while.

original: shing ljon pa'i drung du yang go thob par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i drung du yang go thob par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: We will not be able to get a place under the trees.

original: bdag cag dge slong rab tu shes pa 'ga' zhig khrid de sna la dong nas rnyed pa 'grub par 'gyur na su bkri /🔽nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: bdag cag dge slong rab tu shes pa 'ga' zhig khrid de sna la dong nas rnyed pa 'grub par 'gyur na su bkri / nye dgas smras pa /
translated: So let us take some monk who knows the scriptures with us to the north and we will get offerings. Who should we take?”🔽Upananda said, “Take your own student, the monk Dharma. Trick him with material things and take him.”

original: khyod nyid kyi lhan cig gnas pa dge slong chos de zang zing gis brid de khrid cig / de nas dga' bos dge slong chos rang gi drung du chos gos snam sbyar 'drub pa zhur 'ongs pa'i tshe smras pa /
analyzed: khyod nyid kyi lhan cig gnas pa dge slong chos de zang zing gis brid de khrid cig / de nas dga' bos dge slong chos rang gi drung du chos gos snam sbyar 'drub pa zhur 'ongs pa'i tshe smras pa /
translated: Then Nanda went to the monk Dharma, who was in his presence sewing his Dharma robes, and said,

original: khyod la ngas chos gos snam sbyar gcig sbyin gyis khyod rang gis drub mi dgos so //
analyzed: khyod la ngas chos gos snam sbyar gcig sbyin gyis khyod rang gis drub mi dgos so //
translated: I will give you a patched robe. You need not make one yourself.

original: de nas chos kyis dga' bos byin pa'i snam sbyar gyon te rang gi ras yug chen dge 'dun la phul nas snam sbyar rnying pa yang bsod @2b snyoms pa zhig la byin no //
analyzed: de nas chos kyis dga' bos byin pa'i snam sbyar gyon te rang gi ras yug chen dge 'dun la phul nas snam sbyar rnying pa yang bsod @2b snyoms pa zhig la byin no //
translated: Then Dharmasoka put on the patched robe given by Nanda and offered his own cloth to the Sangha. He also gave his old patched robe to a poor man.

original: de nas dga' bos chos la khyod nga'i phyi bzhin sngar 'dong ngo zhes smras pa dang chos ma btub nas /
analyzed: de nas dga' bos chos la khyod nga'i phyi bzhin sngar 'dong ngo zhes smras pa dang chos ma btub nas /
translated: Then Nanda said, You should go with me first. Dharmasoka was unable to go with him.

original: dga' bos chos gos snam sbyar byin pa de phyir phrogs so //
analyzed: dga' bos chos gos snam sbyar byin pa de phyir phrogs so //
translated: Nanda took back the patched robe he had given to Dharmasoka.

original: de nas dge slong chos snam sbyar med bar bcom ldan 'das kyi zhan 'bring du ljongs rgyur song ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos de'i lo rgyus bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol to //
analyzed: de nas dge slong chos snam sbyar med bar bcom ldan 'das kyi zhan 'bring du ljongs rgyur song ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos de'i lo rgyus bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol to //
translated: Then the monk Dharmasoka, without a patched robe, went on a journey to the middle country. The Blessed One saw him and said to the Venerable Ananda, and the Venerable Ananda told the Blessed One the whole story in detail.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /

translated: and, having rebuked Nanda in many ways,

translated: Here, the main part of the downfall is when the monk who is to be expelled is engaged in the act of stealing, either by himself or by someone appointed by him, any article such as cloth that is not his own, in order to steal it, and the act is completed by the article becoming a separate entity from the owner.

analyzed: 'phrog pa'i spang pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dge slong la 'phrog pa'i spong ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral la bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a monk has committed a downfall of abandoning the training, but has not abandoned it, has not separated from it, has not made a confession, and

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la /
translated: has not given up the object of the downfall,

original: ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: ltung ba ma bshags par ram /

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But he does not commit a new downfall.

original: dge slong gis 'phrog pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /

analyzed: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par /

analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog par byed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If he stores another requisite of a monk, that is also abandoned by the power of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But he does not commit an offense.

translated: If he steals the status of a monk, there is no offense.🔽If he steals what was given to him by himself or by another,

analyzed: gzhan gyis byin pa dang dbral bar bya ba rang gi nyid ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: and if he steals what is not his own, there is no offense.

original: gos nyid du gtogs pa chos gos la sogs pa dge slong gi yo byad gang yang rung ba @3b la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gos nyid du gtogs pa chos gos la sogs pa dge slong gi yo byad gang yang rung ba @3b la na smad pa med do //
translated: If he steals any requisite of a monk, such as the robes that are included in the category of cloth, there is no offense.

translated: If he engages in the act of stealing by means of his body, speech, or both, or by means of a group or individually, there is no offense.

original: dbral bar bya ba'i lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur ba mthar thug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dbral bar bya ba'i lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur ba mthar thug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If he steals an object that is separate from the body of the one who is to be robbed, there is no offense.

original: rang gi phyir 'phrog pa dang gzhan gyi phyir 'phrog pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi phyir 'phrog pa dang gzhan gyi phyir 'phrog pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in stealing for one's own sake or for the sake of others.

original: rang gi nyid sel par byed pa'i 'phrog pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi nyid sel par byed pa'i 'phrog pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in stealing to remove suffering.

original: rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa'i 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni dbral bar bya ba rang gi nyid kyi rdzas dang bdag po nyid sel bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa'i 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni dbral bar bya ba rang gi nyid kyi rdzas dang bdag po nyid sel bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Stealing to remove suffering means to remove one's own or another's suffering by stealing the property of one who has attachment to wealth.

original: gos rung ba nyid dang / tshad dang ldan pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gos rung ba nyid dang / tshad dang ldan pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in stealing what is suitable to be worn and is the right size.

original: dbral bar bya ba la dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dbral bar bya ba la dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in stealing from a fully ordained monk who is the object of the theft.

original: mtshan dang khas blangs pa dag gis rang gi phyogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mtshan dang khas blangs pa dag gis rang gi phyogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in stealing from one who is included in one's own faction through a vow or agreement.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dbral bar bya ba dge slong nyid dang / dbrog par bya ba rang gi nyid ma yin ba gos la sogs pa dang de'i 'am des bskos pa'i lus dang ngag bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dbral bar bya ba dge slong nyid dang / dbrog par bya ba rang gi nyid ma yin ba gos la sogs pa dang de'i 'am des bskos pa'i lus dang ngag bsdus pa'am /
translated: The agent of this is a fully ordained monk who is the object of the theft, the object to be stolen is not his own wealth such as robes and so on, and the body and speech of the thief or one appointed by him are included.

original: tha dad pa dag gis dbrog pa'i don du zhugs pa lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa dag gis dbrog pa'i don du zhugs pa lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no //
translated: Those who engage in the act of stealing are the agents.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the basis of the downfall is fivefold:

original: dbral bar bya ba dge slong nyid dang dbrog par bya ba rang gi nyid ma yin pa gos la sogs pa yo byad gang yang rung ba dang / de'i 'am des bskos pa'i lus dang ngag bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: dbral bar bya ba dge slong nyid dang dbrog par bya ba rang gi nyid ma yin pa gos la sogs pa yo byad gang yang rung ba dang / de'i 'am des bskos pa'i lus dang ngag bsdus pa'am /
translated: the monk who is to be robbed, the articles such as robes that are to be stolen, the body and speech of the monk or his designee,

original: tha dad pa gang yang rung ba dang dbrog pa'i don du zhugs pa dang / lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa gang yang rung ba dang dbrog pa'i don du zhugs pa dang / lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa mthar thug pa'o //
translated: any of the three means, and the completion of the act of stealing.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad pa med do //
translated: If any of these five factors is incomplete, the downfall is not incurred.

original: sbyor ba'i lhung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lhung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du 'phrog pa'i spang pa'i lhung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug pa'i bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du 'phrog pa'i spang pa'i lhung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug pa'i bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has not reached the actual basis of the downfall of stealing, one commits a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed pa brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed pa brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each separate preparation for the main subject, there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: dbral bar bya ba ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la rang ngam des bsgos pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pas 'phrogs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dbral bar bya ba ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la rang ngam des bsgos pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pas 'phrogs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one steals from one who is not fully ordained, either by oneself or by one who is fully ordained or not fully ordained, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: blo gros ngan pas byas pa'i 'phrog pa rgod pa'i bsam pas dus chung zad cig sems gdung bar bya'o snyam pas co dris par gyur cig / gnod par gyur cig / mthu bstan par gyur cig ces @4a * //
analyzed: blo gros ngan pas byas pa'i 'phrog pa rgod pa'i bsam pas dus chung zad cig sems gdung bar bya'o snyam pas co dris par gyur cig / gnod par gyur cig / mthu bstan par gyur cig ces @4a * //
translated: If one steals through bad thoughts, with the intention of just a little time of tormenting the mind, with the intention of harming, with the intention of displaying power, and then gives it back, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bya ba de lta bus chos gos la sogs pa dbrog par byas nas phyir sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bya ba de lta bus chos gos la sogs pa dbrog par byas nas phyir sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu la nyes byas so //
translated: If one steals robes and so on, saying, “May they be destroyed,” “May they be harmed,” “May their power be displayed,” there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gos mi rung ba nyid dang / tshad dang ldan pa ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gos mi rung ba nyid dang / tshad dang ldan pa ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the robes are unsuitable or not the right size, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dbral bar bya ba phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang chos 'di pa ma chags pa dang ma nyams pa dag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dbral bar bya ba phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang chos 'di pa ma chags pa dang ma nyams pa dag la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense for those who are not Buddhists to separate from their preceptor, and for those who are Buddhists but are not celibate or have violated their vows.

original: mtshan dang lta ba khas ma blangs pa dag gis rang gi phyogs kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mtshan dang lta ba khas ma blangs pa dag gis rang gi phyogs kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense for those who have not accepted the marks and views to separate from their preceptor, and for those who are not included in one's own faction.

original: khyim pa'i rtags can nyid la nyes byas so //
analyzed: khyim pa'i rtags can nyid la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense for those who are still householders to separate from their preceptor.

original: rang gis mngon sum du ma bskos pa lkog nas bskos pa dang brgyud pas bskos pas 'phrog pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang gis mngon sum du ma bskos pa lkog nas bskos pa dang brgyud pas bskos pas 'phrog pa la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense for those who have not been appointed in public to separate from their preceptor, and for those who have been appointed in secret or through intermediaries.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations of preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation of a minor offense is also a minor offense, which is a minor offense of a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The initial mental intention is a minor offense of a preparation of a preparation.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos po de nas mthar thug pa ni spang pa'i lhung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos po de nas mthar thug pa ni spang pa'i lhung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the actual basis of the offense of abandoning the training is the actual basis of the offense of forsaking the training that is the final stage of the preparatory action of the body and speech.

original: lhung ba med pa ni rigs pa'i don gyi dbang gis byas pa'i 'phrog pa gnod pa dang mi phan pa byed pa la 'jug pa'i bgegs bya ba'i phyir 'phrog pa la lhung ba med de ;
analyzed: lhung ba med pa ni rigs pa'i don gyi dbang gis byas pa'i 'phrog pa gnod pa dang mi phan pa byed pa la 'jug pa'i bgegs bya ba'i phyir 'phrog pa la lhung ba med de ;
translated: There is no offense if one takes away in order to prevent harm and injury, in order to stop the taking of what was not given, and in order to stop the taking of life.

original: gnod pa ni tshe 'di'i lus la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa ni tshe 'di'i lus la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Harm is that which injures the body in this life.

original: mi phan pa ni 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu mi 'dod pa 'byin pa'i sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: mi phan pa ni 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu mi 'dod pa 'byin pa'i sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Injury is the afflicted mind that produces an undesirable result in the next life.

original: 'dir gzhung ni don gzhan dang 'dul ba'i yo byad kyi phyir ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni don gzhan dang 'dul ba'i yo byad kyi phyir ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Here, the treatise states: “There is no offense if it is for the sake of another’s purpose or for the sake of the requisites of discipline.”

original: ji ltar don gzhan gyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar don gzhan gyis she na /
translated: How is it for the sake of another’s purpose?

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: It is as follows.

original: slob dpon dang mkhan po'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dag 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su dus ma yin pa dang chu klung gi kha 'am yur po che'i khar 'gro ba de dag la /
analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan po'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dag 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su dus ma yin pa dang chu klung gi kha 'am yur po che'i khar 'gro ba de dag la /
translated: The teacher and preceptor of the novice and monk who are going to an uninhabited place or to a place with danger, should not allow them to go to an uninhabited place or to a place with danger, or to cross a river or a large canal at an improper time.

original: slob dpon dang mkhan pos cho ma rkun pa dang g-yon can dag gis gos dag phrog par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'phrog gam 'phrog tu 'jug pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan pos cho ma rkun pa dang g-yon can dag gis gos dag phrog par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'phrog gam 'phrog tu 'jug pa lta bu yin no //
translated: If they do go, the teacher and preceptor should think, “It is not right for thieves and rogues to steal the robes of those who are afraid.”

original: ji ltar 'dul ba'i yo byad kyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dul ba'i yo byad kyis she na /
translated: How is it by means of the requisites of training?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dge slong rnams kyi lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag sdig pa'i grogs po dang sdig pa'i zla bo dang sdig pa'i rten grogs dang lhan cig sdig pa brten cing lam du 'gro bar gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag sdig pa'i grogs po dang sdig pa'i zla bo dang sdig pa'i rten grogs dang lhan cig sdig pa brten cing lam du 'gro bar gyur na /
translated: If the novices and monks who are companions of the monks are going along the road in dependence on evil friends, evil companions, and evil supports,

original: de dag la @4b mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis 'di dag sdig pa grogs po dang sdig pa'i zla bo dang sdig pa'i rten grogs la bsten par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas gos dag 'phrog gam /
analyzed: de dag la @4b mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis 'di dag sdig pa grogs po dang sdig pa'i zla bo dang sdig pa'i rten grogs la bsten par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas gos dag 'phrog gam /
translated: The preceptor and the master should think, “It is not proper for them to rely on sinful friends, sinful companions, and sinful supports,” and they should take away their robes, or cause them to be taken away.

original: 'phrog tu 'jug pa lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phrog tu 'jug pa lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: las dang po pa dang / smos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la lhung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la lhung ba med do //
translated: A beginner, one who is sick, one whose mind is disturbed, and one who is afflicted by pain do not fall into transgression.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gi yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du 'phrog pa'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gi yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du 'phrog pa'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in not relying in any way on the act of taking away the robes of any monk, in any situation.

original: phrogs pa'i chos gos gang yin pa de yong su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phrogs pa'i chos gos gang yin pa de yong su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make use of the robes that have been taken away.

original: de ni phyir sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni phyir sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
translated: They should be returned.

original: phyir bcos pa'i sbyor ba gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa'i sbyor ba gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The other preparations for amendment are the same as before.

original: bye brag tu na phrogs pa'i gos de yongs su longs spyad par mi bya ba de la phyir sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu na phrogs pa'i gos de yongs su longs spyad par mi bya ba de la phyir sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In particular, if one does not return the stolen robe, one should not use it.

original: ji ste yongs su longs spyad par gyur na yang de'i lhag ma gang yod pa gang yin pa de la phyir sbyin par bya ste ji srid du mi sbyin pa de srid du ltung ba bshags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ji ste yongs su longs spyad par gyur na yang de'i lhag ma gang yod pa gang yin pa de la phyir sbyin par bya ste ji srid du mi sbyin pa de srid du ltung ba bshags su mi rung ngo //
translated: If one does use it, one should return whatever remains of it. As long as one does not return it, one’s downfall is not confessed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong des gos de'i lhag ma yod pa phyir sbyin par bya zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong des gos de'i lhag ma yod pa phyir sbyin par bya zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here the text says that the monk should return whatever remains of the robe.

original: phyir sbyin par bya ba ni spang zhing bral bar bya ba'i chog yin la de'i 'og tu zhag gcig la sogs pa lon na lhung ba de chos bzhin du phyir bcos par bya'o ;
analyzed: phyir sbyin par bya ba ni spang zhing bral bar bya ba'i chog yin la de'i 'og tu zhag gcig la sogs pa lon na lhung ba de chos bzhin du phyir bcos par bya'o ;
translated: “Return” means to give up and to part with it. After that, if one day has passed, and so on, one should amend the downfall in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ;'phrog pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu ldang pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: ;'phrog pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu ldang pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twenty downfalls that require relinquishment.🔽The origin of the downfall of hoarding

original: // / brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The origin of the downfall of hoarding is twofold: due to a rule and due to a concession.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The story of the rule: The Lord Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: ri brags shig na khyim bdag dad pa dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can zhig 'dug pa des dgon par dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang rta babs mthon po dang ldan pa skar khung dang skar khung dra ba can dang lan kan gyis brgyan pa
analyzed: ri brags shig na khyim bdag dad pa dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can zhig 'dug pa des dgon par dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang rta babs mthon po dang ldan pa skar khung dang skar khung dra ba can dang lan kan gyis brgyan pa
translated: In a certain mountain village, there lived a householder who was faithful, good, and had virtuous thoughts. He had a temple built for the Saṅgha in the wilderness, with a high gateway, adorned with windows and latticed windows,

original: / snying dang mig 'phrog par byed pa mtho ris kyi them skas su gyur pa khri dang / khri'u dang yo byad phun sum tshogs pa zhig byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: / snying dang mig 'phrog par byed pa mtho ris kyi them skas su gyur pa khri dang / khri'u dang yo byad phun sum tshogs pa zhig byed du bcug ste /
translated: captivating the heart and the eye, like a staircase to heaven, with a full complement of thrones, benches, and supplies.

original: de na dge slong drug cu gnas pa de dag la khyim bdag des chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pas mkho ba stobs par byed do //
analyzed: de na dge slong drug cu gnas pa de dag la khyim bdag des chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pas mkho ba stobs par byed do //
translated: That householder provided the sixty monks who lived there with robes, alms-food, and so on, with all their necessities.

original: de nas dus gzhan zhig na khyim bdag de dus kyi @5a * //
analyzed: de nas dus gzhan zhig na khyim bdag de dus kyi @5a * //
translated: Then, at another time, that householder died.

original: chos dang ldan par gyur nas de'i bus yo byad ma sbyar nas dge slong drug cu po de dag ni gzhan du dong ngo //
analyzed: chos dang ldan par gyur nas de'i bus yo byad ma sbyar nas dge slong drug cu po de dag ni gzhan du dong ngo //
translated: The king became a follower of the Dharma, but his son did not provide the necessities, so the sixty monks went elsewhere.

original: rgan zhugs gnyis shig de na 'khod pa'i tshe byang phyogs nas tshong pa don mthun dag der lhags pas dge slong drug cu dbyar zla ba gsum gnas par khas len pa'i bsod snyoms dang brgyad ston dang bcu bzhi ston dang nya ston dang na pa'i rkyen dang sman
analyzed: rgan zhugs gnyis shig de na 'khod pa'i tshe byang phyogs nas tshong pa don mthun dag der lhags pas dge slong drug cu dbyar zla ba gsum gnas par khas len pa'i bsod snyoms dang brgyad ston dang bcu bzhi ston dang nya ston dang na pa'i rkyen dang sman
translated: When two old monks were left there, a group of merchants came from the north. They offered the sixty monks provisions for three months of summer retreat, and the alms of the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days, as well as medicine and supplies for the sick,

original: gyi yo byad dang rnyed pa dang chos gos kyi zong dag phul te /🔽dge slong bzang po dag bos la dbyar 'dir gnas par khas long shig dang / bdag cag kyang dbyar 'das nas 'dir mchis te /
analyzed: gyi yo byad dang rnyed pa dang chos gos kyi zong dag phul te / dge slong bzang po dag bos la dbyar 'dir gnas par khas long shig dang / bdag cag kyang dbyar 'das nas 'dir mchis te /
translated: and goods for robes and other necessities.🔽They said to the two old monks, “Call the good monks and have them agree to stay here for the summer.🔽After the summer retreat, we will come here

original: dge slong ba rgyal mkho ba bstabs par bya'o zhes rgan zhugs gnyis la smras te dong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ba rgyal mkho ba bstabs par bya'o zhes rgan zhugs gnyis la smras te dong ngo //
translated: and offer the monks what they need.”

original: de nas rgan zhugs gcig gis rnyed pa sbas te /
analyzed: de nas rgan zhugs gcig gis rnyed pa sbas te /
translated: Then one of the old monks hid the goods.

original: gcig gis mnyan yod nas drug sde dag sbran pa dang / drug sde dag gis rgan zhugs gnyis las las phyung ste /
analyzed: gcig gis mnyan yod nas drug sde dag sbran pa dang / drug sde dag gis rgan zhugs gnyis las las phyung ste /
translated: The group of six expelled the two elders.

original: dge slong lto 'dun can zhig bsgos nas nyi ma re re zhing bca' ba rnam pa bco brgyad dang tshod ma snum bag can mang po sna tshogs dag dang / legs par sbyar ba'i btung ba sha stag brims pas dbyar zla ba gsum gyi bsod snyoms thams cad zos te /
analyzed: dge slong lto 'dun can zhig bsgos nas nyi ma re re zhing bca' ba rnam pa bco brgyad dang tshod ma snum bag can mang po sna tshogs dag dang / legs par sbyar ba'i btung ba sha stag brims pas dbyar zla ba gsum gyi bsod snyoms thams cad zos te /
translated: A monk with a craving for food was bribed and was given eighteen kinds of food every day, various kinds of oily vegetables, and only well-prepared drinks. Thus, he ate all the alms of the three months of the rainy season.

original: gos kyi rnyed pa yang bgos nas mnyan yod du dong nas dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs te 'khod do ;
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa yang bgos nas mnyan yod du dong nas dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs te 'khod do ;
translated: After also distributing the robes, they went to Śrāvastī and agreed to stay for the latter rainy season.

original: ; dbyar snga ma 'das pa dang byang phyogs pa'i tshong pa don mthun dag der lhags te /
analyzed: ; dbyar snga ma 'das pa dang byang phyogs pa'i tshong pa don mthun dag der lhags te /
translated: After the earlier rainy season had passed, merchants from the north arrived there.

original: bltas na drug ste dag gis de ltar byas par mthong nas de dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go //
analyzed: bltas na drug ste dag gis de ltar byas par mthong nas de dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go //
translated: They saw that there were only six of them and saw that they had done this. They said, “The practice of the śramaṇas, the sons of the Śākya, has been destroyed.

original: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
translated: The practice of the brahmins has been destroyed.

original: 'di ltar bdag cag gi dad pa'i myu gu skyes ma thag tu bcom mo zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag cag gi dad pa'i myu gu skyes ma thag tu bcom mo zhes smod par byed /
translated: “We have just begun to grow the sprouts of faith, and now they have been destroyed.”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized, disparaged, and complained about it.

original: kha zer byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun sdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kha zer byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun sdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

analyzed: drug sde dag la smras nas rnam grangs du mar smad de /

analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yod bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul pa la nyan thos rnams kyi bslabs pa'i gzhi 'di ltar bca' bar bya ste /
translated: he saw the benefit of laying down a rule for the monks, and so laid down a rule for the monks:

analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong rnams kyis dbyar gyi nang du bgo bar mi bya'o //

original: dge slong rnams kyis dbyar gyi rnyed pa @5b dbyar gyi nang du 'god par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi de ltar bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis dbyar gyi rnyed pa @5b dbyar gyi nang du 'god par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi de ltar bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: “If monks store the summer provisions during the summer, they commit an offense.”🔽The story of the permission

translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī.

original: mnyan yod na dge slong ma skyed dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta mi dang / chos sbyin gnyis las skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta mi ni spong ba ma 'khor yang spong ba mo dang ldan pa yin la /

original: chos sbyin ni mdo sde'i mtha' la 'khor yang mdo sde'i mtha' dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos sbyin ni mdo sde'i mtha' la 'khor yang mdo sde'i mtha' dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Dhammadinnā was a sutra expert and had a retinue of sutra experts.

original: de gnyis dbyar khang gcig tu dbyar gnas par khas blangs nas gang gi tshe skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta mi'i 'khor rnam par langs par gyur pa de'i tshe na chos byin gyis rang gi 'khor la nu mo dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma
analyzed: de gnyis dbyar khang gcig tu dbyar gnas par khas blangs nas gang gi tshe skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta mi'i 'khor rnam par langs par gyur pa de'i tshe na chos byin gyis rang gi 'khor la nu mo dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma
translated: They agreed to spend the rainy season in the same house.🔽When Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī’s retinue rose up, Dharmadinnā said to her retinue, “Sisters, the Bhagavān has allowed the going forth and full ordination of nuns.

original: rnams la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong ma'i dngos po rjes su gnang ba gang yin pa de thams cad skyed dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta mi la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: rnams la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong ma'i dngos po rjes su gnang ba gang yin pa de thams cad skyed dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta mi la brten pa yin la /

translated: The Bhagavān has said, ‘Those who protect the minds of others generate much merit.’🔽You should also meditate on impermanence for a while.”

analyzed: de dag kyang mi rtag pa nyid yid la bya ba sgom par rtsom mo //

analyzed: gang gi tshe chos sbyin gyi 'khor rnam par langs par gyur pa de'i tshe na skye gu'i bdag mo chen po goo ta mi yang rang gi 'khor la nu mo dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis dka' ba spyad pa brgya slong phrag
translated: When the audience of the Dharma gift had risen, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī also rose and said to her retinue, “Sisters, the Bhagavān has practiced austerities for three incalculable eons.

analyzed: du ma dag gis pha rol du phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par mdzad de /
translated: He has completed the six perfections in many hundreds of thousands of ways.

analyzed: bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de thams cad sems can la phan pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: He has realized unsurpassed knowledge, and all of that is for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'i gang zag ni bsod nams mang pa skyed par byed do zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'i gang zag ni bsod nams mang pa skyed par byed do zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: The Bhagavān has said, ‘The person who protects the minds of others generates much merit.’

original: khyed cag kyang re zhig mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdo sde'i mtha' dag kha ton gyis shig ces 'doms par byed cing de dag kyang mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdzo sde'i mtha' dag kha ton byed par rtsom mo //

translated: You should also recite the entire sutra on impermanence.”

analyzed: dge slong ma dag de ltar phan tshun sems rjes su srung @6a * //
translated: The nuns, thus protecting each other’s minds,

analyzed: bas dge ba'i chos rnams kyis mi 'phel te chu med pa nas autpa la bzhin no //
translated: did not increase in virtue, like a lotus without water.

analyzed: de nas chos sbyin gyis dge bsnyen ma sa ga yo byad sbyor du bcug ste /
translated: Then Dharmadinna had the lay vow holder Visākhā prepare the materials

analyzed: btsun mo phreng ldan ma las brgyud nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal las kyang dbyar khang gi gzhi blangs te /
translated: and, through Queen Māllikā, obtained the site for the rainy season retreat from King Prasenajit of Kosala.

analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal la ral gri'i mthu can dang rgyal rigs bzang po pa bzhes bya ba'i khrom gnyis yod pa las /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala had two groups of bodyguards: the sword guards and the good warrior class.

translated: The place where the sword-wielding merchants were camped became a place where their wives were enjoying themselves with other men.🔽The place was no longer a suitable place to stay.

analyzed: chos sbyin gyis dge bsnyen ma sa ga phyogs der dbyar khang byed du bcug gnas dge slong ma rnams kyis kyang der gnas par brtsams so //
translated: The nun Dharmadinna had a summer house built for the laywoman Visākhā in that place. The nuns began to stay there.

original: de nas dge slong ma chos sbyin gyis ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom de dmag gi gnas su song ba'i chung ma rnams la chos bstan pas de dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas dge slong ma chos sbyin gyis ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom de dmag gi gnas su song ba'i chung ma rnams la chos bstan pas de dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
translated: Then the nun Dharmadinna taught the Dharma to the wives of the sword-wielding merchants while their husbands were away on campaign. They attained the fruit of stream entry.

original: ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom dmag gnas nas phyir 'ongs ba rnams la yang chos bstan pas de dag gis kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom dmag gnas nas phyir 'ongs ba rnams la yang chos bstan pas de dag gis kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
translated: She also taught the Dharma to the sword-wielding merchants when they returned from their campaign. They also attained the fruit of stream entry.

original: de nas dus gzhan zhig na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal gyal gyi ri brags pa zhig log nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom de 'bebs su btang ba dang de dag gis dge slong ma chos sbyin la zhus te
analyzed: de nas dus gzhan zhig na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal gyal gyi ri brags pa zhig log nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom de 'bebs su btang ba dang de dag gis dge slong ma chos sbyin la zhus te
translated: Later, when the king of Kosala, Prasenajit, had defeated a rebel in a hill fort, he sent out a band of sword-wielding men to suppress the rebellion. They asked the nun Dharmadinna

analyzed: / gzhu gzhu rgyud mad pa dang / mda' mde'u med pa dang / shing gi ral gri dag thogs te /
translated: and took up bows without bowstrings, arrows without arrowheads, and wooden swords.

original: der dong nas mtshan mo rgyun chags gsum pa klags shing mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin dang / 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi dang / gnod sbyin gyi dmag dpon chen po nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang /
analyzed: der dong nas mtshan mo rgyun chags gsum pa klags shing mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin dang / 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi dang / gnod sbyin gyi dmag dpon chen po nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang /
translated: They went there and, reading the third part of the continuous recitation at night, the lord of the Sahā world, Brahmā, the lord of the gods, Śakra, the four world guardians, the twenty-eight great yakṣa generals,🔽and the gods of the desire and form realms all came.

original: gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lngas rtsen dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' po dang / nye dga'i ming gis yon tan bshad pa byas pa dang / rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bus thos nas chos kyi spun de dag rgyal pos gnas ma yin par bskos pa mthong nas /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lngas rtsen dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' po dang / nye dga'i ming gis yon tan bshad pa byas pa dang / rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bus thos nas chos kyi spun de dag rgyal pos gnas ma yin par bskos pa mthong nas /
translated: The great king Vaiśravaṇa heard this and saw that the king had appointed his Dharma friends to unsuitable positions.

original: gnod sbyin gyi dmag dpon chen po lngas rtsen la smras pa nga'i chos kyi spun 'di dag rgyal pos gnas ma yin par bskos kyi song la ri brags pa de phob ste de dag la byin la /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi dmag dpon chen po lngas rtsen la smras pa nga'i chos kyi spun 'di dag rgyal pos gnas ma yin par bskos kyi song la ri brags pa de phob ste de dag la byin la /
translated: He said to the great yakṣa general Pañcaśikha, “The king has appointed my Dharma friends to unsuitable positions. Go and bring down that mountain village and give it to them.

original: srog @6b chags 'ga' la yang mi gnod par gyis shig /
analyzed: srog @6b chags 'ga' la yang mi gnod par gyis shig /
translated: Do it in such a way that no living being is harmed.”
