translated: Then the great yakṣa general Pañcaśikha emanated a special four-division army and captured that mountain village.

original: sgyu dpya dang bcas par ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom la byin nas de dag gis de dag sgyu dpya dang bcas te mnyan yod du bdas nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal la phul ba dang rgyal po dga' nas des smras pa /
analyzed: sgyu dpya dang bcas par ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom la byin nas de dag gis de dag sgyu dpya dang bcas te mnyan yod du bdas nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal la phul ba dang rgyal po dga' nas des smras pa /
translated: They were taken to the market where they were sold along with the counterfeit coins. The people who bought them took them to Śrāvastī and presented them to King Prasenajit of Kosala. The king was pleased and said,🔽“Sirs, take back the counterfeit coins.”

original: shes ldan dag sgyu dpya dag khyed cag nyid khyer cig / de dag gis sgyu dpya de dag khyer te chos sbyin gyi gan du dong nas smras pa /
analyzed: shes ldan dag sgyu dpya dag khyed cag nyid khyer cig / de dag gis sgyu dpya de dag khyer te chos sbyin gyi gan du dong nas smras pa /
translated: They took the counterfeit coins and went to Dānaśūra. They said,

original: 'phags ma bdag cag gson zhing lhags pa dang / bdag cag gi dpal dang skal ba bzang po phun sum tshogs pa gang lags pa de thams cad 'phags ma kho na'i mthu lags kyis rgyal pos bdag cag la sgyu dpya stsal pa 'di dag thams cad 'phags mas thugs brtse ba'i slad du bzhes su gsol /
analyzed: 'phags ma bdag cag gson zhing lhags pa dang / bdag cag gi dpal dang skal ba bzang po phun sum tshogs pa gang lags pa de thams cad 'phags ma kho na'i mthu lags kyis rgyal pos bdag cag la sgyu dpya stsal pa 'di dag thams cad 'phags mas thugs brtse ba'i slad du bzhes su gsol /
translated: “Noble lady, that we are alive and well and have all this glory and good fortune is entirely due to your power. Please accept all these counterfeit coins given to us by the king out of your compassion.”

original: des smras bu dag sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la mchod pa gyis shig dang / des khyed cag la yun rin po'i dong dang / phan ba dang bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des smras bu dag sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la mchod pa gyis shig dang / des khyed cag la yun rin po'i dong dang / phan ba dang bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He said, “Sons, make offerings to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, and that will be for your long-term benefit and happiness.”

original: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zla ba gsum du yo byad thams cad kyis spyan drangs nas /
analyzed: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zla ba gsum du yo byad thams cad kyis spyan drangs nas /
translated: They invited the Blessed One and the community of disciples to stay for three months with all the necessities.

original: de dag snga dro ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la mchod pa byed /
analyzed: de dag snga dro ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la mchod pa byed /
translated: In the morning they made offerings to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha,

original: phyi dro ni chos nyan par byed do //
analyzed: phyi dro ni chos nyan par byed do //
translated: and in the afternoon they listened to the Dharma.

original: de nas yang dus gzhan zhig na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi ri brags pa gzhan zhig log nas rgyal pos ra la gri'i mthu can gyi khrom la bsgo ba /
analyzed: de nas yang dus gzhan zhig na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi ri brags pa gzhan zhig log nas rgyal pos ra la gri'i mthu can gyi khrom la bsgo ba /
translated: Then, at another time, King Prasenajit of Kosala conquered another hill tribe. The king ordered the army of the sword-wielding Rāma

original: khyed deng la ri brags pa che ge mo zhig phob zhig dang res gzhan la mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: khyed deng la ri brags pa che ge mo zhig phob zhig dang res gzhan la mi gtong ngo //
translated: “Go now and conquer such-and-such a hill tribe. I will not give it to anyone else.”

original: de dag gis bsams pa lngar de'i tshe ni bdag cag gis gnod sbyin gyi dmag dpon chen po lngas rtsen gyi mthus ri brags pa de phab kyi /
analyzed: de dag gis bsams pa lngar de'i tshe ni bdag cag gis gnod sbyin gyi dmag dpon chen po lngas rtsen gyi mthus ri brags pa de phab kyi /
translated: They thought, “At that time, by the power of the great yakṣa general Pañcaśikha, we were able to bring down the mountain.🔽Now we will have to go there. So let us invite the noble ones for three months and give them Dharma robes and then leave.”

original: da ni bdag cag gis de nyid du mchi bar bya dgos par 'gyur bas 'di ltar bdag cag gis 'phags pa dag zla bag gsum du yo khyad thams cad kyis spyan drangs bde dag la chos gos dag phul te 'dong bar bya'o snyam nas de dag chos gos🔽dag thogs te /
analyzed: da ni bdag cag gis de nyid du mchi bar bya dgos par 'gyur bas 'di ltar bdag cag gis 'phags pa dag zla bag gsum du yo khyad thams cad kyis spyan drangs bde dag la chos gos dag phul te 'dong bar bya'o snyam nas de dag chos gos dag thogs te /
translated: They took the Dharma robes

original: gtsug lag khang du dong nas dge slong rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du dong nas dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: and went to the monastery. They said to the monks,

original: 'phags pa dag bdag cag rgyal pos dmag gi gnas su btang ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag cag rgyal pos dmag gi gnas su btang ste /
translated: “Noble ones, the king has sent us to the battlefield.

original: gal te na bdag cag de nyid du 'gum par 'gyur ba gang legs pa @7a * //
analyzed: gal te na bdag cag de nyid du 'gum par 'gyur ba gang legs pa @7a * //
translated: If we die there, it will be good.

original: de lta bu'i gnas kyang mchis par 'gyur bas chos gos 'di dag bzhes su gsol /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas kyang mchis par 'gyur bas chos gos 'di dag bzhes su gsol /
translated: Since such a situation will arise, please accept these Dharma robes.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said,🔽“Venerable ones, we do not need Dharma robes.”

original: bzhin ba zangs dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi gnang du bgo bar mi bya'i zhes bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad pas bdag cag mi len to //
analyzed: bzhin ba zangs dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi gnang du bgo bar mi bya'i zhes bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad pas bdag cag mi len to //
translated: The Blessed One has established a rule that the summer-quarters goods of the monks should not be distributed during the summer. We will not accept them.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gis bzhes te zhog la dgag dbye bgyis nas bgo bar mdzod cig ces de dag gis de dag gnas khang du bcug ste dong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gis bzhes te zhog la dgag dbye bgyis nas bgo bar mdzod cig ces de dag gis de dag gnas khang du bcug ste dong ngo //
translated: “Noble ones, please accept them and put them aside. After the end of the summer retreat, distribute them.” They put them in the monks’ living quarters and left.

original: de dag dmag gi gnas su 'phags pa khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis mthong nas des kos la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal la smras pa /
analyzed: de dag dmag gi gnas su 'phags pa khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis mthong nas des kos la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal la smras pa /
translated: When the noble householder Anāthapiṇḍada saw them in the army camp, he said to King Prasenajit of Kosala,

original: lha ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom gzhu gzhu rgyud ma mchis pa dang / mda' mde'u ma mchis pa dang / zhugs shing gi ral gri thogs pa de dag gis ri brags pa dag mi phebs par mi mkhyen tam /
analyzed: lha ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom gzhu gzhu rgyud ma mchis pa dang / mda' mde'u ma mchis pa dang / zhugs shing gi ral gri thogs pa de dag gis ri brags pa dag mi phebs par mi mkhyen tam /
translated: “Your Majesty, do you not know that the army of those who wield swords, bows without strings, arrows without shafts, and swords made of wood will not be able to conquer the mountain forts?

original: gzhan yang de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi sras sha stag ste ;
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi sras sha stag ste ;
translated: Moreover, they are the Buddha’s sons.

original: de dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'phags ma chos byin la brten nas thams cad kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bgyis so //
analyzed: de dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'phags ma chos byin la brten nas thams cad kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bgyis so //
translated: All of them manifested the fruit of stream-entry in dependence on the spiritual friend, the noble Dharmadinnā.

original: kos la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po rnams la bsgo ba /
analyzed: kos la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po rnams la bsgo ba /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala ordered his ministers,

original: shes ldan dag deng phyin chad khyed kyi dmag dpon 'phags skyes bo la bsgo bar bya'i /
analyzed: shes ldan dag deng phyin chad khyed kyi dmag dpon 'phags skyes bo la bsgo bar bya'i /
translated: “Sirs, from now on you should order the general Virūḍhaka,

original: ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom la bsgo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom la bsgo bar mi bya'o //
translated: and not the army of sword-wielding men.”

original: de nas ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom de dag phyir mkhos su phab nas dge slong rnams kyi dgag dbye byas pa'i tshe de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas ral gri'i mthu can gyi khrom de dag phyir mkhos su phab nas dge slong rnams kyi dgag dbye byas pa'i tshe de dag la smras pa /
translated: Then the army of sword-wielding men was dismissed, and when the monks were performing the poṣadha ceremony, they said to them,

original: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo bdag cag dgag dbye byas kyi chos gso dag byin cig / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo bdag cag dgag dbye byas kyi chos gso dag byin cig / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “Sirs, we are performing the poṣadha ceremony. Give us the poṣadha Dharma.”🔽They said,

original: 'phags pa dag bdag cag gis chos gos dag phul lags kyi de dag bzhes shig //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag cag gis chos gos dag phul lags kyi de dag bzhes shig //
translated: “Noble ones, we have offered our Dharma robes. Please accept them.”

original: dge slong de dag dong nas gnas khang gi sgo phya ba dang / phyogs des snum zhing dang ra pas chos gos de dag sril dag gis rmugs te rdul du brlags shing 'dug par snang ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong de dag dong nas gnas khang gi sgo phya ba dang / phyogs des snum zhing dang ra pas chos gos de dag sril dag gis rmugs te rdul du brlags shing 'dug par snang ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang /
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na gos sped pa'i dge slong bsko bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na gos sped pa'i dge slong bsko bar bya ste /
translated: “Monks, therefore, you should appoint a monk to save robes.

original: gos sped pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang mi ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bskos bar mi bya la bskos pa yang dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gos sped pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang mi ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bskos bar mi bya la bskos pa yang dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: A monk who saves robes who does not have five qualities should not be appointed, and if appointed, he should be dismissed.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'dun @7b pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / gos kyi rnyed pa sbas pa dang / ma sbas pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun @7b pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / gos kyi rnyed pa sbas pa dang / ma sbas pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: Going out of desire, going out of hatred, going out of ignorance, going out of fear, and not knowing whether the acquisition of robes is hidden or not hidden.

original: gos sped pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bskos bar bya la /
analyzed: gos sped pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bskos bar bya la /
translated: A monk who is a saver of robes, who has five qualities, should be appointed even if he has not been nominated.

original: bskos pa yang dbyung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: bskos pa yang dbyung bar mi bya ste /
translated: And if he has been nominated, he should not be dismissed.

original: lnga gang zhe na 'dun pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / gos kyi rnyed pa sbas pa dang ma sbas pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na 'dun pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / gos kyi rnyed pa sbas pa dang ma sbas pa shes pa'o //
translated: What are the five? He does not go out of desire, hatred, confusion, or fear, and he knows what has been hidden and what has not been hidden of the gains of robes.

original: 'di ltar bsko par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsko par bya'o //
translated: This is how he should be appointed.

original: je dang por spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: je dang por spro bar bya ste /
translated: First, he should be encouraged:

original: ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par spro 'am /
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par spro 'am /
translated: “Are you, so-and-so, able to save the gains of robes for the saṅgha during the rainy season?”

original: gal te spro na des spro'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te spro na des spro'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he is able, he should say, “I am able.”

original: de'i 'og tu gnas ma la bsham pa byas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnas ma la bsham pa byas te /
translated: After that, the formal procedure of proposal should be done in the midst of the saṅgha.

original: gand'i brdungs nas dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
analyzed: gand'i brdungs nas dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
translated: Having asked the monks with a question that strikes the essential point, having instructed the monks properly, when the entire Saṅgha is present and agrees, a monk should make a proposal and perform the rite.🔽He should say,

original: des dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: des dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “O Noble Saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par spro na /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par spro na /
translated: This monk so-and-so is willing to save the gains of robe-cloth for the Saṅgha during the rainy season.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par bsko bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par bsko bar bgyi ste /
translated: If the time has come for the Saṅgha and it is agreeable, then the Saṅgha should agree to appoint this monk so-and-so to save the gains of robe-cloth for the Saṅgha during the rainy season.

original: des dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped dod //
analyzed: des dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped dod //
translated: This monk so-and-so will save the gains of robe-cloth for the Saṅgha during the rainy season.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the proposal.

original: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The rite is as follows.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “O Noble Saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par spro ste /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par spro ste /
translated: This monk so-and-so is willing to save the gains of robes for the saṅgha during the rainy season.

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par bsko na /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par bsko na /
translated: If the saṅgha appoints this monk so-and-so to save the gains of robes for the saṅgha during the rainy season,

original: tshe dang ldan pa gnag dag dge slong ming 'di bzhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos gyi rnyed pa sped par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gnag dag dge slong ming 'di bzhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos gyi rnyed pa sped par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig //
translated: those venerable ones who agree that this monk so-and-so be appointed to save the gains of robes for the saṅgha during the rainy season should remain silent.🔽Those who do not agree should speak.

original: gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par bskos lags te /
analyzed: gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dbyar dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa sped par bskos lags te /
translated: The saṅgha has appointed this monk so-and-so to save the gains of robes for the saṅgha during the rainy season.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since there is no objection, this is how it will be upheld.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa @8a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa @8a * //
translated: Then the Blessed One gave the instruction

original: 'dod pa rnams dang / bslab pa la gus pa rnams dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa rnams dang / phra ba rnams dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / mdzes pa rnams dang / drod rig pa rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams dang / bslab pa la gus pa rnams dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa rnams dang / phra ba rnams dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / mdzes pa rnams dang / drod rig pa rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then he said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin no //
translated: “Monks, therefore, the previous was a rule, but this is a concession.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this rule of training for the monks in this way:

original: dge slong gis ston zla tha chungs nyar zhag bcus mtshang ba tshun chad du brtad pa las byung ba'i gos shig rnyed la 'dod na dge slong nges gos de blang par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis ston zla tha chungs nyar zhag bcus mtshang ba tshun chad du brtad pa las byung ba'i gos shig rnyed la 'dod na dge slong nges gos de blang par bya'o //
translated: ‘If a monk finds a robe that has arisen from an invitation during the last ten days of the last month of the rainy season, if he wishes, he may accept that robe.

original: blangs nas gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: blangs nas gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: Having accepted it, he may keep it until the time for giving the robe.

original: de las 'das par bcangs na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las 'das par bcangs na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If one keeps it beyond that, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug ste /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug ste /
translated: The person is one of the six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni rnyed pa la gdu ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rnyed pa la gdu ba /
translated: The affliction is attachment to gain.

original: nyes pa ni dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi nang du 'god par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: nyes pa ni dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi nang du 'god par byed pa'o ;
translated: The fault is that the gain of the rainy season is to be distributed in the rainy season.

original: / de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: / de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: In this, a monk refers to one who is a follower of this doctrine.

original: ston zla tha chungs nyar zhag bcu ma tshang ba tshun chad du zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu na dag ga dbye 'byung ba tshan chad du'o //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs nyar zhag bcu ma tshang ba tshun chad du zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu na dag ga dbye 'byung ba tshan chad du'o //
translated: Up to the last day of the last month of summer refers to up to ten days before the end of the rainy season retreat.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos shig zhes bya ba ni brtad pa las byung ba'i gos lnga po dag ste /
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos shig zhes bya ba ni brtad pa las byung ba'i gos lnga po dag ste /
translated: A robe that arises from a distribution refers to one of the five kinds of robes that arise from a distribution.

original: lnga gang zha na /
analyzed: lnga gang zha na /
translated: What are the five?

original: nad pa la sbyin pa dang / nad pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'chib la sbyin pa dang / shi ba'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'gro bar chas pa la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa la sbyin pa dang / nad pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'chib la sbyin pa dang / shi ba'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'gro bar chas pa la sbyin pa'o //
translated: A robe given to the sick, a robe given for the sick, a robe given to the dying, a robe given for the dying, and a robe given to one who is setting out on a journey.

original: de dag kyang dpe tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de dag kyang dpe tsam du zad do //
translated: These are just examples.

original: rgyal po dang chom rkun dang / rigs rgyud dang chu la sogs pas khyer du dogs pa dang / mchod gnas bgo skal la gtogs pa 'chir dogs pa la sogs pa dag kyang yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: rgyal po dang chom rkun dang / rigs rgyud dang chu la sogs pas khyer du dogs pa dang / mchod gnas bgo skal la gtogs pa 'chir dogs pa la sogs pa dag kyang yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: One should also gather those who are afraid of being carried off by kings, thieves, or floods, or who are afraid of dying without having distributed their inheritance, and so on.

original: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan las so //
analyzed: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan las so //
translated: “Gain” means from others.

original: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer pa'o //
translated: “If one wishes” means if one is seeking.

original: dge slong das zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: dge slong das zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
translated: “The monk” means the one who is a monk.

original: gos des zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos des zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “That robe” means

original: bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang ; du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / go tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang ; du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / go tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: one of the seven types of robes: woolen, cotton, linen, jute, silk, camel’s hair, or coarse hemp.

original: blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba'o //
analyzed: blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba'o //
translated: “Should take” means should make it one’s own.

original: blangs nas gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sba bar bya'o //
analyzed: blangs nas gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sba bar bya'o //
translated: “Having taken it, it should be kept until the time for giving the robe” means it should be stored.

original: dge slong gi gos sbyin pa'i dus ni @8b gang yin /
analyzed: dge slong gi gos sbyin pa'i dus ni @8b gang yin /
translated: What is the proper time for giving a monk’s robe?

original: dus ma yin pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: dus ma yin pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the improper time?

original: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya tshun chad ni gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin la /
analyzed: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya tshun chad ni gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin la /
translated: In a place where the rainy season robes have not been distributed, the time for giving a robe is from the first day of the last autumn month until the end of the last autumn month.

original: lhag ma ni dus yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni dus yin no //
translated: The rest of the time is the improper time.🔽In a place where the rainy season robes have been distributed, the time for giving a robe is from the first day of the last autumn month until the end of the last summer month.

original: sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla 'bring po tha chungs nya phan chad nas dbyar zla 'bring po tha chungs nya phan chad nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya tshun chad ni dus ma ni dus ma yin la lhag ma ni dus yin no //
analyzed: sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla 'bring po tha chungs nya phan chad nas dbyar zla 'bring po tha chungs nya phan chad nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya tshun chad ni dus ma ni dus ma yin la lhag ma ni dus yin no //
translated: The rest of the time is the improper time.🔽If he keeps it beyond that,

original: de las 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba ni de las thal bar 'chang na'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba ni de las thal bar 'chang na'o //
translated: means if he keeps it beyond that time.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: A downfall through a grave offense means that, having given up that article, he must acknowledge the downfall of a grave offense.

original: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a downfall through a grave offense.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyis bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyis bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the later amendments by way of the main part, the preparatory stage, and the preparatory stage of the preparatory stage.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis /
translated: Here, the presentation of the main part of the downfalls is as follows:

original: dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed dam /
analyzed: dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed dam /
translated: If a fully ordained monk appropriates for himself the summer retreat gifts before the summer retreat,

original: de bgos sma de sped pa ma bskos pa rnams kyi dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bgos na brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bgos sma de sped pa ma bskos pa rnams kyi dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bgos na brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: or if he does not distribute the summer retreat gifts before the day of the lifting of the restrictions of the summer retreat, then he commits a basic root downfall of a concealed offense.

original: dge slong la brtad ba las byung ba'i spad ba'i ltung byed byung ba na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la brtad ba las byung ba'i spad ba'i ltung byed byung ba na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a fully ordained monk commits a root downfall of a concealed offense, and he does not abandon it, does not separate himself from it, and does not confess it,

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par brtad pa las byung bar gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang par 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par brtad pa las byung bar gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang par 'gyur te /
translated: If one obtains another object that is not abandoned and not separated from, and not confessed, it is also abandoned by the power of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But one does not incur an offense from that.

original: dge slong gis brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /🔽ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba'am phor bu 'am skar gas sam dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog par byed na de yang snga
analyzed: dge slong gis brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la / ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba'am phor bu 'am skar gas sam dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog par byed na de yang snga
translated: If a fully ordained monk obtains an object that is to be abandoned due to theft,

original: ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: as long as he does not confess the object of abandonment and does not confess it individually, if he obtains another object that is to be abandoned due to theft, it is also abandoned by the power of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //🔽dbyar gyi rnyed pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro // dbyar gyi rnyed pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: But one does not incur an offense from that.🔽There is no second offense for summer gains.

original: dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed pa la na smad do //
analyzed: dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed pa la na smad do //
translated: There is no second offense for appropriating in the middle of the summer.

original: brtad pa'i dbang gis mtha'i zhag bcu la rnyed pa ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: brtad pa'i dbang gis mtha'i zhag bcu la rnyed pa ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Except for the ten days at the end of the retreat, there is no fault in keeping robes obtained through begging.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i rnyed pa bdag gir byas pa dbyar gyi nang logs su dgos @9a * //🔽pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i rnyed pa bdag gir byas pa dbyar gyi nang logs su dgos @9a * // pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in keeping robes obtained through begging during the retreat, if they are needed.🔽There is no fault in keeping robes obtained through begging during the retreat, if they are not distributed to the monks.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i rnyed pa dbyar dag las byung ba dag gis sbyin pa 'dus ma bgos par de las 'das par 'chang ba la na smad pa med do //🔽sbyin bdag gis tshig gis 'god par dbang med pa ma gtogs pa gos sbyin pa'i dus sum bgos par de las 'das par 'chang ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i rnyed pa dbyar dag las byung ba dag gis sbyin pa 'dus ma bgos par de las 'das par 'chang ba la na smad pa med do // sbyin bdag gis tshig gis 'god par dbang med pa ma gtogs pa gos sbyin pa'i dus sum bgos par de las 'das par 'chang ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in keeping robes obtained through begging during the retreat, if they are not distributed to the monks, if the donor says that they are to be distributed later.🔽There is no fault in keeping robes obtained through begging during the retreat, if they are not distributed to the monks, if the donor says that they are to be distributed later, if the robes are not yet ready.

original: gos sped pa ma bgos pa rnams kyi dbyar gyi rnyed pa dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bgos pa lan smad pa med do /🔽gos rung ba nyid dang tshad dang ldan pa lan smad pa med do /
analyzed: gos sped pa ma bgos pa rnams kyi dbyar gyi rnyed pa dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bgos pa lan smad pa med do /🔽gos rung ba nyid dang tshad dang ldan pa lan smad pa med do /
translated: There is no fault in keeping robes obtained through begging during the retreat, if they are not distributed to the monks, if the donor says that they are to be distributed later, if the robes are not yet ready, if the robes are not yet sufficient.🔽There is no fault in keeping robes obtained through begging during the retreat, if they are not distributed to the monks, if the donor says that they are to be distributed later, if the robes are not yet ready, if the robes are not yet sufficient, if the robes are not yet suitable.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dbyar gyi rnyed pa dang / dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed pa dang / dbyar gyi nang logs su bgos pa dang / de sped pa ma bskos pa rnams kyis dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bskos pa dag ni byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dbyar gyi rnyed pa dang / dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed pa dang / dbyar gyi nang logs su bgos pa dang / de sped pa ma bskos pa rnams kyis dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bskos pa dag ni byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agents of this are those who have not been appointed to the summer-retreat acquisitions, to the summer-retreat ownership, to the summer-retreat distribution, and to the summer-retreat saving.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are five branches to the downfall of the actual practice:

original: dbyar gyi rnyed pa dang / rung ba nyid dang / brtad pa'i dbang gis mtha'i zhag bcu la rnyed pa ma gtogs par dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed pa dang / de dbyar gyi nang logs su bgos pa dang / de sped pa ma bskos pa rnams kyis dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bgos pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi rnyed pa dang / rung ba nyid dang / brtad pa'i dbang gis mtha'i zhag bcu la rnyed pa ma gtogs par dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed pa dang / de dbyar gyi nang logs su bgos pa dang / de sped pa ma bskos pa rnams kyis dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bgos pa'o //
translated: the summer-retreat acquisitions, the suitability, the ownership within the summer-retreat except for the acquisitions of the ten days at the end by the power of the invitation, the distribution within the summer-retreat, and the non-distribution on the day after the invitation day by those who have not been appointed to the summer-retreat saving.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang ni rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang ni rigs par na smad do //
translated: If these are incomplete, it is a downfall by analogy.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du brtad pa las byung ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du brtad pa las byung ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the performance of a downfall due to agitation, but has not yet reached the actual basis, one has a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various performances of the actual basis, one has a minor offense.

original: dbyar gyi rnyed pa sped pa mi bsko na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dbyar gyi rnyed pa sped pa mi bsko na nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not appoint a monk to keep the summer retreat gifts, one commits a minor offense.

original: gos mi rung ba nyid dang chad dang ldan pa ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gos mi rung ba nyid dang chad dang ldan pa ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one gives inappropriate or incomplete robes, one commits a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The performance of a performance downfall is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed do /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed do /
translated: There are as many performances of a performance as there are performances.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The performance of a minor offense is also a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Furthermore, the first mental intention is the minor offense of the performance of a performance.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the performance with body and speech is the actual minor offense of the performance.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //🔽ltung ba med pa ni dbyar gyi rnyed pa ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o // ltung ba med pa ni dbyar gyi rnyed pa ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: Then, the final step is the actual basis of a downfall through transgression.🔽There is no offense if the gain is not for the rainy season.

original: dbyar gyi nang logs su gir ma byed pa la ltung med do //
analyzed: dbyar gyi nang logs su gir ma byed pa la ltung med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not make a claim during the rainy season.

original: brtad pa'i dbang gis @9b mtha'i zhag bcu la rnyed pa bdag gir byas pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: brtad pa'i dbang gis @9b mtha'i zhag bcu la rnyed pa bdag gir byas pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one makes a claim during the last ten days of the rainy season due to a threat.

original: brtad pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: brtad pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of threats:

original: nad pa la ni sbyin pa dang / nad pa'i phyir sbyin ba dang / 'chi ba la sbyin ba dang / 'chi ba'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'gro bar chas pa la sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: nad pa la ni sbyin pa dang / nad pa'i phyir sbyin ba dang / 'chi ba la sbyin ba dang / 'chi ba'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'gro bar chas pa la sbyin ba'o //
translated: giving to the sick, giving for the sick, giving to the dying, giving for the dying, and giving to those who are about to depart.

original: mtha'i zhag bcu zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par bya ba'i zla ba gsum po de dag gi mtha'i zhag bcu ste /
analyzed: mtha'i zhag bcu zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par bya ba'i zla ba gsum po de dag gi mtha'i zhag bcu ste /
translated: The last ten days means the last ten days of the three months of the rainy season.

original: stong zla 'bring po tshes lnga nas nya'i bar ram /
analyzed: stong zla 'bring po tshes lnga nas nya'i bar ram /
translated: The middle month of the rainy season is from the fifth day of the waxing phase of the moon to the fifteenth day.

original: ston zla tha chungs tshes lnga nas nya'i bar ro /🔽brtad pa las byung ba'i rnyed pa de dbyar gyi nang logs sum bgos pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs tshes lnga nas nya'i bar ro / brtad pa las byung ba'i rnyed pa de dbyar gyi nang logs sum bgos pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: It is from the fifth day of the last autumn month until the full moon of the same month.🔽There is no offense if the acquired goods are distributed during the summer retreat.

original: gos sbyin pa'i dus su bgos pa la ltung ba med do /
analyzed: gos sbyin pa'i dus su bgos pa la ltung ba med do /
translated: There is no offense if the distribution is made during the time of giving out the robes.

original: sbyin bdag gis tshig gis 'god par dbang med par ma gtogs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis tshig gis 'god par dbang med par ma gtogs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the distribution is made by the owner of the goods.

original: gos sped ba bskos pa rnams kyis dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bgos pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gos sped ba bskos pa rnams kyis dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par ma bgos pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the distribution is not made on the day of the end of the retreat, but on the following day, by the appointed distributors of the robes.

original: las dang po pa dang smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is insane, deranged, or overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du brtad pa las byung ba'i spang bar 'gyur pa rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab bar bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du brtad pa las byung ba'i spang bar 'gyur pa rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab bar bya'o //
translated: The training rule on acquired goods is that a monk should not use any acquired goods at any time or in any situation, and should train in not using them.

original: dbyar gos sped pa'i dge slong bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gos sped pa'i dge slong bskor bar bya'o //
translated: The monk who distributes the robes should be appointed.

original: dbyar gyi rnyed pa gos sbyin pa'i dus su bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi rnyed pa gos sbyin pa'i dus su bgo bar bya'o //
translated: The summer gift of cloth should be distributed in the winter.

original: dge slong gi gos sbyin pa'i dus ni gang yin /
analyzed: dge slong gi gos sbyin pa'i dus ni gang yin /
translated: When is it the time to give cloth to a monk?

original: dus ma yin ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: dus ma yin ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: When is it not the time?

original: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni stong zla tha chungs nya tshun chad ni gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin la lhag ma ni dus yin no //
analyzed: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni stong zla tha chungs nya tshun chad ni gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin la lhag ma ni dus yin no //
translated: In a place where the rainy season robe is not spread out, it is not the time to give cloth from the first day of the last autumn month until the full moon of the last autumn month. The rest of the time is the time.

original: sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya phan chad nas dpyid zla 'bring po nya tshun chad ni dus ma yin la lhag ma ni dus yin no //
analyzed: sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya phan chad nas dpyid zla 'bring po nya tshun chad ni dus ma yin la lhag ma ni dus yin no //
translated: In a place where the rainy season robe is spread out, it is not the time to give cloth from the first day of the last autumn month until the full moon of the middle spring month. The rest of the time is the time.

original: de ni dbyar phyi ma'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni dbyar phyi ma'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: This is from the perspective of the later rainy season.

original: dbyar snga ma la ni ston zla 'bring po nya tshun chad do //
analyzed: dbyar snga ma la ni ston zla 'bring po nya tshun chad do //
translated: In the earlier rainy season, it is from the first day of the middle autumn month.

original: dbyar gnas par las blangs pas sra brkyang bting bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par las blangs pas sra brkyang bting bar bya'o //
translated: The rainy season robe should be spread out after taking on the duties of the rainy season.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu drug pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu drug pa bshad zin to /
translated: This completes the explanation of the twenty-sixth downfall: the downfall of not giving cloth to a monk.

original: // / zhag bdun la 'bral ba ri spad ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / zhag bdun la 'bral ba ri spad ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The story of the mountain hermit who was separated for seven days

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med pas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med pas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: mnyan yod nas ha cang thag mi ring ba na ri brags shig yod pa de na khyim bdag phyug pa nor mang pa longs spyod che ba zhig 'dug ste /
analyzed: mnyan yod nas ha cang thag mi ring ba na ri brags shig yod pa de na khyim bdag phyug pa nor mang pa longs spyod che ba zhig 'dug ste /
translated: Not far from Śrāvastī there was a mountain village where there lived a wealthy householder with many possessions and great wealth.

original: de yang dad pa dang ldan zhing @10a * //
analyzed: de yang dad pa dang ldan zhing @10a * //
translated: He was faithful,

original: bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can yin pas des dge 'dun la bsngos te gtsug lag khang rta babs mthon po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can yin pas des dge 'dun la bsngos te gtsug lag khang rta babs mthon po dang ldan pa /
translated: kind, and had virtuous intentions. He had a temple built for the Saṅgha, with a high gateway,

original: skar khung dang skar khung dra ba can dang lan kan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: skar khung dang skar khung dra ba can dang lan kan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with windows, latticed windows, and railings,

original: snying dang mig 'phrog par byed pa mtho ris kyi them skas su gyur pa /
analyzed: snying dang mig 'phrog par byed pa mtho ris kyi them skas su gyur pa /
translated: captivating the heart and the eye, a staircase to the heavens.

original: khri dang khri'u dang yo byad phun sum tshogs pa zhig byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: khri dang khri'u dang yo byad phun sum tshogs pa zhig byed du bcug ste /
translated: He had it furnished with thrones, benches, and all the necessary articles.

original: der dge slong drug cus dbyar dgag dbye byas te dong nas /
analyzed: der dge slong drug cus dbyar dgag dbye byas te dong nas /
translated: There, sixty monks spent the rainy season and left.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na dge slong gzhan drug cu ljongs gyu zhing 'gro ba na der lhags nas khyim bdag des yo byad sna tshogs bstabs te der dbyar gnas par khas blangs so //
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na dge slong gzhan drug cu ljongs gyu zhing 'gro ba na der lhags nas khyim bdag des yo byad sna tshogs bstabs te der dbyar gnas par khas blangs so //
translated: Later, another sixty monks, wandering through the countryside, arrived there. The householder provided them with various necessities and they agreed to spend the rainy season there.

original: khyim bdag de dang ri brags de'i nye 'khor na yang gtsug lag khang gzhan med pas de dag sbyin pa dag bya bar sems pa gang yin ba de thams cad gtsug lag khang de nyid du sbyin zhing byed pas der dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong
analyzed: khyim bdag de dang ri brags de'i nye 'khor na yang gtsug lag khang gzhan med pas de dag sbyin pa dag bya bar sems pa gang yin ba de thams cad gtsug lag khang de nyid du sbyin zhing byed pas der dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong
translated: Since there were no other monasteries in that town or its vicinity, all the gifts that the householder and others intended to give were given and made in that very monastery.

original: rnams la rnyed pa mang po byung ngo //
analyzed: rnams la rnyed pa mang po byung ngo //
translated: The monks who had agreed to spend the rainy season there obtained much wealth.

original: ston zla tha chungs kyi g-yon can dag gis de thos nas dge 'dun tshes bcu bzhi la mtshan mo chos sgrog pa'i tshe nang du brtul nas dge slong dag bcom nas gos phrogs te /
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs kyi g-yon can dag gis de thos nas dge 'dun tshes bcu bzhi la mtshan mo chos sgrog pa'i tshe nang du brtul nas dge slong dag bcom nas gos phrogs te /
translated: When rogues heard that in the last autumn month, on the fourteenth, the monks were reciting the Dharma at night, they broke in, killed the monks, and stole their robes.

original: dong ba dang / dge slong de dag kyang mtshan mo sgren mor mnyan yod na dong nas dge slong rnams kyis dge slong dag la gos kyi bgo bsha' byas pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dong ba dang / dge slong de dag kyang mtshan mo sgren mor mnyan yod na dong nas dge slong rnams kyis dge slong dag la gos kyi bgo bsha' byas pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na dge slong dgon pa pas chos gos gsum las chos gos yang rung ba khyim gzhan du gzhag par bya'o //🔽der nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong dgon pa pas chos gos gsum las chos gos yang rung ba khyim gzhan du gzhag par bya'o // der nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: “Therefore, monks living in the wilderness should keep an extra robe from among the three robes in another house.🔽They should not sleep there.

original: der skya rengs 'char bar mi khya'o //
analyzed: der skya rengs 'char bar mi khya'o //
translated: They should not let dawn break there.

original: gtsug lag khang nyid du skya rengs 'char bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nyid du skya rengs 'char bar bya'o //
translated: They should let dawn break in the monastery.”

original: dge slong dgon pa pas zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad du chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar bya'o zhes rjes su gnang ba dang / dge slong drug sde dag bsams bzhin du zhag bdun du 'bral bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to ;🔽; de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa pas zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad du chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar bya'o zhes rjes su gnang ba dang / dge slong drug sde dag bsams bzhin du zhag bdun du 'bral bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to ; ; de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The Buddha then allowed the monks to stay apart from their robes for up to six days if they were staying in isolated places.🔽The Buddha then addressed the monks:

original: drug sde dag la smras nas /🔽rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: drug sde dag la smras nas / rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: “Monks, I allow you to stay apart from your robes for six days.🔽But if you stay apart from your robes for more than six days, you commit an offense entailing confession.”

original: bslab ba bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la @10b bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab ba bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la @10b bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: The Buddha then instructed them in the benefits of the training rules, saying, “The training rules bring ten benefits:

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag gnas mal dgon pa dgos pa dang bcas par grags pa /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag gnas mal dgon pa dgos pa dang bcas par grags pa /
translated: “Monks, there are many isolated places that are known to have needs,

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas par grags pa /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas par grags pa /
translated: and they are known to be dangerous.

original: 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag tu dbyar phyi mar gyur la dge slong dgon pa pas 'dod na chos gos gsum las chos gos gang yang rung ba khyim gzhan du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag tu dbyar phyi mar gyur la dge slong dgon pa pas 'dod na chos gos gsum las chos gos gang yang rung ba khyim gzhan du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In places that are known to be frightening, with dangers of various kinds, a monk who lives in the wilderness may, if he wishes, leave one of his three robes at a house.

original: dge slong dgon pa la mtshams kyi phyir rol du 'gro dgos pa de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na /
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa la mtshams kyi phyir rol du 'gro dgos pa de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na /
translated: If a monk who lives in the wilderness has to go outside the monastery zone,

original: dge slong dgon pa des zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad du chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa des zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad du chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar bya'o //
translated: he may stay apart from that robe for up to six days.

original: de las 'das par 'bral na spang pa'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las 'das par 'bral na spang pa'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If he stays apart from it longer than that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location of this training rule was in Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug ste /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug ste /
translated: The persons concerned are six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni rang nyams byed pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rang nyams byed pa /
translated: The affliction is the wish to harm oneself.

original: nyes pa ni dgon par chos gos khyim gzhan du gzhag pa dang zhag bdun du 'bral bar byed pa'o /
analyzed: nyes pa ni dgon par chos gos khyim gzhan du gzhag pa dang zhag bdun du 'bral bar byed pa'o /
translated: The action is to leave one’s robe in a house in the wilderness and to stay apart from it for more than seven days.

original: de la dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: In this training rule, “monk” means someone who belongs to this religion.

original: rab tu mang po dag ces bya ba ni gnyis yan chad ni rab tu mang po dag yin no //
analyzed: rab tu mang po dag ces bya ba ni gnyis yan chad ni rab tu mang po dag yin no //
translated: A large number means two or more.

original: gnas mal zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang ngo //
analyzed: gnas mal zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang ngo //
translated: A dwelling place means a monastery.

original: dgon pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra mo dang / chu rdul dang / lcags rdul dang / ri bong rdul dang / lug rdul dang / glang rdul dang / nyi zer gyi rngul dang / sro ma dang / shig dang /
analyzed: dgon pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra mo dang / chu rdul dang / lcags rdul dang / ri bong rdul dang / lug rdul dang / glang rdul dang / nyi zer gyi rngul dang / sro ma dang / shig dang /
translated: A wilderness means a place where there are atoms, fine particles, water particles, iron particles, rabbit particles, sheep particles, cow particles, sunbeam particles, lice, lice eggs,

original: nas dang / sor dang / khru rnams snga ma drug la phyi ma gcig tu bsgre ste khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid do //
analyzed: nas dang / sor dang / khru rnams snga ma drug la phyi ma gcig tu bsgre ste khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid do //
translated: barley, fingers, and cubits. Six of the former are counted as one of the latter. Half a cubit is a human forearm.

original: khru bzhi la gzhu'o //
analyzed: khru bzhi la gzhu'o //
translated: Four cubits is a bow.

original: gzhu lnga brgya la rgyang grags te /
analyzed: gzhu lnga brgya la rgyang grags te /
translated: Five hundred bows is a krośa.

original: de phan chad dgon pa'o //🔽dogs pa dang bcas par grags pa zhes bya ba ni chom rkun pas 'jigs par grags pa'o //
analyzed: de phan chad dgon pa'o // dogs pa dang bcas par grags pa zhes bya ba ni chom rkun pas 'jigs par grags pa'o //
translated: Beyond that is a wilderness.🔽A place known to be dangerous means a place known to be dangerous because of robbers.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas par grags pa zhes bya ba ni seng+ge dang stag gis 'jigs par grags pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas par grags pa zhes bya ba ni seng+ge dang stag gis 'jigs par grags pa'o //
translated: A place known to be fearful means a place known to be fearful because of lions and tigers.

original: 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni sha sbrang dang sbrang bu ma chu rings dang / rlung dang nyi ma dang sdig sbrul gyi 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag tu'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni sha sbrang dang sbrang bu ma chu rings dang / rlung dang nyi ma dang sdig sbrul gyi 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag tu'o //
translated: Those that are known to be fearful because of different fears means those that are known to be fearful because of the different fears of mosquitoes, flies, wind, sun, and poisonous snakes.

original: dbyar phyi mar gyur la zhes bya ba ni dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dbyar phyi mar gyur la zhes bya ba ni dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs par gyur pa ste /
translated: The phrase in the latter rainy season means in the latter rainy season retreat.

original: de ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis gsungs par zad kyi lung bstan pa la ni yan lag ma yin no //🔽dge slong dgon pa pas zhes @11a * //
analyzed: de ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis gsungs par zad kyi lung bstan pa la ni yan lag ma yin no // dge slong dgon pa pas zhes @11a * //
translated: This was stated only in the context of the story, but it is not a factor in the prediction.

original: bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase a monk who lives in the wilderness means

original: dge slong gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: dge slong gang yin pa des so //
translated: a monk who lives in the wilderness.

original: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer na'o //
analyzed: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer na'o //
translated: The phrase if he wishes means if he desires.

original: chos gos gsum las chos gos gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthang gos las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos gsum las chos gos gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthang gos las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The phrase any of the three robes means any of the three robes of a patched robe, an upper robe, or a bathing robe.

original: khyim gzhan du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim gzhan du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In another house means

original: gang na lam po che dang / srang dang bzhi mdo dang sum mdo dag yod par ro //
analyzed: gang na lam po che dang / srang dang bzhi mdo dang sum mdo dag yod par ro //
translated: where there is a main road, an alley, a crossroads, or a three-way intersection.

original: gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdams par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdams par bya'o //
translated: He should leave it means he should deposit it.🔽If a necessity arises for a monk in the wilderness to go outside the boundary,

original: dge slong dgon ba pa la mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro dgos pa de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi 'am mchod rten gyi 'am gang zag gi bya ba'i phyir mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro dgos pa de lta bu'i rkyen🔽zhig byung na'o //
analyzed: dge slong dgon ba pa la mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro dgos pa de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi 'am mchod rten gyi 'am gang zag gi bya ba'i phyir mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro dgos pa de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na'o //
translated: such as for the sake of the community, a stūpa, or an individual, he should go outside the boundary.

original: dge slong dgon ba pa des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: dge slong dgon ba pa des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
translated: That monk in the wilderness means that monk.

original: zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad du zhes bya ba ni nyin yin mtshan drug gi mtha' tshun chad du ste /
analyzed: zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad du zhes bya ba ni nyin yin mtshan drug gi mtha' tshun chad du ste /
translated: Up to six nights means up to six days and nights.

original: zhag bdun pa'i skye rangs ma shar tshun chad du'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i skye rangs ma shar tshun chad du'o //
translated: Up to the break of the seventh day.

original: chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos gzhag pa gang yin ba de dang ngo //
analyzed: chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos gzhag pa gang yin ba de dang ngo //
translated: “He should be separated from that robe outside the boundary” means that he should be separated from the robe that he has stored.

original: de las 'das par 'bral na zhes bya ba ni de las lhag par skya rengs 'char bar byed na'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par 'bral na zhes bya ba ni de las lhag par skya rengs 'char bar byed na'o //
translated: “If he is separated from it for more than that” means that he is separated from it for more than that.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: “It is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession” means that, having relinquished that object, he should acknowledge the offense entailing confession.

original: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so ;
translated: Therefore, it is called “an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: ; de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ; de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is an offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this offense through the main part, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the presentation of the offense, the absence of an offense, the training, and the amendment.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong dgon pa pas chos gos gsum las gang yang rung ba khyim gzhan du gzhag pa las don gyi dbang gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ba zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs shar na /🔽zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong dgon pa pas chos gos gsum las gang yang rung ba khyim gzhan du gzhag pa las don gyi dbang gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ba zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs shar na / zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the actual basis of the downfall is defined as follows: A monk in retreat who has left any of his three robes in a house and who, for a specific purpose, goes outside the boundary, will have committed the actual basis of a downfall of partial defeat that is to be abandoned within seven days if the dawn of the seventh day breaks before he returns.

original: dge slong la zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na /🔽de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na / de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a monk has committed a downfall of partial defeat that is to be abandoned within seven days,

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: if he has not abandoned it and has not separated from it, or if he has abandoned it but has not separated from it, or if he has abandoned it and has separated from it but has not confessed the downfall,🔽and if he acquires another downfall of the same type that is to be abandoned within seven days,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par zhag bdun na 'bral bar gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na @11b de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par zhag bdun na 'bral bar gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na @11b de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: the latter is also abandoned by the force of the former,

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but he has committed a downfall.

original: dge slong ges zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spangs pa'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
analyzed: dge slong ges zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spangs pa'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
translated: If a fully ordained monk commits a downfall that requires forfeiture within seven days, and as long as he has not confessed and been cleared of that downfall, he stores any of the articles that are to be forfeited, such as a begging bowl,

original: chos gos sam dra ba'am phor bu'am ska rags sam dge sbyong gis 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog par byed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos gos sam dra ba'am phor bu'am ska rags sam dge sbyong gis 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog par byed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang par 'gyur te /
translated: a Dharma robe, a water filter, a water bottle, a belt, or any other article necessary for a monk’s livelihood, he commits an offense equal to the original one.

original: de las lhung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las lhung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not commit a downfall.

original: zhag drug pa las lhag pa bdun pa'i skye rengs shar ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: zhag drug pa las lhag pa bdun pa'i skye rengs shar ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: If he stores it for more than six days, but less than seven days, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: 'jigs pa'i dbang ma gtogs par grong gzhan du 'jog pa la na smad pa med do //🔽bcar chad kyi chos dbang ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i dbang ma gtogs par grong gzhan du 'jog pa la na smad pa med do // bcar chad kyi chos dbang ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If he stores it in another village, except in case of danger, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If he stores it, except in case of a special necessity, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: chos gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa byin gyis brlabs pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: chos gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa byin gyis brlabs pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: If he stores a suitable Dharma robe that has been blessed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: nye 'khor dang bcas pa'i mtshams las 'das pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nye 'khor dang bcas pa'i mtshams las 'das pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he goes beyond the boundary of the monastery and its vicinity together with his companions.

original: 'di'i byed pa po'i dge slong dgon ba pa'i chos gos dang mtshams gzhan dang / zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs shar ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po'i dge slong dgon ba pa'i chos gos dang mtshams gzhan dang / zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs shar ba'o //
translated: The monk who is the agent of this downfall is a monk who lives in the wilderness. The factors are: his three robes, any one of them; he stores them in another village; he goes outside the boundary; and the dawn of the seventh day.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual downfall is completed by five factors:

original: dge slong dgon pa pa'i chos gos gsum las gang yang rung ba dang / grong gzhan du bzhag pa dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ba dang / bar chad kyi dbang ma gtogs pa dag zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs shar ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa pa'i chos gos gsum las gang yang rung ba dang / grong gzhan du bzhag pa dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ba dang / bar chad kyi dbang ma gtogs pa dag zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs shar ba'o //
translated: his three robes, any one of them; he stores them in another village; he goes outside the boundary; and the dawn of the seventh day, except if he is prevented from returning by force majeure.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression, a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas so //
translated: The preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as he has not reached the actual downfall, he commits a minor offense for every effort he makes toward the actual downfall.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the many different preparations for the actual basis, there is one misdeed.

original: don gyi dbar ma gtogs par grong gzhan na 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du 'bral ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: don gyi dbar ma gtogs par grong gzhan na 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du 'bral ba la nyes byas so //
translated: Except for the purpose of the intermediate one, if one is separated from that for more than six days while staying in another village, there is a misdeed.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i lhung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i lhung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall through preparation for preparation is a subtle misdeed.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations for preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyar ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyar ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for a misdeed of preparation is also a misdeed, which is a subtle misdeed.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni bya ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni bya ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, the first mental intention is the subtle misdeed of the preparation of action.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then the preparation of body and speech is the actual misdeed of preparation.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang pa'i lhung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba shes par @12a * //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang pa'i lhung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba shes par @12a * //
translated: Then the final step is the actual basis of the downfall of forsaking the training.

original: bya'o ; ; lhung ba med pa ni dgon pa pa 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na chos gos gcig grong gzhan du zhag drug bzhag pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bya'o ; ; lhung ba med pa ni dgon pa pa 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na chos gos gcig grong gzhan du zhag drug bzhag pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is not able to return within six nights because of illness or some other compelling reason.

original: don gyi dbang gis grong gzhan na 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du 'bral ba la ltung ba med do //🔽bar chad kyi dbang gis zhag bdun pa la sogs par thal ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis grong gzhan na 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du 'bral ba la ltung ba med do // bar chad kyi dbang gis zhag bdun pa la sogs par thal ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is staying in another village for the sake of some important business and he does not separate from the robe for more than six nights.🔽There is no offense if he is unable to return within six nights because of an obstacle such as a river with swift currents.

original: zhag drug tu 'gro ba'i la sogs par brnag pa la sogs pa la ltung ba med do //🔽las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: zhag drug tu 'gro ba'i la sogs par brnag pa la sogs pa la ltung ba med do // las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is unable to return within six nights because he is waiting for a companion or for provisions.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnams pa thams cad mi bsten par bsal par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnams pa thams cad mi bsten par bsal par bya'o //

original: de na dge slong gang dag dbyar gnas pa snga mar khas len pa de dag ni rang gi dus yin no zhes tshol bar byed cing bdag cag gis ci'i phyir mi bcang zhes 'chad bar byed do //

analyzed: dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas len pa de dag kyang rang gi dus yin no zhes tshol bar byed cing bdag cag ci'i phyir mi bcang zhes 'chang bar byed de /

analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag smod par byed phyar ka gtong par byed /
translated: The monks with few concerns criticized and complained and said,🔽“These monks are accumulating many things.

analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong @12b rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /

translated: After speaking in praise of being easy to nourish, easy to satisfy, having few desires, and being content, of being pure, of having the qualities of asceticism, of being beautiful, and of being warm-hearted,

analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: he saw ten benefits of establishing a rule and laid down this rule for my disciples:🔽“‘You should not eat fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from a householder who is not a relative.

analyzed: dge slong gis po ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus na dbyar gyi gos ras chen btsal bar bya'o //

analyzed: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed kyi bar du bcad par bya'o //
translated: He should cut it up when half a month remains of the end of the rainy season.

analyzed: gal te dge slong gis so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus pa'i sngon rol du dbyar gyi gos ras chen tshol bar byed dam /

analyzed: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed las 'das par 'chang na spang pa'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location for this rule is in Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
