analyzed: nyes pa ni dbyar gyi gos ras chen ha cang sngar tshol ba dang ha cang yun ring du 'chad bar byed pa'o //
translated: The action is seeking out a rainy season robe too early or keeping it too long.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: In this rule, “a monk” means a monk in this dharma.

original: so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus na zhes bya ba ni zla ba gcig na dbyar nye bar sgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus na zhes bya ba ni zla ba gcig na dbyar nye bar sgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba na'o //
translated: “When one month of summer remains” means when one month remains until the beginning of the rainy season.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'i gos so //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'i gos so //
translated: “The rainy-season robe” means a robe for the rainy season.

original: btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan las so//
analyzed: btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan las so//
translated: “Should seek” means from another.

original: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du'o //
translated: “Should keep it until the end of the rainy season” means until the end of the rainy season.

original: gal te dge slong gis so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus pa'i sngon rol du /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus pa'i sngon rol du /
translated: “If a monk, before one month of summer remains,

analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen tshol bar byed dam zhes bya ba ni de'i mdun rol du'o //
translated: seeks a rainy-season robe” means before that time.

original: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed las 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba de las 'das par ro //
analyzed: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed las 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba de las 'das par ro //
translated: “If he keeps it for more than a half-month after the end of the rainy season” means for more than that.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spang nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spang nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: “It is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession” means that the robe is to be relinquished and the offense is to be confessed.

original: des nas spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des nas spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba gsungs so // de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is called a “transgression of a partially concordant act.”🔽What is the downfall here?

original: 'dir yang @13a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang @13a * //
translated: Here,🔽the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the reparations should be understood through the root text and commentary of the Compendium of Determinations.

original: dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //🔽de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong bdag nyid dbyar gnas pa snga ma 'am phyi ma gang du khas blangs pa de'i mdun rol gyi zla ba gcig pas snga rol du dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba tshol lam //
analyzed: dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o // de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong bdag nyid dbyar gnas pa snga ma 'am phyi ma gang du khas blangs pa de'i mdun rol gyi zla ba gcig pas snga rol du dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba tshol lam //
translated: The root text and commentary of the Compendium of Determinations explain the downfalls of the rainy season practice.🔽The rainy season practice is undertaken for three months during one of two periods: the earlier period, which is the four months from the middle of the fourth month of the Tibetan calendar to the middle of the seventh month of the Tibetan calendar; and the later period, which is the four months from the middle of the seventh month to the middle of the tenth month of the Tibetan calendar.

original: dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed las 'das par dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'chang na dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed las 'das par dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'chang na dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk who has undertaken the rainy season practice either before or after the proper time, depending on which period he has chosen, seeks rainy season robes before the proper time, which is one month before the rainy season, or if he keeps the rainy season robes for more than a half month after the end of the rainy season, he commits the actual downfall of the rainy season robes.

original: dge slong la dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba'i ltung byed byung na /🔽de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba'i ltung byed byung na / de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a fully ordained monk acquires a large rain cloak that is subject to relinquishment due to a downfall,🔽but he neither relinquishes it nor separates from it, nor confesses the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: or he relinquishes it but does not separate from it, nor confesses the downfall,🔽or he relinquishes it and separates from it, but does not confess the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par byar gyi ras chen du gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed da ni yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par byar gyi ras chen du gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed da ni yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: and then acquires another large rain cloak that is subject to relinquishment,

original: des lhung ba ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des lhung ba ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he does not commit a downfall.

original: dge slong gis dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
analyzed: dge slong gis dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
translated: If a fully ordained monk acquires a large rain cloak that is subject to relinquishment due to a downfall,

original: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par /
analyzed: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par /
translated: as long as he does not confess the downfall to the relinquishing object,🔽or to a monk, or to a nun,🔽or to a male or female novice,

original: lhung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba 'am phor bu 'am ska rags sam /
analyzed: lhung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba 'am phor bu 'am ska rags sam /
translated: or to a male or female lay practitioner,🔽or to a person who is not fully ordained,🔽he does not commit a downfall.

original: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan zhig nye bar 'jog par byed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan zhig nye bar 'jog par byed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one keeps any other requisite of a renunciate, that is also relinquished by the power of the former rule.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But one does not commit an infraction.

original: bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyid mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang pho phan chad du btsal te grub ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyid mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang pho phan chad du btsal te grub ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in seeking and obtaining a substitute for the lower robe of the rainy season retreat before the end of the previous retreat.

original: bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla ba phyed kyi mtha' las 'das par 'char pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla ba phyed kyi mtha' las 'das par 'char pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in wearing the lower robe beyond the last day of the rainy season retreat.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen rung ba dang tshad dang ldan pa la sogs pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen rung ba dang tshad dang ldan pa la sogs pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in wearing the rainy season robe that is suitable and has the right measurements.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i zla ba gcig gi sngon rol du tshol ba dang / dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu zla ba phyed las 'das par 'chang ba dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i zla ba gcig gi sngon rol du tshol ba dang / dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu zla ba phyed las 'das par 'chang ba dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is one who seeks the lower robe before the month of the rainy season retreat, one who keeps it beyond the last day of the rainy season retreat, and one who wears the rainy season robe that is suitable.

original: 'di la tshol ba dang 'chang ba'i dus gnyi ga la yang yan lag gsum gsum gyis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la tshol ba dang 'chang ba'i dus gnyi ga la yang yan lag gsum gsum gyis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this case, there are three branches for the actual basis of a downfall in both the time of seeking and the time of keeping.

original: dbyar gnas par khas len @13b pa'i zla ba cig gi sngon rol gyi dus dang / der btsal te grub pa dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid dang / dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og rol gyi zla ba phyed kyi dus dang / de las 'das par 'chang ba dang /
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas len @13b pa'i zla ba cig gi sngon rol gyi dus dang / der btsal te grub pa dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid dang / dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og rol gyi zla ba phyed kyi dus dang / de las 'das par 'chang ba dang /
translated: The time prior to one month before the summer retreat, the time of seeking and obtaining it, the time of the proper great cloth for the summer retreat, the time after the lifting of the restrictions, and the time of keeping it beyond that.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do //🔽de la dbyar gnas par khas len pa'i zla ba gcig gi sngon rol gyi dus zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma'i ni dbyar zla ra ba tshes bcu drug phan chad do //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do // de la dbyar gnas par khas len pa'i zla ba gcig gi sngon rol gyi dus zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma'i ni dbyar zla ra ba tshes bcu drug phan chad do //
translated: The proper great cloth for the summer retreat.🔽The time prior to one month before the summer retreat is the time after the sixteenth day of the first summer month for those who have already taken the summer retreat.

original: dbyar gnas pa phyi ma'i ni dbyar zla 'bring po tshas bcu drug phan chad do //
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa phyi ma'i ni dbyar zla 'bring po tshas bcu drug phan chad do //
translated: It is the time after the sixteenth day of the middle summer month for those who have not yet taken the summer retreat.

original: dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og rol gyi zla ba phyed kyi dus zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma'i ni ston zla tha chungs tshes gcig tshun chad do //
analyzed: dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og rol gyi zla ba phyed kyi dus zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma'i ni ston zla tha chungs tshes gcig tshun chad do //
translated: The time of the half month after the end of the retreat is the first day of the last autumn month for those who have taken the vow of the earlier retreat.

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma'i ni dgun zla ra ba'i tshes gcig tshun chad do //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma'i ni dgun zla ra ba'i tshes gcig tshun chad do //
translated: It is the first day of the first winter month for those who have taken the vow of the later retreat.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If the retreat is incomplete, it is defective in the appropriate way.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall through transgression is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du dbyar gyis gos ras chen spang pa'i lhung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du dbyar gyis gos ras chen spang pa'i lhung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of abandoning the rainy season retreat cloth, but has not yet reached the actual downfall, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re de la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re de la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each preparation for the actual downfall that is begun, there is a minor infraction.🔽The mere search for the cloth before the retreat is a minor infraction.

original: sngar tshol ba'i tsho tshol ba tsam la nyes byas so / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rnying pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: sngar tshol ba'i tsho tshol ba tsam la nyes byas so / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rnying pa la nyes byas so //
translated: The old rainy season retreat cloth is a minor infraction.

original: mi rung ba dang tshad las chung ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi rung ba dang tshad las chung ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is unsuitable or less than the right size, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of wrong conduct in the preparatory stage is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many as there are preparatory stages, there are that many preparatory stages of the preparatory stages.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparatory stage of a minor offense is also a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po'i yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po'i yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The first mental intention is the minor offense of the preparatory stage of the preparatory stage.

original: de nas lus dang dag gi sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang dag gi sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the preparatory stage of the body and speech is the actual minor offense of the preparatory stage.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the final stage is the actual offense of wrongdoing.

original: lhung ba med pa ni sngon du dang phyi ma gnyis las de ma yin pa'i dus gnyis su mi tshol ba dang mi 'chang ba la lhung ba med do //
analyzed: lhung ba med pa ni sngon du dang phyi ma gnyis las de ma yin pa'i dus gnyis su mi tshol ba dang mi 'chang ba la lhung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not search for or keep the robes during the two periods other than the first and the last.

original: bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang po tshun chad nas tshol ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang po tshun chad nas tshol ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has already accepted a residence and is seeking the rainy-season robe before the first day of the first month of the rainy season.

original: bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla ba phyed kyi mtha'i bar du 'chang ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla ba phyed kyi mtha'i bar du 'chang ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has already kept the rainy-season robe for the first half of the last month of the rainy season.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //🔽bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas @14a * //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do // bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas @14a * //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner; if he is insane; if he is the first offender; if he is sick; or if he is seeking a rainy-season robe for someone else.🔽The training rule on the rainy-season robe is finished.

original: skabs thams cad du dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //🔽bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang po tshun chad nas dbyar gyi ras chen btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: skabs thams cad du dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o // bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang po tshun chad nas dbyar gyi ras chen btsal bar bya'o //
translated: The monks should not, in any way, not use the rainy-season robe, which is a privilege, in any place, at any time.🔽The monks should seek the rainy-season robe before the first day of the first month of the rainy season, the month in which they have accepted a residence.

original: bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla ba phyed kyi mtha'i bar du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla ba phyed kyi mtha'i bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The monks should keep the rainy-season robe for the first half of the last month of the rainy season.

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bya ba thams cad ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma 'am /
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bya ba thams cad ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma 'am /
translated: All the actions that follow the promise to remain in retreat during the rainy season are the same as the previous promise to remain in retreat during the rainy season.🔽

original: phyi ma ji lta ba bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: phyi ma ji lta ba bzhin du bya ste /
translated: All actions that follow the promise to remain in retreat during the rainy season should be performed in accordance with the earlier or later promise to remain in retreat.

original: dper na mtha'i zhag bcu la brtad pa las byung ba'i gos blang ngo zhes gsungs pa ni bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi mtha'i zhag bcu gang yin pa la bya ste /🔽ston zla 'bring po tshes lnga nas nya'i par gyi zhag bcu 'am /
analyzed: dper na mtha'i zhag bcu la brtad pa las byung ba'i gos blang ngo zhes gsungs pa ni bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi mtha'i zhag bcu gang yin pa la bya ste / ston zla 'bring po tshes lnga nas nya'i par gyi zhag bcu 'am /
translated: For example, the statement, “One should accept robes that arise from the ten days at the end of the rainy season” refers to the ten days at the end of one’s own rainy season.🔽The ten days at the end of the rainy season are from the fifth day of the middle autumn month until the full moon of the middle autumn month or from the first day of the last autumn month until the full moon of the last autumn month.

original: ston zla tha chungs ches ldan nas nya'i bar zhag bcu la bya ba lta bu dang / dbyar gyi ras chen yang bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi tshad la ltos nas btsal ba dang / bcang bar bya ba lta bu dang / dgag dbye yang bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi tshad la ltos nas /🔽ston zla 'bring po nya 'am /
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs ches ldan nas nya'i bar zhag bcu la bya ba lta bu dang / dbyar gyi ras chen yang bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi tshad la ltos nas btsal ba dang / bcang bar bya ba lta bu dang / dgag dbye yang bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi tshad la ltos nas / ston zla 'bring po nya 'am /
translated: The great robe of the rainy season should be sought and worn in dependence on the measure of one’s own rainy season.🔽The lifting of restrictions should be performed in dependence on the measure of one’s own rainy season.

original: ston zla tha chungs nyal bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs nyal bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: The lifting of restrictions is performed on the full moon of the middle autumn month or on the full moon of the last autumn month.

original: sras brkyang ba ting ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa zla ba snga ma shos dang 'brel pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sras brkyang ba ting ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa zla ba snga ma shos dang 'brel pa kho na yin no //
translated: The extension of the rainy season retreat is connected only with the earlier month of the rainy season retreat.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spangs ba ste nyi shu brgyad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spangs ba ste nyi shu brgyad pa bshad zin to /
translated: This completes the explanation of the twenty-eighth downfall: the rejection of the great rainy season retreat robe.

original: // / so sor thar ba'i mdo rgya cher 'grel ba 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar ba'i mdo rgya cher 'grel ba 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Compendium of Determinations, a commentary on the monastic code,

original: bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: The twenty-eighth chapter on the downfall of rejecting the great rainy season retreat robe.

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang bcas pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang bcas pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The origin story for the downfall of changing the dedication is twofold:

original: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya rnams kyi grong rdal wa tshongs can zhes bya ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya rnams kyi grong rdal wa tshongs can zhes bya ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Śākya town of Kapilavastu.

original: de'i tshe na khyim bdag gcig gis rang gi dad pa dang / rang gis btsugs pa dang rang gi dang bcas gtsug lag khang byed du bcug nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na khyim bdag gcig gis rang gi dad pa dang / rang gis btsugs pa dang rang gi dang bcas gtsug lag khang byed du bcug nas /
translated: At that time a certain householder had a temple built out of his own faith, out of his own conviction, and out of his own generosity.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin la gang zag gir phul lo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin la gang zag gir phul lo //
translated: He offered it to the venerable Rāhula.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa pa sgra gcan zin gtsug lag khang der ji tsam pa de tsam 'dug nas lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te ljongs rgyur song ngo //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa pa sgra gcan zin gtsug lag khang der ji tsam pa de tsam 'dug nas lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te ljongs rgyur song ngo //
translated: Then the venerable Rāhula stayed in that monastery as long as he liked, took his bowl and robe, and set out on a wandering tour of the countryside.

original: khyim bdag des 'phags pa sgra gcan zin gtsug lag khang der ji tsam pa de tsam 'dug nas lhung bzad dang chos gos thogs te ljongs rgyur song zhes thos te /
analyzed: khyim bdag des 'phags pa sgra gcan zin gtsug lag khang der ji tsam pa de tsam 'dug nas lhung bzad dang chos gos thogs te ljongs rgyur song zhes thos te /
translated: The householder heard that the venerable Rāhula had stayed in that monastery as long as he liked, taken his bowl and robe, and set out on a wandering tour of the countryside.

original: @14b thos nas kyang khyim bdag des gtsug lag khang de dge 'dun la phul lo //
analyzed: @14b thos nas kyang khyim bdag des gtsug lag khang de dge 'dun la phul lo //
translated: Having heard that, the householder offered that monastery to the Saṅgha.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin ji dkar ljongs su 'dug nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin ji dkar ljongs su 'dug nas /
translated: Then the venerable Rāhula stayed in the country of Kāṣi as long as he liked,

original: phyir 'ongs nas de thos nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
analyzed: phyir 'ongs nas de thos nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
translated: and then returned. Having heard that, he asked the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa de la bdag gis ji ltar bgyi /
analyzed: btsun pa de la bdag gis ji ltar bgyi /
translated: “Lord, what should I do about that?”

original: bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Rāhula,

original: sgra gcan zin tshang shog khyod khyim bdag de ga la ba der song la phyin nas phyin bdag de la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: sgra gcan zin tshang shog khyod khyim bdag de ga la ba der song la phyin nas phyin bdag de la 'di skad ces /
translated: Rāhula, go to that householder and say to him, 🔽Householder, do you not criticize my body or speech in the least?

original: khyim bdag khyod kho bo'i lus sam dang la chung zad kyang smod par mi byed dam zhes smros shig / tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin gyis khyim bdag de la de skad ces smras ba na /
analyzed: khyim bdag khyod kho bo'i lus sam dang la chung zad kyang smod par mi byed dam zhes smros shig / tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin gyis khyim bdag de la de skad ces smras ba na /
translated: When the Venerable Rāhula said this to the householder,

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: he replied,

original: 'phags pa sgra gcan zin bdag khyod kyi sku 'am gsung la cung zad kyang smod par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa sgra gcan zin bdag khyod kyi sku 'am gsung la cung zad kyang smod par mi bgyid do //
translated: Noble Rāhula, I do not criticize your body or speech in the least.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin gyis khyim bdag de de skad ces zer ba bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin gyis khyim bdag de de skad ces zer ba bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: Then the Venerable Rāhula told the Blessed One what the householder had said.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Ānanda,🔽Ānanda, go to that householder and say to him,

original: kun dga' bo song la dge slong ji snyed wa tshongs can na nye bar brten cing 'khod pa de dag thams cad dpong sa'i khang par sdus shig / tshe dag ldan pa kun dga' bos de dag der bsdus te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo song la dge slong ji snyed wa tshongs can na nye bar brten cing 'khod pa de dag thams cad dpong sa'i khang par sdus shig / tshe dag ldan pa kun dga' bos de dag der bsdus te /
translated: Go, Ananda, and assemble all the monks who live in dependence on Rajagrha in the assembly hall.🔽 When the Venerable Ananda had assembled all the monks who lived in dependence on Rajagrha in the assembly hall,

original: bcom ldan 'das la mkhyen par gsol ba dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das dpong sa'i khang pa gal ba der gshegs te byon nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mkhyen par gsol ba dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das dpong sa'i khang pa gal ba der gshegs te byon nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
translated: he reported to the Blessed One, Blessed One, all the monks who live in dependence on Rajagrha have assembled in the assembly hall.

original: bshugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa dge slong dag gang gis gang zag gcig gam /
analyzed: bshugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa dge slong dag gang gis gang zag gcig gam /
translated: When they had assembled, the Blessed One asked them, Monks, who among you has been giving gifts to the Sangha of the four directions?

original: gnyis sam rab tu mang po 'am dge 'dun la sbyin ba byin na gzhan gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po 'am dge 'dun la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa ni chos dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gnyis sam rab tu mang po 'am dge 'dun la sbyin ba byin na gzhan gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po 'am dge 'dun la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa ni chos dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The Blessed One said, Monks, if one, two, or many people give gifts to the Sangha of one, two, or many people, it is not a Dharma-based gift.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i len pa ma yin la /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i len pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not a gift in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yongs su longs spyad du rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyad du rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable to be enjoyed.

original: dge slong dag gang gis dge 'dun bye zhing gnyis su gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang gis dge 'dun bye zhing gnyis su gyur te /
translated: Monks, when the Saṅgha is divided and becomes two factions,

original: phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa na /
analyzed: phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa na /
translated: and they remain in opposing positions,

original: phyogs gcig la sbyin par byin nas phyogs gnyis pa la sbyin bar byed pa ni chos dang ldan ba'i sbyin ba ma yin zhir /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la sbyin par byin nas phyogs gnyis pa la sbyin bar byed pa ni chos dang ldan ba'i sbyin ba ma yin zhir /
translated: if one gives to one faction and does not give to the other faction, that is not a gift in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i len pa ma yin la /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i len pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not a gift in accordance with the Dharma.

original: longs snyad du rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: longs snyad du rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable to be enjoyed.

analyzed: dge slong dag gang gis gang zag gcig la sbyin pa byin nas gzhan gcig gam @15a * //

analyzed: gnyis sam rab tu mang po'am / dge 'dun la sbyin par mi byed pa ni chos dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa yin zhing /
translated: or to two, or to many,🔽or to the Saṅgha, that is a gift in accordance with the Dharma.

analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i len pa yin la yongs su longs spyad du rung ba yin no //

analyzed: longs spyad du rung ba yin no //

analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni sbyin pa yin la phyi ma ni ma yin no /
translated: Monks, therefore, the former is a gift, but the latter is not.

analyzed: rgyal po ni sa gzhi la dbang la /
translated: The king has power over the land.

analyzed: bdag po ni gnas mal la dbang /

analyzed: dge slong ni ltung bzed dang chos gos la dbang ngo //

translated: The monks said to the venerable Rāhula, Give back the monastery.🔽The monks said to the venerable R

original: rdzas las 'byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun po dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang ; khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod la spyan drang zhing ras zung gcig yon du dbul bar bsngos pa nye dag thos nas /
analyzed: rdzas las 'byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun po dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang ; khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod la spyan drang zhing ras zung gcig yon du dbul bar bsngos pa nye dag thos nas /
translated: The householder had invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to a meal and had set aside a pair of garments as a gift.

original: der rang la bsgyur du bcug ste /
analyzed: der rang la bsgyur du bcug ste /
translated: He had them given to Upasena.

original: de'i 'og tu khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rang gi khyim du mchod ston gsol nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rang gi khyim du mchod ston gsol nas /
translated: Later, the householder served a feast in his own home for the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks.

original: ras zung de rgan pa'i mtha' logs su bstan te /
analyzed: ras zung de rgan pa'i mtha' logs su bstan te /
translated: He presented the pair of garments to the seniormost monk,

original: rjes su yi rang bar mdzod cig / rjes su yi rang bar mdzod cig ces smras nas /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar mdzod cig / rjes su yi rang bar mdzod cig ces smras nas /
translated: saying, “Rejoice in this! Rejoice in this!”

original: nye dga' la byin pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin @15b du gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'jug ces smod par byed /
analyzed: nye dga' la byin pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin @15b du gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'jug ces smod par byed /
translated: When he gave them to Upasena, the monks who had few desires complained, “Why do the monks make the saṅgha’s gains their own?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized and complained and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: nye dga' la rnams nas /
analyzed: nye dga' la rnams nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this as the basis, with this as the reason, with this as the situation, assembled the community of monks and said to the monks,🔽“Monks, the monk Upāli

original: rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: has been criticized by me in many ways.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bye ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bye ste /
translated: Seeing the ten advantages of laying down a rule of training for my disciples, I lay down this rule of training for the monks:

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk, knowing that something belongs to the community, makes it over to himself, that is a pāyattika offense.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person was Upāli.

original: nyon mongs pa ni brnab sems /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni brnab sems /
translated: The affliction was covetousness.

original: nyes pa ni gzhan gyis gzhan la bsngos pa'i gos gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gzhan gyis gzhan la bsngos pa'i gos gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'dug pa'o //
translated: The offense is that a monk causes a robe that has been dedicated to the Sangha to be given to himself.

original: de las yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
analyzed: de las yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
translated: “Monks” means the Śākya son Nandaka,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: or anyone else like him.

original: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la'o //
translated: “The Sangha” means the Sangha of the Tathāgata’s disciples.

original: bsngos pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzas pa'i 'o //
analyzed: bsngos pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzas pa'i 'o //
translated: “Dedicated” means promised.

original: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa gnyis te /
translated: “Gain” means there are two kinds of gain:

original: gos kyi rnyed pa dang / zas kyi rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa dang / zas kyi rnyed pa ste /
translated: gain of robes and gain of food.

original: don 'di ni gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'di ni gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning here is gain of robes.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis de shes par gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis de shes par gyur pa 'am /
translated: “Deliberately” means that he himself knows it or

original: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: that others tell him.

original: gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la 'bul du 'jug na'o //
analyzed: gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la 'bul du 'jug na'o //
translated: “Causes it to be given to himself” means he causes it to be given to himself.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: A “transgression that requires relinquishment” is a downfall that requires confession after relinquishing the object.

original: des na spang pa'i lhung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na spang pa'i lhung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a “transgression that requires relinquishment.”

original: de la lhung ba ji lta 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la lhung ba ji lta 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas lhung ba rnams par gzhag pa dang / lhung ba med pa dang / bslab byar bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas lhung ba rnams par gzhag pa dang / lhung ba med pa dang / bslab byar bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this class of downfalls by means of the basic transgression, the preparatory stage, the actual act, and the conclusion, as well as by means of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the training rules, and the means of purification.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i ni dge slong gis yon bdag gzhan gyis gang zag dge slong gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i gos kyi rnyed pa shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na /🔽bsngos pa @16a * //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i ni dge slong gis yon bdag gzhan gyis gang zag dge slong gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i gos kyi rnyed pa shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na / bsngos pa @16a * //
translated: The basic transgression is as follows: If a fully ordained monk knowingly takes for himself a piece of cloth that has been offered to another fully ordained monk or to the community,

original: las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then he commits a basic downfall of a transgression that requires relinquishment.

original: dge slong la bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la de ma spang shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la de ma spang shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a monk has committed a downfall that requires forfeiture and has not yet relinquished the object, has not made it disappear, and has not confessed the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: or if he has relinquished the object but has not made it disappear and has not confessed the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par bsngos pa las bsgyur bar gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par bsngos pa las bsgyur bar gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: or if he has relinquished the object and made it disappear but has not confessed the downfall, and then obtains another object that is similar to the one he had dedicated for the benefit of the saṅgha, that object too becomes subject to the same forfeiture.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis bsngos pa las /
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro // dge slong gis bsngos pa las /
translated: However, he does not incur a downfall.

original: bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /🔽ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par ltung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba 'am phor bu 'am skar gas sam /
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la / ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par ltung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba 'am phor bu 'am skar gas sam /
translated: If a monk has committed a downfall that requires forfeiture and🔽has not yet relinquished the object,

original: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i go byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i go byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog par byed na /
translated: as long as he does not confess the downfall to anyone, he may keep the begging bowl, the Dharma robes, the sitting mat, the water strainer, the razor, or any other requisite of a renunciate.

original: de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it is abandoned by the force of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not become a downfall from that.

original: yon bdag gzhan nye du ma yin pa khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba mtshan dang lta ba mthun pa dang mi mthun pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: yon bdag gzhan nye du ma yin pa khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba mtshan dang lta ba mthun pa dang mi mthun pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in giving to another patron who is not a relative, whether a layperson or a renunciate, whether of the same gender or not.

original: gang zag gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in giving to another person or to the Saṅgha.

original: gos kyi rnyed pa rung ba nyid dang / tshad dang ldan pa dang ; tshad pas lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa rung ba nyid dang / tshad dang ldan pa dang ; tshad pas lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in giving a suitable amount of cloth, or a full amount, or more than a full amount.

original: der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one perceives it as belonging to someone else, or if one is unsure of it.

original: bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one takes it after having it transferred to oneself.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni gzhan gyis gzhan la bsngos pa'i gos kyi rnyed pa dang de shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni gzhan gyis gzhan la bsngos pa'i gos kyi rnyed pa dang de shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob pa'o //
translated: The agent of this is one who, knowing that the cloth has been dedicated to another, takes it after having it transferred to oneself.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the actual basis is a downfall through five limbs.

original: yon bdag gzhan gang yang rung ba dang / gang zag dge slong gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos pa dang / gos kyi rnyed pa dang / shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur ba dang thob pa'o //
analyzed: yon bdag gzhan gang yang rung ba dang / gang zag dge slong gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos pa dang / gos kyi rnyed pa dang / shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur ba dang thob pa'o //
translated: and knowingly changing it to oneself.

original: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these is incomplete, then the downfall is a serious transgression.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du bsngos pa la bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas /
analyzed: ji srid du bsngos pa la bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas /
translated: As long as one has not begun the activity of the downfall of forsaking the gift,

original: dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: but has merely begun the activity of changing it to oneself, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each separate activity that one engages in up to the point of the actual downfall, there is a minor offense.

original: sgyur ba la nyes byas so //🔽gang zag gzhan li @16b bsngos pa gang zag gzhan la bsgyur bal nyes byas so //
analyzed: sgyur ba la nyes byas so // gang zag gzhan li @16b bsngos pa gang zag gzhan la bsgyur bal nyes byas so //
translated: Changing it to oneself is a minor offense.🔽Changing to another person what has been dedicated to another person is a minor offense.

original: gang zag gzhan la bsngos pa gang zag gzhan la bskyur ba thob pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan la bsngos pa gang zag gzhan la bskyur ba thob pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: Changing to another person what has been dedicated to oneself is a minor offense.

original: zas gyi rnyed pa la bsgyur ba dang thob pa gnyi ga la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas gyi rnyed pa la bsgyur ba dang thob pa gnyi ga la yang nyes byas so //
translated: There is also a fault in both the transformation and the acquisition of food.

original: dbral ba dang sbyar ba gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba nyid ma yin pa gnas khang la sogs pa bdag la bsgyur ba dang thob pa gnyi ga la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dbral ba dang sbyar ba gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba nyid ma yin pa gnas khang la sogs pa bdag la bsgyur ba dang thob pa gnyi ga la nyes byas so //
translated: There is a fault in both the transformation and the acquisition of a dwelling place, etc. that are not counted as sentient beings.

original: them skas dang khang pa dang sgo la sogs pa'i phyogs gcig la bsngos pa phyogs gcig la bsgyur ba dang thob pa gnyi ga la nyes byas so //
analyzed: them skas dang khang pa dang sgo la sogs pa'i phyogs gcig la bsngos pa phyogs gcig la bsgyur ba dang thob pa gnyi ga la nyes byas so //
translated: There is a fault in both the transformation and the acquisition of a part of a staircase, house, door, etc.

original: bsngos pa ma byin na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsngos pa ma byin na nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not dedicated, there is an offense.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
translated: If one goes outside the boundary

original: dge 'dun gyi shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa'i rnyed pa byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa'i rnyed pa byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so //
translated: and consecrates the acquisition of the Saṅgha’s property of the deceased, etc., there is an offense.

original: rnyed pa dbang ba'i gang zag ma tshogs pa dag gis 'god na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rnyed pa dbang ba'i gang zag ma tshogs pa dag gis 'god na nyes byas so //
translated: If the acquisition is not distributed by those who have the right to distribute it, there is an offense.

original: shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa'i rnyed pa byin gyis ma brlabs par 'god na nyes byas so //
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa'i rnyed pa byin gyis ma brlabs par 'god na nyes byas so //
translated: If the acquisition of the property of the deceased, etc. is not consecrated and is distributed, there is an offense.

original: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa dge 'dun las gcig gam gnyis sam gsum gyis rku sems med phar len pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa dge 'dun las gcig gam gnyis sam gsum gyis rku sems med phar len pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one or two or three take it from the Saṅgha without a thought of stealing, it is a wrong action.

original: rung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi dngos po dga' nyes byas so //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi dngos po dga' nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not suitable, it is a wrong action.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: A downfall through performance is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: A downfall through performance is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed do //
translated: As many as there are performances, there are that many performances of the performance.

original: sbyor ba nyos byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyos byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The performance of the performance of a purchase is a minor offense, a minor downfall through performance.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, the first mental intention is the minor downfall through performance of the performance.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the performance by body and speech is the actual downfall through performance.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the final step is the actual root downfall of a downfall of abandonment.

original: ltung ba med pa ni der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is unconscious.🔽There is no offense if one searches for the food of animals, etc., but does not find any.

original: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa btsal te ma rnyed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa btsal te ma rnyed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one borrows the image of the Sugata in order to give it to another, but then does not return it to the other.🔽There is no offense if one does not give back to the stūpa the property that belongs to the stūpa and that one has used, if one is unable to return it to the stūpa, and if one has not committed any offense.🔽There is no offense if one does not give back to the stūpa the property that belongs to the stūpa and that one has used, if one has given it to another stūpa.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku gzugs gzhan mda' ba'i rgyan la sogs pa dag gal te sku gzugs gzhan la g-yar por sbyin par byed pa la nyes pa med do ;
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku gzugs gzhan mda' ba'i rgyan la sogs pa dag gal te sku gzugs gzhan la g-yar por sbyin par byed pa la nyes pa med do ;
translated: There is no offense if one does not give back to the stūpa the property that belongs to the stūpa and that one has used, if one has given it to the Saṅgha.🔽There is no offense if one does not give back to the stūpa the property that belongs to the stūpa and that one has used, if one has given it to the Saṅgha and the stūpa.🔽There is no offense if one does not give back to the Saṅgha the property that belongs to the Saṅgha and that one has used, if one has given it to the stūpa.🔽There is no offense if one does not give back to the Saṅgha the property that belongs to the Saṅgha and that one has used, if one has given it to the stūpa and the Saṅgha.

original: / mchod rten byang chub chen po dang chos kyi 'khor lo dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang / lha las babs pa rnam ma gtogs par gzhan la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa de nyid la dbul bar ma grub cing der khyer yang mi nus na mchod rten gzhan dag la bsgyur pa la nyes pa med do //🔽byang chub chen po dang / @17a * //
analyzed: / mchod rten byang chub chen po dang chos kyi 'khor lo dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang / lha las babs pa rnam ma gtogs par gzhan la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa de nyid la dbul bar ma grub cing der khyer yang mi nus na mchod rten gzhan dag la bsgyur pa la nyes pa med do // byang chub chen po dang / @17a * //
translated: There is no offense if one does not give back to the stūpa and the Saṅgha the property that belongs to the stūpa and the Saṅgha and that one has used, if one has given it to the Saṅgha.🔽There is no offense if one does not give back to the stūpa and the Saṅgha the property that belongs to the stūpa and the Saṅgha and that one has used, if one has given it to the stūpa.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo dang de /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo dang de /
translated: There is no offense if one does not give back to the stūpa and the Saṅgha the property that belongs to the stūpa and the Saṅgha and that one has used, if one has given it to the stūpa and the Saṅgha.

original: cho 'phrul chen po dang / lha las babs pa rnams kyi rgyud du mnga' ba rnams kyi rnyed pa ni mchod rten gzhan dag la bsgyur du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: cho 'phrul chen po dang / lha las babs pa rnams kyi rgyud du mnga' ba rnams kyi rnyed pa ni mchod rten gzhan dag la bsgyur du mi rung ngo //
translated: The offerings made to the stūpas of the Buddha’s hair and nail relics, and to the stūpas of the Buddha’s robes, begging bowl, and the great miracles, and to the stūpas of the Buddha’s descent from the gods, are not to be transferred to other stūpas.

original: mchod rten chen po bzhi po de dag gi nang nas gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa de nyid la dbul bar ma grub cing der khyer yang mi nus na gzhan gsum po gang yang rung ba la bsgyur ba la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mchod rten chen po bzhi po de dag gi nang nas gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa de nyid la dbul bar ma grub cing der khyer yang mi nus na gzhan gsum po gang yang rung ba la bsgyur ba la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is not possible to offer the offerings made to one of the four great stūpas to that very stūpa, and if it is not possible to take them to that stūpa, then there is no fault in transferring them to any of the other three.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or if one is insane, or if one’s mind is disturbed, or if one is suffering from pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong rnams kyis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du smos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong rnams kyis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du smos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that monks should train by not using in any way the things that are to be relinquished through confession, which are mentioned in all the countries and in all the circumstances.

original: gnas gang na dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas pa der sbyin bdag gis dge 'dun gyi phyir rnyed ba 'bul bar byed na /
analyzed: gnas gang na dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas pa der sbyin bdag gis dge 'dun gyi phyir rnyed ba 'bul bar byed na /
translated: If a donor offers a gift to the saṅgha in a place where there is only one monk,

original: dge slong des gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: that monk should consecrate the gift.

original: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa med par gya tshom du gtsug lag khang dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa med par gya tshom du gtsug lag khang dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abandon a monastery thoughtlessly, without any danger from enemies, thieves, and so on.

original: dge slong gang gtsug lag khang de la rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa der srung ma gzhag go //
analyzed: dge slong gang gtsug lag khang de la rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa der srung ma gzhag go //
translated: If a monk is attached to that monastery, he should appoint someone to guard it.

original: der dge 'dun ma lhags na dge slong srung ma bzhag pa des gtsug lag khang de nyid du lo bcu 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: der dge 'dun ma lhags na dge slong srung ma bzhag pa des gtsug lag khang de nyid du lo bcu 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: If the saṅgha does not come, the monk who has been appointed to guard it should stay in that monastery for ten years.

original: dge slong de lo bcur de na gnas pa'i tshe lo lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong de lo bcur de na gnas pa'i tshe lo lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: While that monk is staying there for ten years, he should spend five years in alms-gathering.

original: der dus su sbyin bdag ma byung na lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig tu 'tsho ba thun mod du bya bas 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: der dus su sbyin bdag ma byung na lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig tu 'tsho ba thun mod du bya bas 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: If no patron appears at the right time, he should spend the next five years living together with the monks of a nearby monastery.

original: dge slong de gal te gtsug lag khang de nas 'gro na dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dag tu gdams par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong de gal te gtsug lag khang de nas 'gro na dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dag tu gdams par bya'o //
translated: If that monk leaves that monastery, he should entrust his belongings to the monks of a nearby monastery.

original: gtsug lag khang bor ba der dge slong dag lhags te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang bor ba der dge slong dag lhags te /
translated: Monks may come to that abandoned monastery.

original: gnyug mar gnas na nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang gzhan na gnas pa'i dge slong de dag dis gnas ma la dang snod spyad la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag gtsug lag de nyid du phyir sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas na nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang gzhan na gnas pa'i dge slong de dag dis gnas ma la dang snod spyad la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag gtsug lag de nyid du phyir sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If they are resident monks, they should return the belongings of the former monks, such as their dwelling place and their vessels, to that monastery.

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gdams pa'i rdzas de dag gtsug lag khang de kho nar mi snang zhing phyir mi steng na dge slong gang dag gis dang po der gzhag pa de dag gis rma zhing phyir sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gdams pa'i rdzas de dag gtsug lag khang de kho nar mi snang zhing phyir mi steng na dge slong gang dag gis dang po der gzhag pa de dag gis rma zhing phyir sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The articles that were designated for one monastery do not appear in that monastery, and are not given out elsewhere. The monks who first put them aside should make amends for them and give them up.

original: khyim @17b bdag de nyid gtsug lag khang de dang gnas gzhan gyi bdag po nyid yin yang des sngar gtsug lag khang der phul ba'i rdzas dag phyis gnas /🔽gzhan der bsgyur zhing dbul du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khyim @17b bdag de nyid gtsug lag khang de dang gnas gzhan gyi bdag po nyid yin yang des sngar gtsug lag khang der phul ba'i rdzas dag phyis gnas / gzhan der bsgyur zhing dbul du mi rung ngo //
translated: Even if that very householder is the owner of that monastery and another place, he cannot later transfer the articles that he previously offered to that monastery to another place.

original: khyim bdag des rdzas de dag sngar phul ba'i gtsug lag khang der mi ster na gtsug lag khang de na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyi mthus gzung bar bya'o //🔽gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gzhan du g-yar po nyid du ni sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag des rdzas de dag sngar phul ba'i gtsug lag khang der mi ster na gtsug lag khang de na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyi mthus gzung bar bya'o // gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gzhan du g-yar po nyid du ni sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If that householder does not give those articles to that monastery where they were first offered, the monks who live in that monastery should take them by the power of their status.🔽The articles of one monastery should not be given out as loans to another monastery.

original: gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gnas gzhan du sbyin par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gnas gzhan du sbyin par mi bya ste /
translated: The articles of one monastery should not be given to another monastery.

original: rnyed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji ltar nges par byas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji ltar nges par byas pa bzhin no //
translated: The presentation of the acquisition is as it is ascertained.

original: de dag gi skabs dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las gnas gang na dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas pa der sbyin bdag gis dge 'dun gyi phyir rnyed pas dbul bar byed na dge slong des gcig bus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi skabs dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las gnas gang na dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas pa der sbyin bdag gis dge 'dun gyi phyir rnyed pas dbul bar byed na dge slong des gcig bus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: In the context of those, in the Questions of the Son of a Brahmin Sūtra it says: “In whatever place a single monk resides, if a donor offers acquisition for the sake of the saṅgha, that single monk should consecrate the acquisition.🔽If he appropriates it without consecrating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: byin gyis ma brlabs par bdag gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa la gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs par bdag gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa la gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The rite and mantra for a single monk to consecrate acquisition is as follows:

original: bdag gnas 'di na gcig pu gnas te /
analyzed: bdag gnas 'di na gcig pu gnas te /
translated: “I, who am alone in this place,

original: dge 'dun la gos kyi rnyed pa 'di byung bas bdag gis gos 'di nyams su blang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun la gos kyi rnyed pa 'di byung bas bdag gis gos 'di nyams su blang ngo //
translated: have this acquisition of cloth for the saṅgha. I will use this cloth.🔽I consecrate it at the proper time.”

original: dus su byin gyis brlab po zhes lan gsum sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dus su byin gyis brlab po zhes lan gsum sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should generate this thought three times and also say it in words.

original: de nyid kyi skabs dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam /
analyzed: de nyid kyi skabs dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam /
translated: The Sutra Requested by the Monk Subahu states:

original: bcings sam / shi 'am spyugs na /
analyzed: bcings sam / shi 'am spyugs na /
translated: If the owner of a temple is killed, bound, dies or is exiled,🔽then monks should not abandon that temple.

original: dge slong dag gis gtsug lag khang de yal bar mi 'dor bar dge slong gang gtsug lag khang de la rjes su chags pa shas chen po yod pa der srung ma gzhag cing der dge 'dun dang / sbyin bdag dus sum lhags na dge slong des lo lnga ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag gis gtsug lag khang de yal bar mi 'dor bar dge slong gang gtsug lag khang de la rjes su chags pa shas chen po yod pa der srung ma gzhag cing der dge 'dun dang / sbyin bdag dus sum lhags na dge slong des lo lnga ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk has a strong attachment to that temple, then he should appoint a caretaker. If the Saṅgha and benefactors come there at the three times, then that monk should spend five years there for the sake of alms.

original: lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig 'tsho ba thun ming du bya bas 'da' bar bya zhing /
analyzed: lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig 'tsho ba thun ming du bya bas 'da' bar bya zhing /
translated: He should spend another five years there living together with the monks of the surrounding temples.

original: gtsug lag khang de dang nyed 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang de gnyis rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad pa'i las bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de dang nyed 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang de gnyis rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad pa'i las bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The property of that temple and the surrounding temples is shared in common, but the ceremony of poṣadha is performed separately.

original: des gnas mal bshams pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad @18a * //
analyzed: des gnas mal bshams pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad @18a * //
translated: Having prepared the seats, having rung the gong, having announced to the monks with a statement of the reason,

original: 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //🔽'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o // 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: when the entire Saṅgha is seated and has reached agreement, a monk should make a proposal and perform the procedure.🔽It should be done like this.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should sit and say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sam gsum mam spyugs na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sam gsum mam spyugs na /
translated: Since the owner of this monastery has been killed, bound, or exiled,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cing dang / dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad par mdzad do //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cing dang / dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad par mdzad do //
translated: if the time has come for the Saṅgha and the Saṅgha agrees, the Saṅgha should do this: the Saṅgha should make this monastery and that monastery have common acquisition for five years, but separate Poṣadhas.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the proposal.

original: las ni 'di ltar bya ba ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di ltar bya ba ste /
translated: The procedure is done like this.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sa ma gum mam spyugs te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sa ma gum mam spyugs te /
translated: The owner of this temple has been killed, bound, or exiled.🔽Therefore, the Saṅgha will make the acquisition of this and that temple common for five years, but will perform the poṣadha separately.

original: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad kyi tshe dang ldan pa gang dag gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso
analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad kyi tshe dang ldan pa gang dag gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso
translated: Venerable ones, if you agree that the acquisition of this and that temple will be common for five years,

original: sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad par bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig //
analyzed: sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad par bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig //
translated: but the poṣadha will be performed separately, then remain silent.

original: gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas /
analyzed: gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas /
translated: But if you do not agree, then speak.

original: dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad lags te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad lags te /
translated: The Saṅgha has agreed and assented to making the acquisition of this and that temple common for five years, but to perform the poṣadha separately.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since there are no objections, this will be upheld as it was spoken.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu dgu pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu dgu pa bshad zin to /
translated: The twenty-ninth downfall is to change a vow after dedicating it.

original: // / gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The basis for the downfall of hoarding is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The Bhagavān Buddha was staying in the Kalandaka Bamboo Grove near Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa pa'i lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dge slong dag sman gang dag de nas lag nyer blangs pa dang / de las byin len byas pa dang / zas kyi phye ma dang 'dres pa dang / phan tshun 'dres pa dang /🔽rang gi rgyud kyis myangs pa gang dag rnam par dbyer yang mi mngon pa de dag dus su yang za bar byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa pa'i lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dge slong dag sman gang dag de nas lag nyer blangs pa dang / de las byin len byas pa dang / zas kyi phye ma dang 'dres pa dang / phan tshun 'dres pa dang / rang gi rgyud kyis myangs pa gang dag rnam par dbyer yang mi mngon pa de dag dus su yang za bar byed /
translated: At that time, the monks who were the students of the venerable Pūrṇa took medicine that they had received with their own hands, that they had received from the donors themselves, that was mixed with flour, that was mixed with other foods,

original: dus ma yin par yang za bar byed cing /
analyzed: dus ma yin par yang za bar byed cing /
translated: and that was not distinguished from their own food. They ate it at the proper time and at the improper time.

original: de dag la bza' bar rnam par dbye bar yang mi mngon @18b nas ;
analyzed: de dag la bza' bar rnam par dbye bar yang mi mngon @18b nas ;
translated: They ate it without distinguishing it from their own food.

original: dge slong don nyung du dag smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag smod par byed /
translated: The monks who had few desires complained and criticized them,🔽saying, “How can the students of the venerable Pūrṇa act in this way?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dar gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dar gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.🔽Then the Blessed One, having understood the situation, gathered the saṅgha of monks and said to the monks:

original: tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dge slong rnams la smras nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dge slong rnams la smras nas /
translated: “Monks, the disciples of the Teacher should not be like the disciples of other teachers.

original: gso dka' ba dang dgang dka' ba dang 'dod pa che ba dang chog mi shes pa rnam par smad de /
analyzed: gso dka' ba dang dgang dka' ba dang 'dod pa che ba dang chog mi shes pa rnam par smad de /
translated: He criticized those who are difficult to support, difficult to fill, who have great desires, and who are not content.

original: gso sla ba dang 'dod pa chung ba dang chog shes pa dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang mdzes pa dang drod rig pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: gso sla ba dang 'dod pa chung ba dang chog shes pa dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang mdzes pa dang drod rig pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: He praised those who are easy to support, who have few desires, who are content, who have the ascetic practices, who are beautiful, and who are temperate.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi'i 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi'i 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Seeing ten benefits, I will lay down a training rule for my disciples, the monks:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong na ba rnams la phan pa so sor bsten par bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong na ba rnams la phan pa so sor bsten par bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks who are sick should rely on what is beneficial.

original: sman gang dag bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sman gang dag bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The medicines that I have allowed are the following:

original: zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi dbu ba de dag las dge slong na bas 'dod na rang gis zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs te /🔽gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyad pas yongs su longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi dbu ba de dag las dge slong na bas 'dod na rang gis zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs te / gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyad pas yongs su longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: If a sick monk wishes, he may consecrate for seven days at a time any of the following: ghee, butter, sesame oil, honey, or molasses.🔽He may then consume it over the course of the seven-day period, storing it for as long as he needs.

original: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If he consumes it after the seven-day period, he commits a minor offense.”

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The location is Rājagṛha.🔽The individuals are the monks who were the students and pupils of Venerable Pilindavatsa.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dge slong dag / nyon mongs pa ni lto 'dun che pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dge slong dag / nyon mongs pa ni lto 'dun che pa /
translated: The affliction is strong desire for food.

original: nyes pa ni gsog 'jog byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gsog 'jog byed pa'o //
translated: The offense is storing food.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
translated: The Blessed One is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
