analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: The monks are those who belong to this Dharma.

original: na ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni nad pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: na ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni nad pa rnams la'o //
translated: The sick are those who are ill.

original: phan pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: Beneficial means suitable.

original: so sor bsten par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni rung ba'o //
analyzed: so sor bsten par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni rung ba'o //
translated: To be used individually means appropriate.

original: sman gang dag bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu bsten pa'o //🔽zhun mar zhes bya ba ni mar bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sman gang dag bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu bsten pa'o // zhun mar zhes bya ba ni mar bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The medicines that have been allowed are as follows:🔽Clarified butter is the essence of milk.

original: 'bru mar zhes bya ba ni 'bru mar nyid do //🔽sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi'o //
analyzed: 'bru mar zhes bya ba ni 'bru mar nyid do // sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi'o //
translated: Oil is the essence of sesame seeds.🔽Honey is the honey of bees.

original: bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba ni bur ram mo //
analyzed: bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba ni bur ram mo //
translated: Sugar candy is sugar.

original: de dag las @19a * //
analyzed: de dag las @19a * //
translated: From among those

original: zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal pa de dag las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal pa de dag las so //
translated: means from among those that have been allowed.🔽The monk

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa de'o //
translated: is the one who is a monk.

original: na bas zhes bya ba ni nad pas so //
analyzed: na bas zhes bya ba ni nad pas so //
translated: “Sick” means ill.

original: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer na'o /
analyzed: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer na'o /
translated: “If he wishes” means if he desires.

original: rang gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “By himself” means by his own hand.

original: zhag bdun par byin gyis da rlabs te /
analyzed: zhag bdun par byin gyis da rlabs te /
translated: “He should consecrate it as for seven days”

original: zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan bdun par ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan bdun par ro //
translated: means for seven days and nights.

original: gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyad pas yongs su longs spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gis blangs te bza' par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyad pas yongs su longs spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gis blangs te bza' par bya ba'o //
translated: “He should consume it by consuming it as stored” means he should consume it by taking it himself.

original: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun las 'das par ro //
analyzed: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun las 'das par ro //
translated: “If he consumes it beyond that” means beyond seven days.

original: spang pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: “He commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession” means that, having relinquished that article, he should acknowledge the offense entailing relinquishment.

original: de nas spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is called an offense entailing relinquishment.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is an offense entailing relinquishment?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restorations should be understood through the main part, the preparatory stages, and the preparatory stages of the preparations.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba skya ngas brgyad pa shar na gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba skya ngas brgyad pa shar na gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir ro //
translated: Here, the presentation of the main part of the downfalls is as follows: For a fully ordained monk to keep for more than seven days medicine that is not consecrated as permitted by the Buddha is a main part of the downfall of keeping stored food.

original: skabs 'dir dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag gis gzhung lugs tha dad par rtog pa yod de /
analyzed: skabs 'dir dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag gis gzhung lugs tha dad par rtog pa yod de /
translated: In this context, there are different opinions among the upholders of the Vinaya regarding the presentation of the main part and the preparatory stages of the downfalls.

original: sngon gyi 'dul ba 'dzin pa du rgyas kyi bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon dharma mi tras 'dul ba'i mdo rgya cher 'grel ba'i gzhung bshad pa las ni dge slong gis sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / bza' zar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi 'dul ba 'dzin pa du rgyas kyi bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon dharma mi tras 'dul ba'i mdo rgya cher 'grel ba'i gzhung bshad pa las ni dge slong gis sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / bza' zar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: The master of Vaibhāṣika, the past vinaya master Dharmaratna, in his commentary on the Vinaya Sūtra says:🔽Monks may consecrate medicine for seven days and eat what is not suitable to eat.🔽

original: dus su rung ba'i zas dang / thun tshod du rung ba'i ltung ba dag bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba gsog 'jog du gyur na /
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i zas dang / thun tshod du rung ba'i ltung ba dag bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba gsog 'jog du gyur na /
translated: The earlier masters of the Vinaya, such as the Vaibhashika master Dharmaratna, who commented on the Vinaya Sutra, state that if a fully ordained monk stores food that is not suitable to be eaten, such as medicine that has been consecrated for seven days, food suitable to be eaten at the proper time or food suitable to be eaten within a set period of time,

original: gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir ba 'byung /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir ba 'byung /
translated: he commits the actual downfall of storing food.

original: bar gyi 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha che'i yul bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon kaly'ana mi tra la sogs pas so sor thar ba'i mdo'i 'grel pa gzhan zhig bshad pa la las ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir @19b 'chang ba gsog
analyzed: bar gyi 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha che'i yul bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon kaly'ana mi tra la sogs pas so sor thar ba'i mdo'i 'grel pa gzhan zhig bshad pa la las ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir @19b 'chang ba gsog
translated: The later masters of the Vinaya, such as the Kashmiri Vaibhashika master Kalyanamitra, who commented on the Vinaya Sutra in a different way, state that if a fully ordained monk stores food that is medicine consecrated for seven days in order to eat it,

original: 'jog tu gyur na /
analyzed: 'jog tu gyur na /
translated: he commits the actual downfall of storing food.

original: gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
translated: This is the actual downfall of storing.

original: bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa dang / dus su rung ba'i zas dang thun tshod du rung ba'i ltung ba dag bza' ba'i phyir 'chad ba gsog 'jog tu gyur pa ni gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa dang / dus su rung ba'i zas dang thun tshod du rung ba'i ltung ba dag bza' ba'i phyir 'chad ba gsog 'jog tu gyur pa ni gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one stores food that is not suitable to be eaten, or that is suitable to be eaten only at certain times, or that is suitable to be eaten only within a certain time, in order to eat it, this is not the actual downfall of storing.

original: gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'i skabs kyi sbyor ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ba byung ste /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'i skabs kyi sbyor ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ba byung ste /
translated: This is a fault in the preparatory stage of the actual downfall of storing.

original: 'dir ni so sor thar pa'i mdo dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhung bla ma dang / 'dul ba'i mdo las dge slong gis sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang pa skya rengs brgyad pa shar na gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir ni so sor thar pa'i mdo dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhung bla ma dang / 'dul ba'i mdo las dge slong gis sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang pa skya rengs brgyad pa shar na gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
translated: In this case, the Vinaya scriptures, the higher code, the detailed explanation of the Pratimoksha Sutra, and the Vinaya Sutra state that if a monk stores for more than seven days medicine that is to be consumed within seven days, he commits the actual downfall of storing at dawn on the eighth day.

original: dus su rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dang / bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa dang / gsog 'jog tu gyur pa ni skabs 'di'i nyes byas su 'gyur bar gsungs pa'i gzhung dang sbyar te /
analyzed: dus su rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dang / bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa dang / gsog 'jog tu gyur pa ni skabs 'di'i nyes byas su 'gyur bar gsungs pa'i gzhung dang sbyar te /
translated: The five types of improper food are those that are not suitable to be eaten at the proper time, those that are not suitable to be eaten at the proper time and within a day, those that are to be kept until one is cured of an illness, those that are not suitable to be eaten and those that are stored.

original: slob dpon kaly'ana mi tras bshad pa'i lugs bzhin du bris so //
analyzed: slob dpon kaly'ana mi tras bshad pa'i lugs bzhin du bris so //
translated: This is written according to the system explained by the master Kalyanamitra.

original: dge slong la gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /🔽spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram / spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a fully ordained monk commits a downfall that requires relinquishment due to storing, but has not relinquished it, has not separated from it and has not confessed the downfall,🔽or has relinquished it but has not separated from it and has not confessed the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par /
translated: or has relinquished it and has separated from it but has not confessed the downfall,

original: sman zhag bdun par gtogs pa'i rigs mthun pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na /
analyzed: sman zhag bdun par gtogs pa'i rigs mthun pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na /
translated: and then obtains another similar medicine that is included in the seven day medicine,

original: de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: that medicine is also relinquished due to the force of the former medicine.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: However, he does not commit a downfall.

original: /'dir zhag bdun pa la rnag nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyi bye brag gzhan bstan pa'i phyir zhag bdun la ni rigs thun pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: /'dir zhag bdun pa la rnag nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyi bye brag gzhan bstan pa'i phyir zhag bdun la ni rigs thun pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, in order to teach another particular type of engagement with pus during the seventh day, it says, “On the seventh day, it is the same type.🔽”

original: spang ba gzhan dag la ni rnag nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid 'chang bar gtogs pa spyi'i shan nyid kyang 'chang bar gtogs pa gzhan spyi la 'byung zhing /🔽'bral bar gtogs pa gzhan spyi'i shan nyid kyang 'bral bar gtogs pa gzhan spyi la 'byung /
analyzed: spang ba gzhan dag la ni rnag nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid 'chang bar gtogs pa spyi'i shan nyid kyang 'chang bar gtogs pa gzhan spyi la 'byung zhing / 'bral bar gtogs pa gzhan spyi'i shan nyid kyang 'bral bar gtogs pa gzhan spyi la 'byung /
translated: In other abandonments, the engagement with pus is a general characteristic of the category of engagement, and it occurs in other general categories of engagement.🔽A general characteristic of another category of separation occurs in other general categories of separation.

original: 'jog par gtogs pa gzhan spyi'i shan nyid kyang 'jog par gtogs pa gzhan spyil 'byung ba la sogs pa lta bu yin la /🔽zhag bdun pa 'di la ni rang @20a * //
analyzed: 'jog par gtogs pa gzhan spyi'i shan nyid kyang 'jog par gtogs pa gzhan spyil 'byung ba la sogs pa lta bu yin la / zhag bdun pa 'di la ni rang @20a * //
translated: A general characteristic of another category of placement occurs in other general categories of placement.

original: nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid zhag bdun par gtogs pa spyi la 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid zhag bdun par gtogs pa spyi la 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: In this seventh day, the engagement with pus is not a general characteristic of the category of the seventh day,

original: rigs mthun pa nyid la 'byung ste /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa nyid la 'byung ste /
translated: but it occurs in the same type.

original: 'di lta ste rang nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid mar du gtogs pa'i ni mar phyis rnyed pa la 'byung ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid mar du gtogs pa'i ni mar phyis rnyed pa la 'byung ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: For example, when one obtains oil that is included in the category of butter, it is used for butter, but not for sesame oil, etc.

original: 'bra mar la sogs pa dag mi 'gyur ba dang ; de bzhin du rang nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid 'bru mar du gtogs pa'i ni 'bru mar phyir rnyed pa la 'byung ba nyid yin gyi mar la sogs pa dag la mi 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bra mar la sogs pa dag mi 'gyur ba dang ; de bzhin du rang nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid 'bru mar du gtogs pa'i ni 'bru mar phyir rnyed pa la 'byung ba nyid yin gyi mar la sogs pa dag la mi 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: And when one obtains sesame oil that is included in the category of butter, it is used for sesame oil, but not for butter, etc.🔽Here, the text of the Vinaya states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis tshes la mar rnyed la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis tshes la mar rnyed la /
translated: If a bhikṣu obtains butter on the first day of the fortnight,

original: des tshes gnyis la gzhan zhig kyang rnyed par gyur na dge slong des snga ma shos bza' bar bya zhing /🔽phyi ma shos gtang bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: des tshes gnyis la gzhan zhig kyang rnyed par gyur na dge slong des snga ma shos bza' bar bya zhing / phyi ma shos gtang bar bya ba 'am /
translated: and if he obtains another on the second day, the bhikṣu should use the first one,🔽and he should discard the second one,

original: rung bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: rung bar bya ba 'am /
translated: or he should make it into a suitable object,

original: gzhan la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: or he should give it to others.

original: gtong bar mi byed dam /
analyzed: gtong bar mi byed dam /
translated: If he does not discard it,

original: gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na zhag brgyad pa'i skya rengs shar na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na zhag brgyad pa'i skya rengs shar na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not give it to another, then at sunrise on the eighth day, it becomes a downfall that requires relinquishment.🔽If a fully ordained monk has committed a downfall that requires relinquishment and stores another requisite, such as a begging bowl, a Dharma robe, a water strainer, a cup, a belt, or any other article necessary for a renunciate’s life,

original: dge slong gis gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par ltung bzed dam chos gos sam dra pa 'am phor bu 'am ska rags sam dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang🔽yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: dge slong gis gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par ltung bzed dam chos gos sam dra pa 'am phor bu 'am ska rags sam dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog par byed na /
translated: without having confessed and thus removed the original downfall,

original: de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: then that second article becomes subject to relinquishment by the force of the first downfall.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the monk does not incur a second downfall.

original: gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed 'di dang // 'og nas gsog 'jog gi ltung byed ces 'byung ba la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed 'di dang // 'og nas gsog 'jog gi ltung byed ces 'byung ba la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: The following is the difference between this downfall that requires relinquishment and the downfall that requires confession alone that is described below.

original: 'di ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' pa'i phyir bcang ba skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu gyur pa la /🔽spang ba'i ltung byed du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' pa'i phyir bcang ba skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu gyur pa la / spang ba'i ltung byed du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is a downfall due to a downfall, because it is a downfall that is a downfall due to eating the medicine that has been consecrated for seven days, when the eighth dawn has arrived, and it is stored.

original: 'og ma ni dus su rung ba'i zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga gsog 'jog tu gyur pa zos pa la ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'og ma ni dus su rung ba'i zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga gsog 'jog tu gyur pa zos pa la ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The next is a downfall due to a downfall, because it is a downfall that is a downfall due to eating the five cooked foods and the five foods that are not cooked, which are suitable for the time, when they have been stored.

original: sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir bcang ba skya rengs brgyad pa shar ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir bcang ba skya rengs brgyad pa shar ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating the medicine that has been consecrated for seven days, when the eighth dawn has arrived, for the sake of eating it.

original: sman zhag bdun pa ni zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsa dang bu ram gyi dbu bdag go //
analyzed: sman zhag bdun pa ni zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsa dang bu ram gyi dbu bdag go //
translated: The medicine that is consecrated for seven days is clarified butter, sesame oil, honey, and sugar.

original: zhun mar zhes bya ba ni mar bzhus pa ste bdud rtsi yang de'i khongs su gtogs so //
analyzed: zhun mar zhes bya ba ni mar bzhus pa ste bdud rtsi yang de'i khongs su gtogs so //
translated: Clarified butter is melted butter, and nectar is also included in that.

original: 'bru mar zhes bya @20b pa ni 'bru mar nyid de /
analyzed: 'bru mar zhes bya @20b pa ni 'bru mar nyid de /
translated: Sesame oil is sesame oil.

original: zhag rnam pa lnga po nya'i zhag dang / ri bong gi zhag dang / chu srin byis pa gsod kyi zhag dang / dom gyi zhag dang / phag gi zhag dus su bskol /
analyzed: zhag rnam pa lnga po nya'i zhag dang / ri bong gi zhag dang / chu srin byis pa gsod kyi zhag dang / dom gyi zhag dang / phag gi zhag dus su bskol /
translated: The five types of meat are the meat of fish, rabbit, porpoise, bear, and pig.

original: dus su btsags /
analyzed: dus su btsags /
translated: They are to be cooked at the proper time,

original: dus su byin gyis brlabs pa dag kyang 'di'i khongs su gtogs so //
analyzed: dus su byin gyis brlabs pa dag kyang 'di'i khongs su gtogs so //
translated: and they are to be consecrated at the proper time.

original: sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi'o//
analyzed: sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi'o//
translated: Honey is the honey of bees.

original: bu ram dang bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba ni bu ram nyid de /
analyzed: bu ram dang bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba ni bu ram nyid de /
translated: Sugar and sugar-cane are sugar itself.

original: hvags dang li kha ra la sogs pa yang 'di'i khongs su gtogs so //🔽sman zhag bdun pa byin len byin pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: hvags dang li kha ra la sogs pa yang 'di'i khongs su gtogs so // sman zhag bdun pa byin len byin pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa de dag ni /
translated: Sugar-cane juice and molasses are also included in this.🔽Medicines that may be kept for seven days are medicines that have been accepted and consecrated.

original: dge slong nad pas zhag bdun gyi mtha'i dus tshun chad du rung gis byin len byas shing byin gyis brlabs te bsten par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dge slong nad pas zhag bdun gyi mtha'i dus tshun chad du rung gis byin len byas shing byin gyis brlabs te bsten par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: They are to be used by sick monks for seven days at the most, having been accepted and consecrated.

original: mi na bas ni byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la gzhan gyis brlabs pa dag bzar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mi na bas ni byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la gzhan gyis brlabs pa dag bzar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable for a healthy person to consecrate it, nor is it suitable for a healthy person to eat what has been consecrated by another.

original: sos pa nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no //
analyzed: sos pa nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no //
translated: If a healthy person begs for it, give it to him.

original: slong ba me dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: slong ba me dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The begging bowl should be placed in the Saṅgha’s medicine house.

original: de dag zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs par cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs par cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The consecration of those for seven days is as follows:

original: sman de dag sman pa dang sman pa rab tu byung ba dang sman g-yog bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mkhas pa gang yang rung ba'i sa gzhir snga dro bskol cing btsags nas /
analyzed: sman de dag sman pa dang sman pa rab tu byung ba dang sman g-yog bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mkhas pa gang yang rung ba'i sa gzhir snga dro bskol cing btsags nas /
translated: The medicine should be boiled and strained in the morning by a physician, a renunciate physician, or a skilled novice physician on the ground.

original: bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres par byas la /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres par byas la /
translated: It should be made free from unsuitable things that are held in the hand, cooked inside, kept overnight inside, cooked by a monk, and so on.

original: dge slong nad pas kyang snga dro lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas la dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa gcig mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
analyzed: dge slong nad pas kyang snga dro lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas la dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa gcig mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
translated: He should sit with his knees drawn up to his chest, and a fully ordained monk who is in good health and who shares his view and mode of dress should sit in front of him.

original: gnyi gas ltung bzed dam sman snod lag pa g-yon par gzhag la g-yas pas kha nas bka' ste /
analyzed: gnyi gas ltung bzed dam sman snod lag pa g-yon par gzhag la g-yas pas kha nas bka' ste /
translated: The sick monk should place the alms-food or the medicine in his left hand and open the container with his right hand.

original: nad pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The sick monk should then say the following:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sman zhag bdun pa 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyir bgyi bar zhag bdun par byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sman zhag bdun pa 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyir bgyi bar zhag bdun par byin gyis brlab po //
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, will use this seven-day medicine for myself and for those who are living the spiritual life with me. I consecrate it as seven-day medicine.”

original: lan gsum du bzlas /🔽sde'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas / sde'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: This should be repeated three times.

original: nad pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The sick monk should say, “It is well.”

original: de phyin chad zhag bdun gyi bar du byin len ma zhig par byas te rang gis @21a * //🔽bsten cing bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de phyin chad zhag bdun gyi bar du byin len ma zhig par byas te rang gis @21a * // bsten cing bza' bar bya'o //
translated: After that, he should keep it without being discarded for seven days and should use it himself.

original: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la nyi ma re re zhing deng phan chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te deng ni nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la nyi ma re re zhing deng phan chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te deng ni nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Every day, on the day after the day of the consecration of the seven-day period has passed, the monk should say, “From now on, the first day has passed. Today is the second day,” and so on.

original: zhag brgyad pa'i skya rengs ma shar tshun chad du zos zin cing lhag ma byed na der zad /
analyzed: zhag brgyad pa'i skya rengs ma shar tshun chad du zos zin cing lhag ma byed na der zad /
translated: If he eats what remains of the medicine after the dawn of the eighth day, he should stop at that point.

original: yod na nad pa'i phyir slong ba la sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: yod na nad pa'i phyir slong ba la sbyin pa'am /
translated: If there is any left, he should give it to a fellow monk who is sick,

original: dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag pa'am /
translated: or he should put it in the medicine house of the community,

original: bsam pa thag pa nas ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis gzhan la gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis gzhan la gtang bar bya'o //
translated: or he should give it away to others with a mind that is free of any concern for himself.

original: de ltar ma byas par bza' ba'i phyir 'chad na skya rengs brgyad pa shar na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur zhing spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas par bza' ba'i phyir 'chad na skya rengs brgyad pa shar na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur zhing spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not do that, but keeps it for the purpose of eating, then when the eighth dawn arrives, it becomes stored and kept, and the actual basis of a downfall is incurred.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba dang de dag skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba dang de dag skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The perpetrator of this downfall is one who keeps the medicine consecrated as seven-day medicine for the purpose of eating, and when the eighth dawn arrives, it becomes stored and kept.

original: 'di la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the actual basis of a downfall is incurred through four limbs:

original: sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa nyid dang / rang nyid bza' ba'i phyir dang / 'chang ba dang skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa nyid dang / rang nyid bza' ba'i phyir dang / 'chang ba dang skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: it is medicine consecrated as seven-day medicine; it is kept for the purpose of eating by oneself; it is kept; and when the eighth dawn arrives, it becomes stored and kept.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these limbs is incomplete, then a downfall is not incurred.

original: sbyor ba'i lhung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lhung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall is accrued at dawn.

original: ji srid du gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one engages in the act of the downfall of storing but has not reached the actual basis, it is a wrong action.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various acts that one engages in that are different from the actual basis, there is a wrong action.

original: bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis bcos pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa mi sha la sogs pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa dang 'dres pa dang /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis bcos pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa mi sha la sogs pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa dang 'dres pa dang /
translated: It is not permissible to eat food that is not suitable to eat, such as that which has been held in the hand, that has been left overnight, that has been cooked in one's own quarters, that has been prepared by a fully ordained monk, that is not suitable to eat such as human flesh and that which is mixed with what is not suitable to eat.

original: brtags pa la gzhan dang 'dres pa /
analyzed: brtags pa la gzhan dang 'dres pa /
translated: That which is examined and mixed with other substances.🔽For example, that which is suitable for one session when mixed with food suitable for a specific time and so on is not suitable to eat because of the fault of being mixed with what is not suitable to eat.

original: dper na dus su rung ba'i zas dang 'dres pa'i thun tshod du rung ba la sogs pa'i blta bu'i skyon gyis rung ba ma yin pa nyid du gyur pa dag ni bza' ba'i phyir 'chad na nyin zhag gcig lon na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur pas de dag zhag
analyzed: dper na dus su rung ba'i zas dang 'dres pa'i thun tshod du rung ba la sogs pa'i blta bu'i skyon gyis rung ba ma yin pa nyid du gyur pa dag ni bza' ba'i phyir 'chad na nyin zhag gcig lon na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur pas de dag zhag
translated: If one eats these for the purpose of eating, then they become stored and set aside after one day.

original: lon par 'chang ba la nyes byas so //🔽dus su rung ba'i zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga byin len byas pa ma zhig ba bza' ba'i phyir 'chad na phyed yol na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur bas de phyed yol gyi bar du 'chang @21b bal nyes byas so //
analyzed: lon par 'chang ba la nyes byas so // dus su rung ba'i zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga byin len byas pa ma zhig ba bza' ba'i phyir 'chad na phyed yol na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur bas de phyed yol gyi bar du 'chang @21b bal nyes byas so //
translated: If one keeps it after that, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one keeps for more than half a day food that is suitable for any time, such as the five foods that can be kept uncontaminated and the five foods that can be kept after chewing, which have been offered and have not been rejected, with the intention of eating it, it becomes stored and should be discarded at the end of that half day.

original: thun tshod du dung ba'i btung ba byin len byas pa byin gyis brlabs pa byin len ma zhig par btung ba'i phyir 'chang na thun tshod las 'das na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur bas de thun tshod las 'das par 'chad ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: thun tshod du dung ba'i btung ba byin len byas pa byin gyis brlabs pa byin len ma zhig par btung ba'i phyir 'chang na thun tshod las 'das na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur bas de thun tshod las 'das par 'chad ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one keeps for more than one day a drink that is suitable for any time, such as a medicinal drink, which has been offered and has not been rejected, with the intention of drinking it, it becomes stored and should be discarded at the end of that day.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of wrong conduct in relation to preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many as there are preparations, there are also that many preparations of preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation of a preparation is also a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, first, the mental act is a minor offense in the preparation.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the act of body and speech is the actual offense in the preparation.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i lhung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i lhung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the final step is the actual offense of a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: ltung ba med pa ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis ma brlabs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis ma brlabs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not consecrate medicine for seven days.

original: skya rengs brgyad pa dang nyin mtshan dang / phyed yol dang / thun tshod ma 'das pa gsog 'jog tu ma gyur pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: skya rengs brgyad pa dang nyin mtshan dang / phyed yol dang / thun tshod ma 'das pa gsog 'jog tu ma gyur pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not store the medicine, but takes it at the eighth dawn, or at the end of the day and night, or at the end of the watch.

original: zhag bdun pa'i 'dru mar la sogs pa rkang pa bsku ba la sogs pa'i don gang gi phyir rung ba byas pa de'i phyir 'chang ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i 'dru mar la sogs pa rkang pa bsku ba la sogs pa'i don gang gi phyir rung ba byas pa de'i phyir 'chang ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one stores medicine for seven days, such as oil, and uses it for the purpose of anointing the feet, and so on.

original: snang blugs pa dang bsku mnye bya ba dag gi gsog 'jog byas kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: snang blugs pa dang bsku mnye bya ba dag gi gsog 'jog byas kyang rung ngo //
translated: One may store oil for anointing and massage.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for beginners, for those who are insane, for those whose minds are disturbed, and for those whose senses are impaired.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not relying on any kind of hoarding in any situation.

original: sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la 'di skad ces deng phan chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te /
analyzed: sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la 'di skad ces deng phan chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te /
translated: Every day, the monk should be told, “Today is the day after the first day of the seven-day period during which you may keep medicines.

original: deng ni nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: deng ni nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Today is the second day.”

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: gsog 'jog gi spang ba ste sum cu pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi spang ba ste sum cu pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the thirty-first downfall.

original: // / tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu po dag bton zin to zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed gdon pa'i 'jug bsdu pa ste /
analyzed: // / tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu po dag bton zin to zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed gdon pa'i 'jug bsdu pa ste /
translated: “Venerable ones, I have recited the thirty rules on partial defeats.🔽The thirty rules on partial defeats are the three sets of ten that were taught in the chapter on partial defeats.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu po dag ces bya ba ni sdar bstan pa'i bcu tshan gsum po dag go //🔽bton zin to zhes bya ba ni dam bca' @22a * //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu po dag ces bya ba ni sdar bstan pa'i bcu tshan gsum po dag go // bton zin to zhes bya ba ni dam bca' @22a * //
translated: I have recited them is said in order to conclude the recitation of the rules on partial defeats,🔽in order to summarize the chapter on partial defeats,

original: ba'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / nyan pa po rnams spro bar bya ba'i phyir smos so //🔽de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag la ji 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri'o //
analyzed: ba'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / nyan pa po rnams spro bar bya ba'i phyir smos so // de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag la ji 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri'o //
translated: and in order to encourage those who are listening.🔽“In regard to this, I ask the venerable ones—are you completely pure in this matter?🔽I ask a second time, venerable ones—are you completely pure in this matter?

original: ji 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
analyzed: ji 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
translated: I ask a third time, venerable ones—are you completely pure in this matter?

original: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cad mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cad mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba yin te /
translated: “Venerables, if you are pure in this, then in this matter you should remain silent. What I have announced I consider to be settled.”

original: de la zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu po dag bton pa de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu po dag bton pa de la'o //
translated: This is the proclamation of the downfalls that are to be confessed individually.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed gdon pa bshad zin to /
