analyzed: nyes byas dang / tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng ba'o //🔽rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: lying that is a defeat, lying that is a serious violation, lying that is a minor offense, lying that is a confession, lying that is a downfall from the vows of individual liberation, lying that is a downfall from the bodhisattva vows, lying that is a downfall from the tantric vows, and lying that is a downfall from the commitments.

original: gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / @25b so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o //🔽rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / @25b so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o // rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: “without basis” means that the accusation is not based on what has been seen, heard, or suspected.

original: gzhi med par tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o ;🔽/ rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi med par tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o ; / rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: “Seven aspects” means that the accusation is not based on the monk’s moral discipline, his view, his conduct, or his livelihood having degenerated, or on what has been seen, heard, or suspected.

original: dge slong brdzun smra bar 'dod pa na /
analyzed: dge slong brdzun smra bar 'dod pa na /
translated: “Six aspects” means that the accusation is not based on the monk having lied,🔽or on what has been seen, heard, or suspected.🔽“Three aspects” means that the accusation is not based on what has been seen, heard, or suspected.

original: 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba ni 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa dang / gzhi med par mthong ba dang / thos pa dang /
analyzed: 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba ni 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa dang / gzhi med par mthong ba dang / thos pa dang /
translated: “Two aspects” means that the accusation is not based on what has been seen or heard.

original: dogs pas brdzun smra ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pas brdzun smra ba'o //
translated: “One aspect” means that the accusation is not based on what has been suspected.

original: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas kyis gleng ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas kyis gleng ba'o //
translated: They are: accusing someone of a defeating offense without having a basis in fact; accusing someone of a serious violation, a minor offense, an offense that must be confessed by an individual, or an offense of wrong conduct without having a basis in fact.

original: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gzhi med par tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi med par tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng ba'o //
translated: They are: accusing someone of a lapse in morality, a lapse in view, a lapse in conduct, or a lapse in livelihood without having a basis in fact.

original: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: gzhi med par mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi med par mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o //
translated: They are: accusing someone without having seen, heard, or suspected anything.🔽What are the three?

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum gang zhe na brdzun smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum gang zhe na brdzun smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa'o //
translated: They are: intending to lie, thinking, “I will lie”; lying, thinking, “I am lying”; and having lied, thinking, “I have lied.”

original: rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa'o //
translated: When lying, one thinks, “I am lying,” and when one has lied, one thinks, “I have lied.”

original: brdzun smra ba na rnam pa gcig pu 'ba' zhig ni med do /
analyzed: brdzun smra ba na rnam pa gcig pu 'ba' zhig ni med do /
translated: But there is no lying when one does not know that one is lying.

original: brdzun smra ba ni /
analyzed: brdzun smra ba ni /
translated: What is lying?

original: pham par 'gyur ba yang yod /🔽dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba yang yod /🔽nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba yang yod /🔽ltung byed du 'gyur bar yang yod /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba yang yod / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba yang yod / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba yang yod / ltung byed du 'gyur bar yang yod /
translated: There is lying that is a defeat,🔽lying that is a serious transgression of the monastic code,🔽lying that is a serious violation,🔽lying that is a minor infraction,

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: and lying that is a minor infraction in the monastic code.

original: de la brdzun smra ba pham par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brdzun smra ba pham par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is lying that is a defeat?

original: 'di lta ste dge slong med la med bzhin du mi'i chos bla me smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge slong med la med bzhin du mi'i chos bla me smra ba'o //
translated: It is when a monk, without being a monk, claims to be a monk and says that he has seen or experienced something supramundane.

original: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is lying that is a serious transgression of the monastic code?

original: 'di lta ste dge slong khros shing zhe sdang bar gyur nas ji nas kyang 'di tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge slong khros shing zhe sdang bar gyur nas ji nas kyang 'di tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam nas /
translated: It is when a monk, out of anger and hatred, thinks, “I will destroy this person’s pure conduct,” and then accuses that person of having engaged in sexual intercourse.

original: dge slong dag la ltung ba med pa la gzhi med pa pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag la ltung ba med pa la gzhi med pa pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: It is to falsely accuse a monk of a defeating offense without having a basis in fact.

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba gang zhes na /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba gang zhes na /
translated: “What is a serious transgression?

original: 'di lta ste dge slong dge 'dun gyi nang du ched du @26a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge slong dge 'dun gyi nang du ched du @26a * //
translated: It is when a monk, in the midst of the Saṅgha,

original: bsams te / chos ma yin pa'i chos su ston pa dang / chos chos ma yin par ston pa dang / 'dul bam yin pa 'dul bar ston pa dang / 'dul ba 'dul ba ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bsams te / chos ma yin pa'i chos su ston pa dang / chos chos ma yin par ston pa dang / 'dul bam yin pa 'dul bar ston pa dang / 'dul ba 'dul ba ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: deliberately teaches what is contrary to the Dharma as the Dharma, what is the Dharma as contrary to the Dharma, what is not the Vinaya as the Vinaya, and what is the Vinaya as not the Vinaya.

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a minor infraction?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dge slong zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa 'don pa na ci 'di la /
analyzed: dge slong zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa 'don pa na ci 'di la /
translated: when a monk recites the Prātimokṣa Sūtra every half month,

original: khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dris pa na yongs su ma dag bzhin du cang mi smra bar sdod pa'o //
analyzed: khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dris pa na yongs su ma dag bzhin du cang mi smra bar sdod pa'o //
translated: if, when asked, ‘Are you completely pure in this matter?’ he remains silent while not being completely pure.

original: ltung byed du 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ltung byed du 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is an offense?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: brdzun du smra ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag ma gtogs pa brdzun du smra ba gzhan gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni ltung byed du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag ma gtogs pa brdzun du smra ba gzhan gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni ltung byed du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Except for these four types of lying, all other lying is a minor offense.

original: ltung byed ces bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dags dang ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed 'tshed par byed ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung byed ces bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dags dang ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed 'tshed par byed ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Minor offense” means that one will be burned, cooked, and fall into the hells, the animal realm, the world of hungry ghosts, the lower realms, bad rebirths, and unfortunate destinies.

original: gzhan yang ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
translated: Moreover, if that offense is not confessed and not individually confessed,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: it will be an obstruction to wholesome qualities.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a minor offense.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit that offense?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab bar bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //🔽de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa spom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur te brdzun du smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab bar bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o // de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa spom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur te brdzun du smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang /
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this through the downfalls, the preparations, the preparations for the preparations, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the amendings.🔽Here, the presentation of the actual downfalls is as follows: Except for the downfalls that are the grounds for defeat, the serious offenses, and the offenses of wrong conduct, when one lies with the object of a person who understands, and one changes one's perception to a different perception, and one thinks, I am lying,

original: brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa na sbyor ba dang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa na sbyor ba dang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: and when one lies and thinks, I am lying, then the actual basis of the downfalls of the serious faults and the downfalls of wrong conduct is the actual basis of the downfalls of the serious faults and the downfalls of wrong conduct.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: Lying is posited by the power of discernment,

original: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin pas don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba thams cad la na smad pa med do //🔽brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa na sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i dngos gzhi yin pas de la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin pas don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba thams cad la na smad pa med do // brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa na sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i dngos gzhi yin pas de la na smad pa med do //
translated: but since it is not posited by the power of things, there is no fault in all cases of transforming the discernment of an object into something else.🔽When lying, if one thinks, I am lying, then the actual basis is accompanied by preparation, so there is no fault in that.

original: brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa ni dngos gzhi mjug dang bcas pa yin pas de la yang na smad pa med do //
analyzed: brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa ni dngos gzhi mjug dang bcas pa yin pas de la yang na smad pa med do //
translated: When one has lied, if one thinks, I have lied, then the actual basis is accompanied by conclusion, so there is no fault in that.

original: gzhi gcig la du ma nyid dang bcas pa la na smad pa med @26b do /
analyzed: gzhi gcig la du ma nyid dang bcas pa la na smad pa med @26b do /
translated: There is no fault in saying that one thing has many.

original: ; yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra bas de la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: ; yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra bas de la na smad pa med do //
translated: Since doubt is similar to discernment, there is no fault in that.

original: ltung byed du gtogs pa'i brdzun gyi don gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: ltung byed du gtogs pa'i brdzun gyi don gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in any of the meanings of lying that are included in the downfalls.

original: nyan pa po mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa don go ba bsams pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyan pa po mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa don go ba bsams pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the listener is a human being, understands the meaning, and is not contemptible.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The agent is one who has changed his perception of the object of the lie.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual downfall is completed by five factors:

original: 'du shes bsgyur bas nyid dang / bdag gnyid kyis smras pa nyid dang / nyan pa po mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i brdzun nyid dang / gzhan gyis don go ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes bsgyur bas nyid dang / bdag gnyid kyis smras pa nyid dang / nyan pa po mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i brdzun nyid dang / gzhan gyis don go ba'o //
translated: changing one’s perception, lying, the listener being a human being, the listener being in a normal state of mind, and the listener understanding the meaning.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is incomplete, a serious violation is incurred.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /🔽ji srid du brdzun smra ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te / ji srid du brdzun smra ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The preparation is a minor offense.🔽As long as one has not reached the actual practice of lying, one commits a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various preparations for the actual practice, one commits a minor offense.

original: brdzun smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa ni sbyor ba la yin pas de la nyes byas so //
analyzed: brdzun smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa ni sbyor ba la yin pas de la nyes byas so //
translated: When one wishes to lie, thinking, I will tell a lie, is the preparation, so there is an offense of wrong conduct for that.

original: mi'i 'gro ba pa ni tha snyad du bya ba nyid kyi yan lag yin pas mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba pa ni tha snyad du bya ba nyid kyi yan lag yin pas mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
translated: Since the human realm is a branch of the object to be transacted, there is an offense of wrong conduct for the nonhuman realm.

original: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
translated: If one lies to an animal, it is deprecated.

original: rnam par rig byed la ni don go ba nyid yan lag yin pas nyan pa po rang bzhin nyams pa la sogs pas don ma go ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed la ni don go ba nyid yan lag yin pas nyan pa po rang bzhin nyams pa la sogs pas don ma go ba la nyes byas so //
translated: Since the object understood is a branch of the indicative form, there is an offense of wrong conduct for the listener who does not understand the meaning due to degeneration of the faculties and so on.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for preparation is a subtle misdeed.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la spyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de nyid de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la spyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de nyid de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also preparations for preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The preparation is a misdeed and the preparation for preparation is also a misdeed.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: It is a subtle misdeed.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dngos po brdzun yang 'du shes bden pas smra ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dngos po brdzun yang 'du shes bden pas smra ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if the object is false but one’s perception is true.

original: brdzun smra ba la rnam pa gcig pu 'ba' zhig ni med pas brdzun du smra ba 'jug pa nyi tshe la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: brdzun smra ba la rnam pa gcig pu 'ba' zhig ni med pas brdzun du smra ba 'jug pa nyi tshe la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a bodhisattva who is speaking in a way that is indirect or figurative.

original: tshig thal zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig thal zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the words have already been spoken.

original: gal te brjod par bya ba sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yin na ni gzhan brjod kyang ltung ba med de /
analyzed: gal te brjod par bya ba sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yin na ni gzhan brjod kyang ltung ba med de /
translated: If the words that are spoken are painful, there is no offense if the bodhisattva is speaking to someone else.

original: de'i phyir gsad par bya ba mthong ngam zhes 'dri ba la /🔽re zhig me 'de shig / re zhig skom 'thung shig / re zhig ngal sos shig / nam mkha' mthong ngo //🔽sen mo mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsad par bya ba mthong ngam zhes 'dri ba la / re zhig me 'de shig / re zhig skom 'thung shig / re zhig ngal sos shig / nam mkha' mthong ngo // sen mo mthong ngo //
translated: For example, when someone asks, “Have you seen my cow?”🔽and the bodhisattva replies, “I have seen it being led away,”🔽or when someone asks, “Have you seen my horse?”

original: don dam par na /
analyzed: don dam par na /
translated: and the bodhisattva replies, “I have seen its hoof,”

original: sems can nam /
analyzed: sems can nam /
translated: or when someone asks, “Have you seen my elephant?”🔽and the bodhisattva replies, “I have seen its tusk,”

original: gsad par bya ba ma mthong ngo zhes smras na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gsad par bya ba ma mthong ngo zhes smras na ltung ba med do //
translated: there is no offense.🔽There is no offense if the bodhisattva is a beginner.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor @27a * //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor @27a * //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is insane or is suffering from an emotional disturbance.

original: pa dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: pa dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is in pain due to an illness.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a fully ordained monk should train in not relying on any of the aspects of lying in any situation.

original: mna' 'dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mna' 'dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not swear.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas phra mo'o //🔽sbyor ba nyed byas dang / dngos gzhi ltung byed bsdam pa dang / mthol ba dang bshags pas ltung ba las bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas phra mo'o // sbyor ba nyed byas dang / dngos gzhi ltung byed bsdam pa dang / mthol ba dang bshags pas ltung ba las bslang bar bya'o //
translated: The preparation for lying is a minor offense.🔽The actual basis is a downfall. The amendment is to confess and to restrain oneself from future downfalls.

original: de la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas phra mo dang / sbyor ba nyes byas de gnyis bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas yin na ni gzhan la mthol ba dang bshags mi dgos par rang gi yid kyis ltung ba snga ma mthong ba dang phyin chad bsdam pas snga ma 'gyod pa dang /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas phra mo dang / sbyor ba nyes byas de gnyis bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas yin na ni gzhan la mthol ba dang bshags mi dgos par rang gi yid kyis ltung ba snga ma mthong ba dang phyin chad bsdam pas snga ma 'gyod pa dang /
translated: If the two preparations for lying are minor offenses that are to be restrained, then one does not need to confess them to another person.

original: phyin chad mi bya'o snyam du bsdam pa byas na ltung ba las ldang ngo //
analyzed: phyin chad mi bya'o snyam du bsdam pa byas na ltung ba las ldang ngo //
translated: If one resolves, “I will not do it again,” one rises from the offense.

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas yin na ni gzhan la mthol ba dang bshags pas phyir bcos par bya dgos so //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas yin na ni gzhan la mthol ba dang bshags pas phyir bcos par bya dgos so //
translated: If it is a fault that is to be confessed, one must confess it to another and restore it.

original: de la bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas ni bshags par bya ba'i nyes ba'i nyes byas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa yid kyi nyes byas zhes byas zhes byas zhes bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de la bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas ni bshags par bya ba'i nyes ba'i nyes byas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa yid kyi nyes byas zhes byas zhes byas zhes bya ba dag yin no //
translated: Among those, the faults that are to be resolved are the mental faults that are included in the class of faults that are to be confessed.

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas ni lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba'i sgrub pa dag yin no /
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas ni lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba'i sgrub pa dag yin no /
translated: The faults that are to be confessed are the physical and verbal faults that are established through preparation.

original: de la bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas mthol ba dang bshags pa'i cho ga ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas mthol ba dang bshags pa'i cho ga ni 'di yin te /
translated: The rite for confessing the faults that are to be confessed is as follows:

original: dge slong gis ltung ba bcab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis ltung ba bcab par mi bya ste /
translated: A monk should not conceal a downfall.

original: ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas phra mo dang / sbyor ba nyes byas bshags par bya ba gang yang rung ba byung na bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan
analyzed: ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas phra mo dang / sbyor ba nyes byas bshags par bya ba gang yang rung ba byung na bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan
translated: If you commit a minor offense that is a precursor to a downfall, or any other offense that is a precursor to an offense that must be confessed, you should not conceal it even for a single moment.🔽Immediately, you should remove your sandals, and in the presence of a fully ordained monk who is in good standing and who shares your view and monastic discipline, and who is within sight or hearing, you should sit in the kneeling position with your palms together in front of your heart.

original: mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba'i ste tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smros te /
analyzed: mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba'i ste tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smros te /
translated: You should then confess the downfall by its name and the circumstances in which it occurred.

original: cig car mthol ba dang bshags par byar rung ngo //
analyzed: cig car mthol ba dang bshags par byar rung ngo //
translated: You may confess a downfall immediately after you have committed it.

original: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The formula for this is as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please heed me.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba la ltung ba brdzun du smra ba'i ltung ba brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes byas phra mo dang / nyes byas byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba la ltung ba brdzun du smra ba'i ltung ba brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes byas phra mo dang / nyes byas byung ste /
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, have the downfall of lying, the downfall of lying that is a downfall due to indulging in sexual intercourse, and the minor offense that occurs due to such-and-such an action.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i ltung ba de tshe dang @27b ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i ltung ba de tshe dang @27b ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, confess this downfall in the presence of the venerable ones.

original: mi 'chab po //
analyzed: mi 'chab po //
translated: I do not conceal it.🔽I confess it.

original: 'chags so // mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'chags so // mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If I confess it, I will be comfortable;

original: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: if I do not confess it, I will not be comfortable.

original: nyan pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing 'chags pas mthong do zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: nyan pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing 'chags pas mthong do zhes brjod par bya /
translated: The listener says, “Do you see the downfall?” The one confessing says, “I see it.”

original: nyes byas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: nyes byas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /
translated: The listener says, “From now on, will you refrain from that offense?”

original: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: The one confessing says, “I will refrain.” This is repeated three times.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya zhing /
translated: The listener says, “That is the method.”

original: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should say, “Excellent!”

original: de tsam gyis na brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i ltung ba las ldang ngo ;
analyzed: de tsam gyis na brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i ltung ba las ldang ngo ;
translated: By that alone, one rises from the downfall of lying through the preparation and the actual basis.

original: / brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi byung na de'i phyir bcos pa yang snga ma bzhin du mthol ba dang bshags pas phyir bcos par bya dgos te /
analyzed: / brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi byung na de'i phyir bcos pa yang snga ma bzhin du mthol ba dang bshags pas phyir bcos par bya dgos te /
translated: If the actual basis of the offense of lying occurs, then, as before, one must restore it through confession and acknowledgment.

original: de'i chog dang sngags kyang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i chog dang sngags kyang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The rite and the mantra are the same as before.

original: sngags kyi byed brag tu na bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed byang ba ste zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi byed brag tu na bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed byang ba ste zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: The difference in the mantra is that one should say, “I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, have purified the offense of lying.”

original: de ltar ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir cig car mthol ba dang / bshags par byas na de'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba ni logs shig tu mthol zhing bshags mi dgos te /
analyzed: de ltar ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir cig car mthol ba dang / bshags par byas na de'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba ni logs shig tu mthol zhing bshags mi dgos te /
translated: If one confesses and acknowledges the actual basis of the offense at the same time, then one does not need to confess and acknowledge the preparation and the act separately.

original: de tsam gyis na brdzun smra ba'i ltung ba las ldang ngo //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na brdzun smra ba'i ltung ba las ldang ngo //
translated: By this much, one rises up from the transgression of lying.

original: de'i mdo la gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na /
analyzed: de'i mdo la gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na /
translated: In the case where there is no person to whom one could confess,

original: skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault of concealment until dawn.

original: ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ma bshags pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ma bshags pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: For as long as one does not find a person to whom one could confess, for that long, even if dawn has broken, there is no fault of concealment in not confessing.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: In the case where there is no person to whom one could confess, for as long as one does not find a person to whom one could confess, for that long, in the absence of the thought to confess, there is no fault of concealment.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyed der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyed der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
translated: In the case where there is a person to whom one could confess, but due to some condition, one does not have the opportunity to go there,

original: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If one has gone to another place, then there is no fault of concealment if one has no thought of confessing it.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i @28a * //
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i @28a * //
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if one who has incurred a downfall thinks,

original: gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro 'am /
analyzed: gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro 'am /
translated: “If I go to him and do not confess, I will incur the fault of concealment,” and because of that does not go to him,

original: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or if one does not confess after going to him, there is no fault of concealment.

original: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not go to him because of any circumstance, or if one goes to him but does not confess before dawn, or if one generates the thought of concealment, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang la mi mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug la ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa gcig la ji🔽mthol de'i 'og tu dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug ba ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya'o //🔽ltung ba ming las mi mthun pa'i gang zag med na /
analyzed: gang la mi mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug la ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa gcig la ji mthol de'i 'og tu dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug ba ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya'o // ltung ba ming las mi mthun pa'i gang zag med na /
translated: The person to whom one confesses and in front of whom one confesses is a fully ordained monk who is a fellow Buddhist, who is present within the same boundary, who is of the same view and of the same class, and who is not a person with whom one is quarreling.🔽If there is no such person, then one should confess in front of a fully ordained monk who is a fellow Buddhist, who is present within the same boundary, who is of the same view and of the same class, but who is not a person with whom one is not quarreling.

original: ltung ba rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
translated: If there is no such person, then one should confess in front of a fully ordained monk who is a fellow Buddhist, who is present within the same boundary, who is of the same view and of the same class, but who is a person with whom one is not quarreling.

original: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
translated: Here, “name” refers to the class of downfalls.

original: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
translated: “Class” refers to the type of downfall that has occurred.

original: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta ba can mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta ba can mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa dang /
translated: “This Dharma” refers to nuns, those who have received the purificatory fast precepts, female novices, male and female novices, laymen and laywomen who are followers of the Tathāgata, and householders who are within the same boundary.

original: lta ba mi mthun pa mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dag go //
analyzed: lta ba mi mthun pa mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dag go //
translated: “Different views” refers to those who are within a different boundary.

original: 'dir de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mthol na bcab par ni mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mthol na bcab par ni mi 'gyur la /
translated: Here, if one confesses to those who have different characteristics, it is not concealed.

original: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is a wrong action.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag la mthol na bcab par ni mi 'gyur la /🔽gnas ngan len rig par byed pa las ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag la mthol na bcab par ni mi 'gyur la / gnas ngan len rig par byed pa las ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses to those who have not received full ordination, it is not concealed.🔽If one makes a confession to those who are aware of the negative tendencies, it is a downfall.

original: gnas ngan len ma yin pa rig par byed pa las ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len ma yin pa rig par byed pa las ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a confession to those who are not aware of the negative tendencies, it is a wrong action.

original: chos 'di pa de dag gang yang rung ba mtshams gzhan du 'dug pa dang // lta ba mi mthun pa la mthol na bcab par ni mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos 'di pa de dag gang yang rung ba mtshams gzhan du 'dug pa dang // lta ba mi mthun pa la mthol na bcab par ni mi 'gyur la /
translated: If any of these people are in a different boundary, or if they have a different view, then there is no concealment.

original: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: But there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs par rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa la mthol na yang bcab par ni mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs par rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa la mthol na yang bcab par ni mi 'gyur la /
translated: If one confesses to a fully ordained monk who is not a natural monk, then there is no concealment.

original: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: But there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa @28b mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mthun pa la mthol na yang bcab par ni mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa @28b mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mthun pa la mthol na yang bcab par ni mi 'gyur la /
translated: If one confesses to a fully ordained monk who is a natural monk, who has the same view, who is in the same boundary, and whose offense has the same name and type, then there is no concealment.

original: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: But there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na bcab par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na bcab par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: If one confesses to a fully ordained monk who is a natural monk, who has the same view, who is in the same boundary, and whose offense has a different name and type, then there is no concealment.

original: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And there is no downfall.

original: 'og ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'og ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the other downfalls.

original: ltung ba mthol ba la spyir bstan pa ni mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par brjod par bya'o //🔽mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod par ma nus na tha na ming ngam /
analyzed: ltung ba mthol ba la spyir bstan pa ni mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par brjod par bya'o // mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod par ma nus na tha na ming ngam /
translated: The general confession is to recite the confession formula completely.

original: rigs gcig go bar byas nas yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs gcig go bar byas nas yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is unable to recite the entire confession formula, then one should confess by saying the name or the class of the downfall.

original: bshags pa'i sngags ni rdzogs par brjod dgos so //🔽nyes byas mthol ba la ni ming dang rigs lam brjod par bdag la ltung ba byung ngo zhe'am /
analyzed: bshags pa'i sngags ni rdzogs par brjod dgos so // nyes byas mthol ba la ni ming dang rigs lam brjod par bdag la ltung ba byung ngo zhe'am /
translated: The confession formula must be recited completely.

original: bdag gis kha na ma tho ba byas so zhes bya ba rnam pa gang yang rung bas rig par byas na yang rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis kha na ma tho ba byas so zhes bya ba rnam pa gang yang rung bas rig par byas na yang rung ngo //
translated: For a minor infraction, one should confess by saying the name or the class of the infraction, or by saying, “I have incurred a downfall,” or “I have done something wrong.”

original: phan par 'gyur ba'i dngos gzhi ma gtogs pa sbyor ba dang nyes byas la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan thams cad la yang bcabs pa yod na sngar bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos par bya zhing /
analyzed: phan par 'gyur ba'i dngos gzhi ma gtogs pa sbyor ba dang nyes byas la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan thams cad la yang bcabs pa yod na sngar bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos par bya zhing /
translated: In the case of all other downfalls, except for the actual basis of an infraction that is helpful to sentient beings, if there is concealment, one should first amend the infraction of concealment.

original: phyis ltung ba nyid phyir bcos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis ltung ba nyid phyir bcos par shes par bya'o //
translated: Later, the downfall itself should be recognized and restored.

original: bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos pa ni ltung ba ming dang rigs gang byung ba dang ; ji srid bcabs pa de gnyis ji mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos pa ni ltung ba ming dang rigs gang byung ba dang ; ji srid bcabs pa de gnyis ji mthol bar bya'o //
translated: The restoration of the fault of concealment is as follows: The name and type of the downfall and the length of the concealment are confessed.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma la ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod na spo ba zhes bya ba'i las kyis de med par bya dgos so //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma la ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod na spo ba zhes bya ba'i las kyis de med par bya dgos so //
translated: If the downfall is a partially concordant one, the monk must perform the ceremony called “relinquishment of the downfalls” in order to eliminate the fault of concealment.

original: mthol ba dang bshags par bya ba'i skabs yod bzhin du mi mthol mi 'chags na zhag re nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthol ba dang bshags par bya ba'i skabs yod bzhin du mi mthol mi 'chags na zhag re nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If the monk does not confess and reveal the downfall while there is an opportunity to do so, he commits an offense of wrong conduct for each day that he remains silent.

original: gang la mthol ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa yod na chos 'di pa gzhan la mthol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la mthol ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa yod na chos 'di pa gzhan la mthol bar mi bya'o //
translated: The person to whom the downfall is confessed should be a fully ordained monk who is in a natural state, whose view and discipline are the same as one’s own, and who is present within the same boundary. If the downfall is of a different name or type, the downfall should not be confessed to another monk who is a follower of the same doctrine.

original: bshags par ni chos 'di pa gzhan la rnam pa thams cad du mi bya'o //
analyzed: bshags par ni chos 'di pa gzhan la rnam pa thams cad du mi bya'o //
translated: The downfall should never be confessed to another person who is not a follower of this doctrine.

original: de ltar ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo dang / sbyor ba nyes byas dang / dngos gzhi phyir bcos pa'i chog dang sngags de dag ni ltung byed dgu bcu po thams cad dang ci rigs par sbyar te /
analyzed: de ltar ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo dang / sbyor ba nyes byas dang / dngos gzhi phyir bcos pa'i chog dang sngags de dag ni ltung byed dgu bcu po thams cad dang ci rigs par sbyar te /
translated: Thus, the minor infractions of preparation of the downfalls, the infractions of preparation, the rites of amendment of the actual basis, and the mantras are to be applied in the appropriate manner to all ninety downfalls.

original: bye brag tu na ltung ba'i ste tshan gyi ming dang / gang byung ba'i rigs tha dad pa @29a * //
analyzed: bye brag tu na ltung ba'i ste tshan gyi ming dang / gang byung ba'i rigs tha dad pa @29a * //
translated: In particular, the names of the classes of downfalls and the different types of downfalls that occur are to be mentioned individually.

original: so sor smos par bya ba'i chog gzhan thams cad ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: so sor smos par bya ba'i chog gzhan thams cad ni 'dra'o //
translated: All the other rites are the same.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed de dang po bshad zin to /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed de dang po bshad zin to /
translated: The first downfall of lying has already been explained.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Compendium of Discipline, a commentary on the Sutra of Individual Liberation,

original: bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: PART 19

original: skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the downfall of speaking of faults: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde dag dge slong rnams la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde dag dge slong rnams la 'di lta ste /
translated: At that time, the group of six monks spoke to the monks in this way:

original: zhar ba dag / theng po dag / smad 'chal dag / lag sor rdum po dag / sgur po dag / mi'u thung dag / wa ba can dag /
analyzed: zhar ba dag / theng po dag / smad 'chal dag / lag sor rdum po dag / sgur po dag / mi'u thung dag / wa ba can dag /
translated: “You are blind, you are lame, you are crippled, you have deformed fingers, you are hunchbacked, you are short, you have a goiter,

original: lkugs pa dag /
analyzed: lkugs pa dag /
translated: you are mute,🔽you are deaf, you are paralyzed, you are crippled, you are lame, you have a cleft lip, you have a large head.”

original: 'on pa dag / rten 'phye dag / rkang bam dag / gyol po dag / mchu 'phyangs dag / mgo bo che dag ces mi'i skyon nas smra ba kun tu spyod par byed do //
analyzed: 'on pa dag / rten 'phye dag / rkang bam dag / gyol po dag / mchu 'phyangs dag / mgo bo che dag ces mi'i skyon nas smra ba kun tu spyod par byed do //
translated: They made a practice of speaking about the faults of people.

original: des dge slong dag spa gong ba dang / gzengs dma' ba dang / zhum par gyur nas /
analyzed: des dge slong dag spa gong ba dang / gzengs dma' ba dang / zhum par gyur nas /
translated: The monks became discouraged, their spirits were low, and they became depressed.

original: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas btang zhing /
analyzed: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas btang zhing /
translated: They gave up receiving teachings, reading, reciting, practicing, keeping things in mind, and the inner mental practice of shamatha.

original: sdug bsngal dang yu di mi bde ba mang bar gnas nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yu di mi bde ba mang bar gnas nas /
translated: They remained in a state of much suffering and unhappiness.

original: dge slong di nyung du dag smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong di nyung du dag smod par byed /
translated: A few monks criticized them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and they were ridiculed.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.🔽Then the Blessed One, with this event and this basis, convened a gathering of the saṅgha of monks and asked the group of six:

original: drug sde dag la smras nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la smras nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: “Is it true, as they say, that you monks have been criticizing other monks?”🔽“It is true, Blessed One.”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: The Blessed One rebuked them, “Foolish men, it is not suitable, it is not proper, it is not worthy of a renunciant, it is not allowable, it is not to be done.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags dag kyang skyon nas smra bas kun du spyad pa na byams pa'i rgyun gcod par byed na mi rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags dag kyang skyon nas smra bas kun du spyad pa na byams pa'i rgyun gcod par byed na mi rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Even animals born in the animal realm, when they engage in criticizing others, cut off the stream of love, so what need is there to speak of humans?”🔽Having spoken in this way about the past,

original: zhes sngon byung ba'i bka' mchi dag bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: zhes sngon byung ba'i bka' mchi dag bka' stsal nas /
translated: he said this:

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he established the training rules for my disciples in the Vinaya.

original: mi'i skyon nas smra ba na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: mi'i skyon nas smra ba na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If you speak of a person's faults, you commit an offense.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The person is the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni ngag yang dag par ma bsdams pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni ngag yang dag par ma bsdams pa /
translated: The affliction is not restraining one's speech.

original: @29b nyes pa ni mi'i skyon nas smra ba'o //
analyzed: @29b nyes pa ni mi'i skyon nas smra ba'o //
translated: The fault is speaking of a person's faults.

original: de la mi'i skyon nas smra na zhes bya ba ni mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i bsams pas ngag dang / tshig dang / tha snyad dang / skad dang / brjod pa dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / tshig gi lam dang / tshig gi sgra dang /
analyzed: de la mi'i skyon nas smra na zhes bya ba ni mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i bsams pas ngag dang / tshig dang / tha snyad dang / skad dang / brjod pa dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / tshig gi lam dang / tshig gi sgra dang /
translated: There, if you speak of a person's faults means if, with the intention to speak of a person's faults, you speak with speech, words, expressions, sounds, statements, definitions, paths of speech, sounds of speech,

original: ngang gi las dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed smra ba'o /
analyzed: ngang gi las dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed smra ba'o /
translated: actions of speech, and verbal intimation.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: You commit an offense is as before.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit an offense?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang // phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya //🔽de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba je rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dge slong gi skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pas tshig 'jam pos kyang rung /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang // phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya // de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba je rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dge slong gi skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pas tshig 'jam pos kyang rung /
translated: Here, the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the remedies should be understood through the main part, the preparation, and the preparation of the preparation.

original: rtsub pos kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rtsub pos kyang rung ste /
translated: Here, the presentation of the main part of the downfalls is as follows: A fully ordained monk who wishes to speak about the faults of another fully ordained monk, whether with gentle or harsh words,

original: skyon gyi rnam pa rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung bas smra na mi dga' ba nyid du ma gyur na yang skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon gyi rnam pa rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung bas smra na mi dga' ba nyid du ma gyur na yang skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: if he speaks with any of the aspects of fault that are not suitable, then even if the other person does not become displeased, he commits the actual downfall of speaking about faults.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa tsam ma nyams pa nyid kyi yul la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa tsam ma nyams pa nyid kyi yul la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault for a fully ordained monk who is merely newly fully ordained.

original: skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung bas brjod pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung bas brjod pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in speaking with any intention of expressing a fault.

original: tshig 'jam rtsub gang yang rung bas brjod pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: tshig 'jam rtsub gang yang rung bas brjod pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in speaking with either gentle or harsh words.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni skyon rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smras pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni skyon rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smras pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: The agent of this is one who speaks with any intention of expressing a fault.

original: mi dga' ba nyid du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mi dga' ba nyid du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in speaking with either displeasure or pleasure.

original: gzhi gcig la du ma nyid bcas pa la na smad pa med do //🔽'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: gzhi gcig la du ma nyid bcas pa la na smad pa med do // 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: There is no fault in speaking with many words on a single topic.🔽The agent of this is one who speaks with any intention of expressing a fault.

original: skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pa dang / pha rol po dge slong nyid do //
analyzed: skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pa dang / pha rol po dge slong nyid do //
translated: The other is a fully ordained monk.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are five branches that constitute the actual downfall:

original: pha rol po dge slong nyid dang / skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pa dang / rang gi tshig gang yang rung ba dang / skyon rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smras pa dang / pha rol pos don go ba nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol po dge slong nyid dang / skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pa dang / rang gi tshig gang yang rung ba dang / skyon rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smras pa dang / pha rol pos don go ba nyid do //
translated: and the other person understands the meaning.

original: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽The downfall through association is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall through preparation is a minor infraction.

original: di srid du skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: di srid du skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: If one begins to speak about the faults of others, but does not reach the actual downfall, one commits a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o /
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o /
translated: For each of the preparations that one undertakes, one commits a minor infraction.

original: mi'i skyon nas smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du skyon nas smra bar bya'o snyam pa ni sbyor ba yin pas de la @30a * //
analyzed: mi'i skyon nas smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du skyon nas smra bar bya'o snyam pa ni sbyor ba yin pas de la @30a * //
translated: If one wishes to speak about the faults of others, but thinks, “I will speak about their faults,” this is the preparation.

original: nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyes byas so //
translated: Therefore, this is a minor infraction.

original: mi'i 'gro ba pa ni tha snyad du byas pa nyid kyi yan lag yin pas mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba pa ni tha snyad du byas pa nyid kyi yan lag yin pas mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa la nyes byas so //
translated: Since the human being is a limb that is conventionally designated, there is an offense of wrong conduct for a human being who is not a human being.

original: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
translated: If it is an animal, it is reprehensible.

original: rnam par rig byed la ni don go ba nyid yan lag yin pas nyan pa po rang bzhin nyams pa la sogs pas don ma go ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed la ni don go ba nyid yan lag yin pas nyan pa po rang bzhin nyams pa la sogs pas don ma go ba la nyes byas so //
translated: Since the understanding of the meaning is the limb of the expression, there is an offense of wrong conduct for not understanding the meaning due to the listener's degeneration of nature and so on.

original: khyim pa dang phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba nyams pa dang / mtshan mi mthun pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: khyim pa dang phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba nyams pa dang / mtshan mi mthun pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for those who are householders, for those who are renunciates of other religions, for those who are renunciates of this religion but have degenerated, for those who have the wrong gender, and for those who are not fully ordained.

original: skyon rung ba ma yin par bsams pa las gzhan la rgyal rigs nyid dang bram ze nyid la sogs pa dag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: skyon rung ba ma yin par bsams pa las gzhan la rgyal rigs nyid dang bram ze nyid la sogs pa dag la nyes byas so //
translated: If one thinks that the fault is not suitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct for others who are of the royal caste, the priestly caste and so on.

original: skyon ma yin pa tshig kyal ba 'ba' zhig smra ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: skyon ma yin pa tshig kyal ba 'ba' zhig smra ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the fault is not a fault, there is an offense of wrong conduct for speaking only frivolous speech.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of preparation is a subtle offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: There are as many applications of the application as there are applications.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed byas phra mo'o //
translated: The application of the application of the misdeed is that many.

original: ltung ba med pa ni skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pas bstod pa'i phyogs la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pas bstod pa'i phyogs la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for one who is not inclined to speak of faults, but who is inclined to praise.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one whose mind is disturbed, or for one who is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not relying on speaking of faults in all situations and in all countries.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed de gyis pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed de gyis pa bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of speaking of faults has been explained.

original: // / phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall of divisive speech🔽The origin story for the downfall of divisive speech is this.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde dag dge slong rnams la phra mas kun du spyod par byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde dag dge slong rnams la phra mas kun du spyod par byed de /
translated: At that time, the group of six monks were slandering the monks.

original: des dge slong dag spa gong ba dang / gzengs dma' ba dang / zhum par gyur nas lung mnod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha to na dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
analyzed: des dge slong dag spa gong ba dang / gzengs dma' ba dang / zhum par gyur nas lung mnod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha to na dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
translated: Because of that, the monks became anxious, discouraged, and depressed, and they gave up their study, recitation, discussion, practice, mental engagement, and inner mental tranquility.

original: 'di ltar dus yun ring po nas nye bar bsags pa chos dang ldan pa'i gcugs pa'i rgyun yang gcod par byed nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dus yun ring po nas nye bar bsags pa chos dang ldan pa'i gcugs pa'i rgyun yang gcod par byed nas /

translated: At that time, the group-of-six monks knew that the Saṅgha had settled a legal issue according to the Dharma,🔽but they reopened it, saying, “This legal issue has not been settled by resolution, nor has it been settled by good resolution. It should be settled by resolution.🔽This legal issue has not been examined, nor has it been examined well. It should be examined.

analyzed: rtsod pa 'di ni nye bar ma zhi ba dang / legs par nye bar ma zhi ba yin gyi yang nye bar zhi bar bya'o zhes yang las kyis skyo sngogs byed de /

analyzed: dge slong dag yang dang yang du rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar byed pa na /

analyzed: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la byang dang / nang gi sems kyi zhe gnas gzhan gtong bar byed nas /

original: dge slong don nyung du dag smod par byed /

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /

analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa /

analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: This is not the conduct of one who has gone forth.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /

analyzed: mthun pas zhes bya ba ni @32a * //
translated: “In agreement” means

analyzed: chos bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba dang / ston pa'i bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: “In accordance with the Dharma” means in accordance with the Dharma, the monastic code, and the Teacher’s instructions.

original: ma dum zhing gang gi cho de dag 'thab pa'i tsho gcig la gcig skur pa yang 'de bas shing ;🔽'dum pa'i tshe phebs par yang smra ste /🔽tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la smod par byed /

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /

original: dge slong ges bud med la chos bsten par mi bya ba dang / tshig lngas chos bstan par bya ba dang / tshig drug gis chos bstan par bya ba dang / skyes pa gzhag ste ji tsam 'dod par chos bstan par bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong ges bud med la chos bsten par mi bya ba dang / tshig lngas chos bstan par bya ba dang / tshig drug gis chos bstan par bya ba dang / skyes pa gzhag ste ji tsam 'dod par chos bstan par bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa dang /
translated: Thinking this, the Buddha said, “Monks should not teach Dharma to women, they should teach Dharma with five words, they should teach Dharma with six words, and they should teach Dharma to the extent they wish, leaving out the men.”

original: drug sde dag gis khyi dang / spre'u dang / be'u dang / phyi rgan du nyal ba dang / gog pa dang / khye'u dag drung du gzhag ste /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis khyi dang / spre'u dang / be'u dang / phyi rgan du nyal ba dang / gog pa dang / khye'u dag drung du gzhag ste /

original: ji tsam 'dod par dud med la chos ston cing /
analyzed: ji tsam 'dod par dud med la chos ston cing /

original: des rlom pa dang / khengs par byed nas dge slong don nyung ngu dag smod par byed /
analyzed: des rlom pa dang / khengs par byed nas dge slong don nyung ngu dag smod par byed /

original: phyar ka gtong par byed /

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol te //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng bzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng bzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Teacher, convened a saṅgha of monks due to this event, this cause, this occurrence, and this situation.

original: drug sde dag la @34a * //
analyzed: drug sde dag la @34a * //
translated: He rebuked the group of six monks,

original: smras nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: smras nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not proper,🔽it is not worthy of a renunciant,🔽it is not allowable,🔽it is not to be done.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad do //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad do //

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang bud med la tshig lnga'am /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang bud med la tshig lnga'am /
translated: “Therefore, monks, you should recite this training rule:

analyzed: drug la lhag par chos ston na rig pa'i skyes pa ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk teaches more than five or six words of the Dharma to a woman, except when there is a knowledgeable man present, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni 'char ka /
analyzed: gang zag ni 'char ka /

original: nyon mongs pa ni sred pa /🔽nyes pa ni bud med la rig pa'i skyes pa med par tshig lnga'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni sred pa / nyes pa ni bud med la rig pa'i skyes pa med par tshig lnga'am /

analyzed: drug lhag par chos ston na / de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am /
translated: The offense was to teach more than five or six words of Dharma to a woman who was not a relative.🔽The words were:

analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //

original: bud med la zhes bya ba ni bud med gzhon nu ma legs nu ma legs par smra ba dang / nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par nus pa la'o //
analyzed: bud med la zhes bya ba ni bud med gzhon nu ma legs nu ma legs par smra ba dang / nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par nus pa la'o //

original: tshig lnga'am / drug las lhag par zhes bya ba ni tshig lngas chos ston pa na bsams bzhin du tshig drug las thal bar byed pa dang / tshig drug gis chos bstan pa na yang bsams bzhin du tshig bdun pa las thal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig lnga'am / drug las lhag par zhes bya ba ni tshig lngas chos ston pa na bsams bzhin du tshig drug las thal bar byed pa dang / tshig drug gis chos bstan pa na yang bsams bzhin du tshig bdun pa las thal bar byed pa'o //
translated: “More than five or six words” means that if one teaches Dharma with five words, one should not intentionally exceed six words, and if one teaches Dharma with six words, one should not intentionally exceed seven words.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'am /

original: sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos kyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos kyis bshad pa'o //

original: ston na zhes bya ba ni 'chad na'o //

original: rig pa'i skyes pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i skyes pa gzhag ste'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i skyes pa gzhag ste'o //

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhen /

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //

translated: Here, the characteristics of the offense, the non-offense, the training, and the amendment should be understood through the basic offense, the preparation, and the preparation of the preparation.

analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gi khyim pa mo bud med dang / gzhon nu ma legs par smras pa dang / nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par nus pa la /

analyzed: gnas gcig tu sangs rgyas sam /

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni bud med dam gzhon nu ma legs par smras pa dang / nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par nus pa la chos tshig drug las lhag par ston pa la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni bud med dam gzhon nu ma legs par smras pa dang / nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par nus pa la chos tshig drug las lhag par ston pa la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is a woman or a girl who is able to understand the meaning of the well-spoken and badly-spoken teachings, and who is the one who is the chief in the perception of teaching more than six words.

analyzed: 'di la yan lag drug gis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: shes bzhin du ston pa'o //

analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
