analyzed: dge slong mid 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong 'phral ba dang / dge slong ma gsal ma khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid na /
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready to appoint the monk so-and-so to inform the houses of the monks’ and nuns’ transgressions,

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang zag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang zag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing
translated: let the honorable ones consent. Those who do not consent, speak up. The Saṅgha has appointed the monk so-and-so to inform the houses.

original: gnang nas / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par bskos lags te /
analyzed: gnang nas / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par bskos lags te /
translated: The Saṅgha has appointed the monk so-and-so to inform the houses.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung ba de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung ba de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: The Blessed One remained silent, and so it was that the Blessed One assented.

original: dge slong khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa'i kun tu spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa'i kun tu spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The monks should act in accordance with the following points of proper conduct when visiting the houses of the faithful.

original: dge slong khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pas khyim rnams su 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pas khyim rnams su 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: When a monk visits the houses of the faithful, he should say the following:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyod nyon cig / khyim rnams su khyim sun par byed pa dang / gnas rnams su gnas sun par byed pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyod nyon cig / khyim rnams su khyim sun par byed pa dang / gnas rnams su gnas sun par byed pa 'di lta ste /
translated: “Venerable sirs, please listen! Those who cause trouble in the houses and those who cause trouble in the monasteries are like this:

original: dper na 'bras s'a lu'i zhing phun sum tshogs pa la ser ba'i 'khor lo mi bzad pa bab na de ltar 'bras s'a lu de nyid shin te ma dang / chud za ba dang / tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba dang / bur ma shing gi zhing phun sum tshogs pa la nad kyi rigs dmar po @39a * //
analyzed: dper na 'bras s'a lu'i zhing phun sum tshogs pa la ser ba'i 'khor lo mi bzad pa bab na de ltar 'bras s'a lu de nyid shin te ma dang / chud za ba dang / tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba dang / bur ma shing gi zhing phun sum tshogs pa la nad kyi rigs dmar po @39a * //
translated: For example, when a terrible hailstorm falls on a perfect field of rice, the rice is destroyed, wasted, and ruined in an improper way. When a red disease strikes a perfect sugarcane field, the sugarcane is destroyed, wasted, and ruined in an improper way. When a perfect field of rice is struck by a terrible hailstorm, the rice is destroyed, wasted, and ruined in an improper way. When a perfect sugarcane field is struck by a red disease, the sugarcane is destroyed, wasted, and ruined in an improper way. In the same way, those who cause trouble in the houses and those who cause trouble in the monasteries are destroyed, wasted, and ruined in an improper way.

original: zhes bya ba byung na 'di ltar bu ram shing de nyid shin te ma dang / chud za ba dang / tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba lta bu dag yod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba byung na 'di ltar bu ram shing de nyid shin te ma dang / chud za ba dang / tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba lta bu dag yod kyi /
translated: If they say, “It is so,” then they should be told, “It is just like that sugar cane being cut, wasted, and spoiled by improper methods.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag dge slong 'di dang dge slong ma 'dis bstan pa'i tshod ma 'dzin cig /'di ltar dge slong 'di dag dge slong ma 'di ni yos tshig pa bzhin du chos 'dul ba 'di la skyer mi rung ba'i chos can yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag dge slong 'di dang dge slong ma 'dis bstan pa'i tshod ma 'dzin cig /'di ltar dge slong 'di dag dge slong ma 'di ni yos tshig pa bzhin du chos 'dul ba 'di la skyer mi rung ba'i chos can yin gyi /
translated: Venerable ones, do not take the word of this monk and this nun, because just like a burnt seed, these monks and this nun are unfit for this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang / gnas brtan kun shes koondi n+ya dang / rlangs pa dang / rta thul dang / bzang ldan dang / ming chen dang / gnas brtan grags pa dang / gang po dang / dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bzangs dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang / gnas brtan kun shes koondi n+ya dang / rlangs pa dang / rta thul dang / bzang ldan dang / ming chen dang / gnas brtan grags pa dang / gang po dang / dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bzangs dang /
translated: The Blessed One, the elder Ājñātakauṇḍinya, Śreṇika, Aśvaka, Bhadrika, Mahānāman, the elder Yaśas, Pūrṇa, Vimala, Gavāṃpati, Subāhu,

original: sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gi bu chen po dang / gsus po che chen po dang / skul byed chen po dang / k'a ty'a'i bu chen po dang / lteng rgyas 'od srungs dang / chu klu 'od srungs dang / ga ya 'od srungs dang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gi bu chen po dang / gsus po che chen po dang / skul byed chen po dang / k'a ty'a'i bu chen po dang / lteng rgyas 'od srungs dang / chu klu 'od srungs dang / ga ya 'od srungs dang /
translated: Śāriputra, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Mahākauṣṭhila, Mahākapphiṇa, Mahācunda, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, Nadī-Kāśyapa, Gayā-Kāśyapa,

original: 'gab ma 'od srungs dang / 'ong srungs chen po dang / dga' byed dang / kim pi li dang / legs skyes dang / nam gru dang / sa ri dang / nye sde dang / som nyi nam gru dang / lam bstan dang / lam phran bstan dang /
analyzed: 'gab ma 'od srungs dang / 'ong srungs chen po dang / dga' byed dang / kim pi li dang / legs skyes dang / nam gru dang / sa ri dang / nye sde dang / som nyi nam gru dang / lam bstan dang / lam phran bstan dang /
translated: Urubilvā-Kāśyapa, Mahā-Kāśyapa, Nanda, Kimbila, Upasena, Revata, Śāriputra, Ānanda, Somā-Revata, Māgandiya, Khadiravanika,🔽Mahā-Kappina, Bhadra, and Bāṣpa.

original: brtag pa'i shing rta dang / chen po pa dang / grags byin dang / de dag la sogs pa dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams la ltos shig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brtag pa'i shing rta dang / chen po pa dang / grags byin dang / de dag la sogs pa dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams la ltos shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Look at these and other elder monks.”

original: dge slong khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa de khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed du song ba dang / dge slong 'phral bas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba dang / de khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed par bskos so zhes thos nas /
analyzed: dge slong khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa de khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed du song ba dang / dge slong 'phral bas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba dang / de khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed par bskos so zhes thos nas /
translated: to be the messenger to announce the invitation to the houses.

original: de de'i gan du song nas smras pa /🔽khyod khyim rnams su kho bo sun 'byin du 'gro'am /
analyzed: de de'i gan du song nas smras pa / khyod khyim rnams su kho bo sun 'byin du 'gro'am /
translated: He went to him and said,

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: “Are you going to the houses to announce the invitation to humiliate me?”

original: dge 'dun gyi chos dang ldan pa'i bka' bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi chos dang ldan pa'i bka' bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “I must carry out the Saṅgha’s lawful order.”

original: kho bos de dang de byar rung na /
analyzed: kho bos de dang de byar rung na /
translated: “If I can do this and that,🔽why shouldn’t I cut open your belly, fill your intestines with excrement, and wrap them around the Jetavana, and hang your head at the gate of the Jetavana like a vessel of oil?”

original: khyod kyi lto dral te rgyu ma dag gis rgyal byed kyi tshal dkri bar bya ba dang / mgo yang 'bru mar gyi snod bzhin du rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgor dpyang la gdags par ci ma rung ba ci yod ces zer nas dge slong des dge slong rnams la 'phral bas bdag spyos te /
analyzed: khyod kyi lto dral te rgyu ma dag gis rgyal byed kyi tshal dkri bar bya ba dang / mgo yang 'bru mar gyi snod bzhin du rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgor dpyang la gdags par ci ma rung ba ci yod ces zer nas dge slong des dge slong rnams la 'phral bas bdag spyos te /
translated: The monk told the monks what Pūraṇa had said.

original: de na re de skad zer gyis bdag khyim rnam su so sor go bar byed par mi spro'o zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis @39b bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de na re de skad zer gyis bdag khyim rnam su so sor go bar byed par mi spro'o zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis @39b bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag mi gti mug can des gang zag ni gsod par nus kyi dge 'dun ni mi nus pas de'i phyir dge 'dun gyis khyim rnams su so sor go bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag mi gti mug can des gang zag ni gsod par nus kyi dge 'dun ni mi nus pas de'i phyir dge 'dun gyis khyim rnams su so sor go bar bya'o //
translated: “Monks, that foolish man can kill an individual but not the saṅgha. Therefore the saṅgha should go to the houses to inform them individually.

original: 'di ltar so sor go bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor go bar bya ste /
translated: This is how you should inform them individually.

original: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o//
analyzed: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o//
translated: You should perform the proclamation procedure.

original: de yang 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: You should do it like this.

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas /
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas /
translated: You should prepare the seats and arrange the drinking water for washing.🔽You should ring the bell and make an announcement to the monks with the words of inquiry.

original: gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par 'gyur ba la /
translated: When the entire saṅgha is present and agrees,

original: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te /
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te /
translated: a single monk should make the proclamation.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: ‘Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong 'phral ba 'di dang / dge slong ma gsal ma 'di ci nas kyang skye bo phal po che'i tshogs ma dad par rig par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyim rnams su spyod par bgyid de /🔽dge slong 'phral ba dang / dge slong ma gsal ma ci nas kyang skye bo phal po che'i tshogs ma dad par rig par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyim rnams su spyod par bgyid kyang /
analyzed: dge slong 'phral ba 'di dang / dge slong ma gsal ma 'di ci nas kyang skye bo phal po che'i tshogs ma dad par rig par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyim rnams su spyod par bgyid de / dge slong 'phral ba dang / dge slong ma gsal ma ci nas kyang skye bo phal po che'i tshogs ma dad par rig par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyim rnams su spyod par bgyid kyang /
translated: “This monk Bhadrika and this nun Prasenā are acting in such a way that the great multitude of people will know that they are not faithful.🔽Although this monk Bhadrika and this nun Prasenā are acting in such a way that the great multitude of people will know that they are not faithful,

original: dge slong 'phral ba dang / dge slong ma gsal ma khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par spro ba su yang ma mchis na /
analyzed: dge slong 'phral ba dang / dge slong ma gsal ma khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par spro ba su yang ma mchis na /
translated: no one is enthusiastic about having this monk Bhadrika and this nun Prasenā explain things in the houses.”

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong 'phral ba dang / dge slong ma gsal ma ci nas kyang skye bo phal po che'i tshogs ma dang par rig par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyim rnams su spyod par bgyid pa gang gis mthong zhing gang du mthong ba des khyim der khyed dge slong 'di dang /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong 'phral ba dang / dge slong ma gsal ma ci nas kyang skye bo phal po che'i tshogs ma dang par rig par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyim rnams su spyod par bgyid pa gang gis mthong zhing gang du mthong ba des khyim der khyed dge slong 'di dang /
translated: If the time is right for the Saṅgha and it is agreeable to you, then the Saṅgha should give permission for the Saṅgha to send the monk Upa and the nun Prasenajit to the houses to inform the people, ‘Whatever you see or have seen, in that house you should not take the measure of the teaching of this monk and this nun.

original: dge slong ma 'dis bstan pa'i tshod ma 'dzin cig dge slong 'di dang dge slong ma 'di ni yos tshig pa bzhin du chos 'dul ba 'di la skyer mi rung ba'i chos can yin gyi /
analyzed: dge slong ma 'dis bstan pa'i tshod ma 'dzin cig dge slong 'di dang dge slong ma 'di ni yos tshig pa bzhin du chos 'dul ba 'di la skyer mi rung ba'i chos can yin gyi /
translated: This monk and this nun are like a burnt seed, unfit to grow in this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gnas brten gnas brtan rnams la ltos shig ces so sor go bar bgyid du stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gnas brten gnas brtan rnams la ltos shig ces so sor go bar bgyid du stsal to //
translated: Look to the Blessed One and to the elder monks, the most senior monks.’

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis so sor rig pa'i khyim dag tu so sor go bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis so sor rig pa'i khyim dag tu so sor go bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “You should understand the houses that are known to you.”🔽When they did not understand the houses that were not known to them, and they understood the houses that were not known to them, they were deprived of alms.

original: de dag so sor ma rig pa dang / so sor ma rig pa'i khyim dag tu yang so sor go bar byed pa na de dag bsod snyoms kyis phongs par gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @40a * //
analyzed: de dag so sor ma rig pa dang / so sor ma rig pa'i khyim dag tu yang so sor go bar byed pa na de dag bsod snyoms kyis phongs par gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @40a * //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: pa ; so sor rig pa'i khyim dag tu so sor go bar bya'i /
analyzed: pa ; so sor rig pa'i khyim dag tu so sor go bar bya'i /
translated: “You should understand the houses that are known to you.

original: so sor ma rig pa'i khyim dag tu so sor go bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: so sor ma rig pa'i khyim dag tu so sor go bar mi bya ste /
translated: You should not understand the houses that are not known to you.

original: de lta bas na dge 'dun gyis gnang bam gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge 'dun gyis gnang bam gtogs so //
translated: Therefore, except for when the Saṅgha gives permission,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la ye byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mched mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la ye byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mched mdzad nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the humility of training, gave a discourse on the Dharma that was consistent with that, that was in harmony with that, and that was appropriate to that.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: “Monks, therefore, this is a new rule that I prescribe for you:

original: pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: The disciples of the Buddha should recite this training rule like this:

original: yang dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gnas ngan len gyis ltung ba brjod na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gnas ngan len gyis ltung ba brjod na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk tells a layperson about a monk’s downfall due to a serious offense, except if the Saṅgha has given permission, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is in Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
translated: The person is a follower of this doctrine.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There is no affliction or fault.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am /🔽gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am / gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, a monk refers to the group of six monks, or anyone else like them.

original: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A person who has not completed the preliminary duties refers to🔽anyone who has not completed the preliminary duties.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of preliminary duties:

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma'o //
translated: the preliminary duties of a monk and the preliminary duties of a nun.

original: de las gzhan pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Anyone other than those two is called a person who has not completed the preliminary duties.

original: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, a corrupting offense refers to

original: gnas ngan len ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len ni gnyis te /
translated: the two kinds of corrupting offenses:

original: pham par 'gyur ba kun nas slong ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma kun nas slong pa'o //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba kun nas slong ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma kun nas slong pa'o //
translated: the corrupting offense that is a basis for defeat, and the corrupting offense that is a basis for a serious offense.

original: ci'i phyir de dag gnas ngan len zhes bya zhe na ngo bo nyid las dang kun nas slong ba las so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gnas ngan len zhes bya zhe na ngo bo nyid las dang kun nas slong ba las so //
translated: Why are they called corrupting offenses? Because of their nature, because of the action, and because of the motivation.

original: ltung ba brjod na zhes bya ba ni smra na'o //
analyzed: ltung ba brjod na zhes bya ba ni smra na'o //
translated: If he mentions the downfall, he says it.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang bam gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis gnang ba gzhag sta'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang bam gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis gnang ba gzhag sta'o //
translated: Except if the Saṅgha has given permission means except if the Saṅgha has set aside the rule.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense of wrongdoing is as described above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here one should understand the characteristics of downfalls, their absence, the precepts, and their restoration, by means of the main part, the preparatory acts, and the subsequent part of an action.🔽Here, the main part of a downfall is to not be appointed by the saṅgha of monks to speak about the faults of a monk, and then to speak about a defeating offense or a partially defeating offense to someone who is not fully ordained.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong dge 'dun gyis gnas ngan len brjod par ma bskos pas nyan pa po bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la pham par 'gyur pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba mi shes pa nyid du @40b shes pa la pham par 'gyur ba dang /🔽dge 'dun lhag ma dag so so yang rung bsdus pa yang rung ba smras na /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong dge 'dun gyis gnas ngan len brjod par ma bskos pas nyan pa po bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la pham par 'gyur pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba mi shes pa nyid du @40b shes pa la pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dag so so yang rung bsdus pa yang rung ba smras na /
translated: If one speaks about the partially defeating offenses, either individually or collectively, to someone who is fully ordained, but who does not understand the subject, one commits a root downfall of the purificatory fast.

original: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzher 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzher 'gyur ro //
translated: If one speaks about the partially defeating offenses, either individually or collectively, to someone who is fully ordained and who understands the subject, one commits a serious violation of the purificatory fast.

original: ltung ba 'byin pa po'i dge slong dge 'dun gyis gnas ngan len brjod par ma bskos pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa po'i dge slong dge 'dun gyis gnas ngan len brjod par ma bskos pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk who is the accuser has not been appointed by the saṅgha to speak about the faults.

original: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i phyir dge 'dun la ma gsol ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i phyir dge 'dun la ma gsol ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he has not asked the saṅgha for permission to speak about the faults.

original: nyan pa po bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mi'i 'gro ba khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba mtshan dang lta ba mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyan pa po bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mi'i 'gro ba khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba mtshan dang lta ba mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the listener is not fully ordained, or is a human being, or is a layperson, or is a renunciant, or is of the same gender and views as the accuser.

original: nyan ba bos snga nas dge slong gis pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i ltung ba mi shes pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyan ba bos snga nas dge slong gis pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i ltung ba mi shes pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the listener has not previously been told by the monk that there are downfalls called “defeats” and “residual faults.”

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dag so so yang rung bsdus pa yang rung ba lan smad pa med do //🔽de gnyis gang yang rung ba rang gis smras pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dag so so yang rung bsdus pa yang rung ba lan smad pa med do // de gnyis gang yang rung ba rang gis smras pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the listener has not been told that there are individual and collective downfalls called “defeats” and “residual faults.”

original: de gnyis so sor yang rung /
analyzed: de gnyis so sor yang rung /
translated: There is no offense if the listener has been told by the accuser that he has committed either of these two kinds of downfalls.

original: bsdus par yang rung /
analyzed: bsdus par yang rung /
translated: There is no offense if the listener has been told that there are individual and collective downfalls.🔽There is no offense if the listener has been told that there are individual and collective downfalls called “defeats” and “residual faults.”

original: sbyor ba gcig gis tshig gcig tu yang smras pa la ni don du ma yod kyang dngos gzhi gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis tshig gcig tu yang smras pa la ni don du ma yod kyang dngos gzhi gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: Although many meanings are expressed in a single word by a single application, there is no fault in positing a single actual basis.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni nyan pa po bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba mi shes pa nyid la 'dun shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni nyan pa po bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba mi shes pa nyid la 'dun shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The listener who is not fully ordained is the principal agent in not knowing the offense entailing expulsion or the offense of partial defeat.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are five branches that constitute the actual basis:🔽The bhikṣu is not appointed by the saṅgha to speak about the faults.🔽The listener is not fully ordained and does not know the faults.

original: dge slong dge 'dun gyis gnas ngan len brjod par ma bskos pa dang / des nyan pa po bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa gnas ngan len mi shes pa nyid du shes pa dang / nyan pa po ma'i 'gro ba pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun gyis gnas ngan len brjod par ma bskos pa dang / des nyan pa po bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa gnas ngan len mi shes pa nyid du shes pa dang / nyan pa po ma'i 'gro ba pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dang /
translated: The listener is not fully ordained.

original: gnas ngan len pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dag so so'am /
analyzed: gnas ngan len pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dag so so'am /
translated: The faults are either an offense entailing expulsion or an offense of partial defeat.

original: bsdus pa gang yang rung ba smas pa dang / pha rol pos don go ba'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa gang yang rung ba smas pa dang / pha rol pos don go ba'o //
translated: The act is complete when either of the two has been said and the other person understands the meaning.

original: de dag pas yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag pas yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If the act is incomplete in any of these ways, the offense is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du gnas ngan len brjod pa'i lhung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du gnas ngan len brjod pa'i lhung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The preparatory stage of a downfall is a minor infraction. It is a minor infraction to begin the preparatory stage of a downfall that requires confession and is to be remedied by acknowledgment, and to continue in that state until the actual downfall is committed.

original: dngos gzhi sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each preparatory act that is distinct from the actual downfall, there is a minor infraction.

original: nyan pa po mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyan pa po mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the person to whom one is confessing is not human, the offense is a minor infraction.

original: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //🔽@41a * // pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i gnas ngan len las gzhan pa'i ltung ba brjod pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do // @41a * // pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i gnas ngan len las gzhan pa'i ltung ba brjod pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the person is an animal, the offense is a serious infraction.🔽If one confesses a downfall that is not a defeating offense or a serious violation, the offense is a minor infraction.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gnas ngan len brjod pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gnas ngan len brjod pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one confesses the faults of a person who has not taken full ordination, the offense is a minor infraction.

original: bden par smras pa la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: bden par smras pa la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur gyis /
translated: This minor infraction applies only if the confession is true.

original: brdzun du smras na ni ltung ba gzhan smras pa yang yin no //
analyzed: brdzun du smras na ni ltung ba gzhan smras pa yang yin no //
translated: If one lies, one also commits the other downfalls.

original: pha rol pos don ma go ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: pha rol pos don ma go ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person does not understand the meaning, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall through preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations of the preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation of the preparation is also a minor offense, a minor offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge 'dun gyis gnas ngan len brjod par bskos pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge 'dun gyis gnas ngan len brjod par bskos pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one is appointed by the saṅgha to speak about the faults of a monk who is misbehaving.

original: dge 'dun la gsol ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun la gsol ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one is requesting something from the saṅgha.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall for a beginner, or for one who is insane, deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gi yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gi yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule to be trained in is that in all circumstances, with regard to all the topics of the fully ordained monks, one should train in not relying on the downfalls that are the expression of negative tendencies.

original: dge 'dun gyis dge slong dang dge slong ma sdig pa can dag khyim du so sor go bar byed pa'i dge slong spro bar byas te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis dge slong dang dge slong ma sdig pa can dag khyim du so sor go bar byed pa'i dge slong spro bar byas te /
translated: The Saṅgha should appoint a monk who is capable of making himself understood to the monks and nuns who are evildoers.

original: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsko bar bya'o//
analyzed: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsko bar bya'o//
translated: He should be appointed through a legal procedure consisting of an announcement and a single affirmative vote.🔽When making himself understood in the houses, the monk should say to those who are aware of the negative tendencies, ‘Venerables, listen!

original: khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pas dge slong gis gnas ngan len so sor rig pa dag tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed nyon cig / khyim rnams su khyim sun par byed pa dang / gnas rnams su gnas sun par byed pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pas dge slong gis gnas ngan len so sor rig pa dag tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed nyon cig / khyim rnams su khyim sun par byed pa dang / gnas rnams su gnas sun par byed pa 'di lta ste /
translated: This person who is creating a schism in the Saṅgha, who is creating a dispute in the Saṅgha, who is acting as an obstacle to the harmony of the Saṅgha, who is acting as an obstacle to the comfort of the Saṅgha, who is acting as an obstacle to the harmony and comfort of the Saṅgha, is creating displeasure for householders, is acting as an obstacle to the comfort of householders, is acting as an obstacle to the comfort of the Saṅgha, and is creating a dispute in the Saṅgha.

original: dper na 'bras s'a lu'i zhing phun sum tshogs pa la ser ba'i 'khor lo mi bzad pa bab na 'di ltar 'bras s'a lu de nyid shin te ma dang / chud za ba dang / tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba dang / bu ram shing gi zhing phun sum tshogs pa la nad kyi rigs dmar po zhes bya ba byung na 'di ltar bu ram shing de nyid shing de nyid shin te ma dang /
analyzed: dper na 'bras s'a lu'i zhing phun sum tshogs pa la ser ba'i 'khor lo mi bzad pa bab na 'di ltar 'bras s'a lu de nyid shin te ma dang / chud za ba dang / tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba dang / bu ram shing gi zhing phun sum tshogs pa la nad kyi rigs dmar po zhes bya ba byung na 'di ltar bu ram shing de nyid shing de nyid shin te ma dang /
translated: For example, if a terrible hailstorm were to fall on a perfect field of rice, the rice would be destroyed, lost, and ruined in an improper way.

original: chud za ba dang / tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba lta bu dag yod kyi /
analyzed: chud za ba dang / tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba lta bu dag yod kyi /
translated: If a disease called red rot were to occur in a perfect field of sugarcane, the sugarcane would be destroyed, lost, and ruined in an improper way.🔽Venerable ones, do not take the measure of the teaching by this monk and this nun.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag dge slong 'di dang dge slong ma 'dis bstan pa'i tshod ma 'dzin cig /'di ltar dge slong 'di dang / dge slong ma 'di ni yos tshig pa bzhin du chos 'dul ba 'di la skyer mi rung ba'i @41b chos can yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag dge slong 'di dang dge slong ma 'dis bstan pa'i tshod ma 'dzin cig /'di ltar dge slong 'di dang / dge slong ma 'di ni yos tshig pa bzhin du chos 'dul ba 'di la skyer mi rung ba'i @41b chos can yin gyi /
translated: This monk and this nun are unfit for this Dharma and Vinaya, like a burnt seed.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams la ltos shig ces smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams la ltos shig ces smra bar bya'o //
translated: You should look at the Blessed One and the most venerable of elders!🔽 If the monk who is to inform the houses is not eager to inform the houses, then all the monks should inform the houses, saying,

original: gal te dge slong khyim du so sor go bar byed pa khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed par mi spro na de'i tshe dge slong thams cad kyis dge slong dang dge slong ma 'di gnyis sdig can yin no zhes khyim du so sor go bar bya
analyzed: gal te dge slong khyim du so sor go bar byed pa khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed par mi spro na de'i tshe dge slong thams cad kyis dge slong dang dge slong ma 'di gnyis sdig can yin no zhes khyim du so sor go bar bya
translated: These two monks are wicked!

original: ba'i phyir / gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i phyir / gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o //
translated: The procedure is by a simple proclamation.

original: phyir bcos ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed de bdun pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed de bdun pa bshad zin to /
translated: The seventh downfall is explained.🔽The downfall of falsely accusing another of a serious offense

original: // / mi'i chos bla ma brngod pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can na /
analyzed: // / mi'i chos bla ma brngod pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can na /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed in Vaiśālī

original: spre'u rdzing gi 'gram khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzangs na bzhugs so //
analyzed: spre'u rdzing gi 'gram khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzangs na bzhugs so //
translated: in the pavilion in the grove of the mango garden.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis nya pa lnga brgya chu klung yid 'ong ldan la brten cing 'khod pa dag gis chu srin nya'i rigs gzung ba'i gleng gzhi las de dag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis nya pa lnga brgya chu klung yid 'ong ldan la brten cing 'khod pa dag gis chu srin nya'i rigs gzung ba'i gleng gzhi las de dag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad
translated: When the Bhagavān had the five hundred fishermen who lived on the banks of the beautiful river go forth and become fully ordained in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya,

original: nas / de dag gis dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: nas / de dag gis dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: they manifested arhatship.

original: de dag mu ge byung ba'i tshe nya pa'i grong gi nye 'khor du dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dag gis mi'i chos bla ma ji ltar thob pa nye du dag la brjod nas /
analyzed: de dag mu ge byung ba'i tshe nya pa'i grong gi nye 'khor du dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dag gis mi'i chos bla ma ji ltar thob pa nye du dag la brjod nas /
translated: When a famine occurred, they agreed to spend the rainy season near the village of the fishermen. They told their relatives about the higher human qualities they had attained.

original: 'jig rten ni yon tan la dga' ba yin pas nye du dag gis re zhig rang gi bu dag las kyang phrogs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni yon tan la dga' ba yin pas nye du dag gis re zhig rang gi bu dag las kyang phrogs te /
translated: Since the world delights in good qualities, the relatives stole from their own sons and🔽gave them to the arhats.

original: de dag la bsod snyoms legs par bstabs pas 'tshag brtas par gyur to //
analyzed: de dag la bsod snyoms legs par bstabs pas 'tshag brtas par gyur to //
translated: Since they were well provided for with alms, they became strong.

original: gang gi tshe dbyar 'das nas 'dus pa chen po'i tshe dge slong rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du 'dod ba'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong gang dag spong byed kyi grong du dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag ni
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbyar 'das nas 'dus pa chen po'i tshe dge slong rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du 'dod ba'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong gang dag spong byed kyi grong du dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag ni
translated: When the summer was over, at the time of the great assembly, the monks wanted to prostrate at the feet of the Blessed One. At that time, the venerable Ānanda saw that the monks who had taken a vow to stay in the rainy season in the town of Pāpā were

original: bsod snyoms kyis brel pas rid pa dang / nyam chung ba dang / rke ba dang / skoms pa dang / lus ma thob pa dang / pags pa dang / sha dang khrag bri bar mthong /
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyis brel pas rid pa dang / nyam chung ba dang / rke ba dang / skoms pa dang / lus ma thob pa dang / pags pa dang / sha dang khrag bri bar mthong /
translated: emaciated, weak, thin, thirsty, their bodies not well-developed, their skin, flesh, and blood dried up, because they were busy with alms.

original: dge slong gang dag nye ba'i grong gi nye 'khor du dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag ni bsod snyoms kyis brel ba med pas tsho ba dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag rgyas par mthong nas /
analyzed: dge slong gang dag nye ba'i grong gi nye 'khor du dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag ni bsod snyoms kyis brel ba med pas tsho ba dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag rgyas par mthong nas /
translated: He saw that the monks who had taken a vow to stay in the rainy season in the vicinity of the town of Upārikā were not busy with alms, and their bodies were well-developed, their skin, flesh, and blood plump.

original: de ci las gyur pa'i rgyu dris pa dang / de dag gis kyang rgyas par @42a * //
analyzed: de ci las gyur pa'i rgyu dris pa dang / de dag gis kyang rgyas par @42a * //
translated: He asked the cause of this, and they explained in detail.

original: smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' 'bos de dag la khyed cag gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden pa brjod du rung ngam zhes dris pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /🔽rung yang srid /
analyzed: smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' 'bos de dag la khyed cag gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden pa brjod du rung ngam zhes dris pa dang / de dag gis smras pa / rung yang srid /
translated: “Venerable Ānanda,” they replied, “is it permissible to speak of the higher perceptions of a human being to someone who has not completed the novitiate?”🔽“

original: mi rung yang srid de /
analyzed: mi rung yang srid de /
translated: It may be permissible or it may not be,” they said.🔽“We have spoken.”

original: 'di ltar bdag cag gis ni smras so zhes zer ba dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden pa brjod ces smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag cag gis ni smras so zhes zer ba dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden pa brjod ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: Those monks who were modest complained and criticized those monks, “How could monks speak of the higher perceptions of a human being to someone who has not completed the novitiate?”🔽They reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The Blessed One then assembled the community of monks and asked them,🔽“Monks, is it true that monks spoke of the higher perceptions of a human being to someone who has not completed the novitiate?”

original: chu klung yid 'ong ldan gyi 'gram na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams la rmas nas /
analyzed: chu klung yid 'ong ldan gyi 'gram na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams la rmas nas /
translated: He asked the monks who lived on the banks of the beautiful river.🔽

original: mi brtson pa dang mi sbyor ba dang ma brtags par sbyor ba rnam par smad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: mi brtson pa dang mi sbyor ba dang ma brtags par sbyor ba rnam par smad pa mdzad de /
translated: The Buddha asked the monks who lived on the banks of the beautiful river why they were not diligent, not applying themselves, and not practicing with analysis.

original: brtson pa dang sbyor ba dang / brtags te spyod pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /🔽bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas da'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste yang dge slong gang gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden pa smras na ltung byed do
analyzed: brtson pa dang sbyor ba dang / brtags te spyod pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas / bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas da'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste yang dge slong gang gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden pa smras na ltung byed do
translated: He criticized them and praised diligence, application, and practicing with analysis.🔽He saw ten benefits of establishing the precepts and said to his disciples, “You should recite the following basis of the training in the Vinaya:

original: zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk says that a person who has not completed the approach to full ordination has higher qualities that are beyond human beings, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni yangs pa can /
analyzed: yul ni yangs pa can /
translated: The location was Vaiśālī.

original: gang zag ni nya pa las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong dgra bcom pa lnga brgya /
analyzed: gang zag ni nya pa las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong dgra bcom pa lnga brgya /
translated: The person was five hundred monks who were arhats and who had gone forth from the occupation of fishing.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bas ma brtags pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bas ma brtags pa /
translated: The affliction was not purifying their latent tendencies, so they were not practicing with analysis.

original: nyes pa ni gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden pa smras pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden pa smras pa'o //
translated: The offense is speaking of the higher human state as true to a person who is not fully ordained.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: Here, “a bhikṣu” means a follower of this doctrine.

original: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni gnyis te /
translated: “To a person who is not fully ordained” means that there are two types of fully ordained people:

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma'o //
translated: bhikṣus and bhikṣuṇīs.

original: de las gzhan pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Those who are not these are not fully ordained.

original: mi'i chos bla ma zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi chos mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mi'i chos bla ma zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi chos mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: “The higher human state” means the human state of nirvāṇa.

original: de ni mi rnams kyis 'thob kyi /
analyzed: de ni mi rnams kyis 'thob kyi /
translated: This is attained by humans,

original: za ma dang ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa dag gis kyang mi 'thob na sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: za ma dang ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa dag gis kyang mi 'thob na sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not by eunuchs, neuters, or hermaphrodites, much less by hell beings, animals, or hungry ghosts.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i @42b khams pas gzugs kyi khams bla ma yin la /
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i @42b khams pas gzugs kyi khams bla ma yin la /
translated: “Higher” means that the form realm is higher than the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams pas gzugs med pa'i khams bla ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams pas gzugs med pa'i khams bla ma yin pa'o //
translated: The formless realm is higher than the form realm.

original: yang na mi'i chos zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa lnga dag go //
analyzed: yang na mi'i chos zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa lnga dag go //
translated: Or, the term “human dharma” refers to the five hindrances.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni de dag spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni de dag spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The term “higher” refers to the abandonment of those.

original: bden pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dngos po bden pa kho na yin pa'o//
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dngos po bden pa kho na yin pa'o//
translated: The term “truth” refers to the reality of that.

original: smra na zhes bya ba ni brjod na'o //
analyzed: smra na zhes bya ba ni brjod na'o //
translated: The term “if he says” means if he speaks.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The term “offense” means the same as before.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhen na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhen na /
translated: Here, what is the offense?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam bar gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam bar gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the offense should be understood by the characteristics of the basic offense, the preparatory act, the preparatory act of the preparatory act, the non-offense, the training, and the amendment.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis 'du shes ma bsgyur bar bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pa bden pa nyid gang zag bden pa ma mthong ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la brjod na mi'i chos bla ma
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis 'du shes ma bsgyur bar bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pa bden pa nyid gang zag bden pa ma mthong ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la brjod na mi'i chos bla ma
translated: Here, the actual basis of a downfall is as follows: If a fully ordained monk, without changing his perception, says to someone who is not fully ordained that he possesses the higher perceptions of a human being, that he has seen the truth, and that he is a person who has seen the truth, then he has committed the actual basis of the downfall of boasting about higher knowledge.

original: brjod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the actual basis of the downfall of boasting about higher knowledge.

original: mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed 'di dang / sngar smras pa'i pham par 'gyur ba'i rnam par bstan pa gzhan thams cad ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed 'di dang / sngar smras pa'i pham par 'gyur ba'i rnam par bstan pa gzhan thams cad ni 'dra'o //
translated: This downfall and all the other downfalls that are described as being causes for the loss of full ordination are similar.

original: khyad par du na snga ma ni 'du shes bsgyur te /🔽brdzun du smras pa dang / nyan pa po gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par du na snga ma ni 'du shes bsgyur te / brdzun du smras pa dang / nyan pa po gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The difference is that in the former case, one lies by changing one’s perception.

original: 'di ni 'du shes ma bsgyur bar bden par smras pa dang / nyan pa po bden pa ma mthong ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la smras na dngos gzhi rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes ma bsgyur bar bden par smras pa dang / nyan pa po bden pa ma mthong ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la smras na dngos gzhi rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In this case, the actual basis is established when one says something true without changing one’s perception, but the person who hears it has not seen the truth and is not fully ordained.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes ma bsgyur bar bden par snas pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes ma bsgyur bar bden par snas pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no offense if one does not change one’s perception, but speaks truthfully.

original: bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma gang yang rung ba dang ldan par smras pa la na smad pa med de//
analyzed: bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma gang yang rung ba dang ldan par smras pa la na smad pa med de//
translated: There is no offense if one claims to possess any of the higher knowledges of a human being.

original: mi'i chos bla ma dang de'i 'bras bu la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mi'i chos bla ma dang de'i 'bras bu la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one claims to possess the higher knowledge of a human being and its result.

original: nyan pa po mi'i 'gro ba po bden pa ma mthong ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyan pa po mi'i 'gro ba po bden pa ma mthong ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the listener is a human being, but has not seen the truth, or has not completed the preliminary stage of the rite of ordination.🔽The agent is a human being who has not seen the truth, or who has not completed the preliminary stage of the rite of ordination.🔽The basis is a human being who has not seen the truth, or who has not completed the preliminary stage of the rite of ordination.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni mi'i 'gro ba pa'i gang zag ni bden pa ma mthong ba dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / mi'i chos bla ma bden pa nyid do ;
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni mi'i 'gro ba pa'i gang zag ni bden pa ma mthong ba dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / mi'i chos bla ma bden pa nyid do ;
translated: The action is claiming to possess the higher knowledge of a human being.

original: ;'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te mi'i chos bla ma dang / bden pa nyid dang / nyan pa po mi'i 'gro ba bden pa ma mthong ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / rang gis brjod pa dang / pha rol pos don go ba'o //
analyzed: ;'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te mi'i chos bla ma dang / bden pa nyid dang / nyan pa po mi'i 'gro ba bden pa ma mthong ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / rang gis brjod pa dang / pha rol pos don go ba'o //
translated: The completion is the listener’s understanding of the meaning.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par @43a * //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par @43a * //
translated: If any of those are incomplete, one is respectively

original: na smad do //
analyzed: na smad do //
translated: censured.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: A downfall of transgression is a wrong doing.

original: ji srid du mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so /
analyzed: ji srid du mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so /
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the class of downfalls that are verbal offenses but has not reached the actual basis, it is a wrong doing.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed pa brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed pa brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations that are different from the actual basis, there is a wrong doing.

original: gzhan de dang ldan par smras pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gzhan de dang ldan par smras pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one says that another person possesses that, it is a wrong doing.

original: nyan pa po mi'i 'gro ba pa dang rang bzhin nyams pa la sogs pas smra mi shes pa dang / don brnga mi 'phrad pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyan pa po mi'i 'gro ba pa dang rang bzhin nyams pa la sogs pas smra mi shes pa dang / don brnga mi 'phrad pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the listener is a human being, but is impaired by nature and so on and does not understand the meaning, it is a wrong doing.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the listener is a nonhuman being, it is a wrong doing.

original: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
translated: If the listener is an animal, it is censured.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: A downfall of transgression of a preparation is a subtle wrong doing.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations of preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni mi'i chos bla ma ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni mi'i chos bla ma ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is not speaking of the higher qualities of a human being.

original: nyan pa po bden ba mthong ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa la ltung ba med do /
analyzed: nyan pa po bden ba mthong ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa la ltung ba med do /
translated: There is no offense if the listener has seen the truth or has taken full ordination.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gi yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gi yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is stated in order to avoid not refraining from speaking of the higher qualities of a human being in all situations and to all fully ordained monks.

original: gdul ba'i don nyid ma gtogs par khyim pa'i mdun du rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdul ba'i don nyid ma gtogs par khyim pa'i mdun du rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: Except for the purpose of guiding, one should not display supernatural powers in front of laypeople.

original: dge slong ma ston pa'i spyan sngar rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma ston pa'i spyan sngar rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not display supernatural powers in front of fully ordained nuns.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.🔽This concludes the explanation of the eighth downfall.

original: mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed de brgyad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed de brgyad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The Vinaya Verses states:

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel ba 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel ba 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Vinaya Compendium, a commentary on the Sūtra on the Foundation of Mindfulness on the Monastic Code,

original: bam bo nyi shu ba /
analyzed: bam bo nyi shu ba /
translated: Volume Twenty

original: skur ba 'debs pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: skur ba 'debs pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The introduction to the downfall on slander.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Rājagṛha, in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gnas mal 'bogs pa dang / zas la bsko bar bskos pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gnas mal 'bogs pa dang / zas la bsko bar bskos pa'i tshe na /
translated: When the venerable Jīvaka Komārabhacca was appointed to assign dwellings and distribute food,

original: de dad pa dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can yin pas dge 'dun la chos dang ldan pas zhal ta byed pa'i las la brtson pa yin la des sangs rgyas sam @43b chos sam //
analyzed: de dad pa dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can yin pas dge 'dun la chos dang ldan pas zhal ta byed pa'i las la brtson pa yin la des sangs rgyas sam @43b chos sam //
translated: he was faithful, good, and had a virtuous nature. He was diligent in his work of serving the saṅgha in a way that was in accordance with the Dharma. He did not offer to the Buddha, the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun nam yid du 'thad pa'i dge slong rnams la ma phul ba'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun nam yid du 'thad pa'i dge slong rnams la ma phul ba'am /
translated: or the saṅgha, or to monks who were pleasing to him,

original: yongs su ma btang ba ci yang med de /
analyzed: yongs su ma btang ba ci yang med de /
translated: There is nothing that he has not given away.

original: des de ltar phul zhing yongs su btang bas chos gos gsum ngan cing snam sbyar rnyings nas /
analyzed: des de ltar phul zhing yongs su btang bas chos gos gsum ngan cing snam sbyar rnyings nas /
translated: Since he has given away and relinquished everything in this way, his three Dharma robes are in bad condition and his patched robe is worn out.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One about this.🔽The Blessed One gave them a large piece of cloth, and the monks gave it to the venerable Mahākāśyapa.

original: de la gsol ba'i las kyis ras yug chen byin pa dang / dge slong mdza' bo dang sa las skyes gnyis tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor dang / tsher bas tsher bas nas rjes su 'brel pa'i khon yod pas de gnyis dge slong rnams kyi mdun na tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di ltar dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa rnyed do cog gcig gis gang zag la yongs su sngo bar byed na dge 'dun gyis rnyed pa
analyzed: de la gsol ba'i las kyis ras yug chen byin pa dang / dge slong mdza' bo dang sa las skyes gnyis tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor dang / tsher bas tsher bas nas rjes su 'brel pa'i khon yod pas de gnyis dge slong rnams kyi mdun na tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di ltar dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa rnyed do cog gcig gis gang zag la yongs su sngo bar byed na dge 'dun gyis rnyed pa
translated: The monks Nanda and Gavāṃpati had a grudge against the venerable Mahākāśyapa, and they said to the monks, “Venerables, if one person dedicates all the gains of the saṅgha to an individual, how can the saṅgha’s gains🔽be accomplished?”

original: bsgrub par ga la 'gyur zhes smod par byed nas dge slong rnams kyis de gnyis la smras nas tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed gnyis der ma 'dus sam /
analyzed: bsgrub par ga la 'gyur zhes smod par byed nas dge slong rnams kyis de gnyis la smras nas tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed gnyis der ma 'dus sam /
translated: The monks said to them, “Venerables, did you not attend that meeting?”

original: 'dus so // 'on ci'i phyir smod par byed /🔽de gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dus so // 'on ci'i phyir smod par byed / de gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: “We’re in agreement.” “Why are you disparaging us?”

original: ji kho bo cag gnyis ngur yang mi gnang ngam zhes zer ba na /
analyzed: ji kho bo cag gnyis ngur yang mi gnang ngam zhes zer ba na /
translated: “Because you two are not allowing us to do it.”🔽“Well then, why don’t you two do it?”

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag sngar legs par rung bar byas nas de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag gis 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag sngar legs par rung bar byas nas de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag gis 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te /
translated: “Venerables, why do you disparage and insult the monks who have already made a proper agreement, saying,

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa bdag gis gang zag la bsngos so zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa bdag gis gang zag la bsngos so zhes smod par byed /
translated: ‘The saṅgha’s gains have been dedicated to individuals’?

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: You’re making a big deal out of nothing.”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The Blessed One then assembled the saṅgha of monks and asked the monks Mitra and Bhūmija about this matter,

original: dge slong mdza' bo dang / sa las skyes gnyis la smras nas /
analyzed: dge slong mdza' bo dang / sa las skyes gnyis la smras nas /
translated: and after asking them, he rebuked them, saying,

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: “This is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not suitable.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not proper.🔽It is not in accord with the Dharma.

analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa dang gang la bsngos pa'i gang zag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa rab tu byung ba 'am /

translated: the robes were previously offered out of faith; they are the Sangha’s acquisition of robes; they are assigned to a human being; the lie is told; the other person understands the meaning by any means.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is incomplete, then a downfall is not incurred, but a minor infraction is incurred.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of slander but has not yet reached the actual basis, one has a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various preparations that are different, there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: mtshan dang lta ba mi mthun pa dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gzhi 'dis skur pa 'debs pa la nyes byas so /
analyzed: mtshan dang lta ba mi mthun pa dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gzhi 'dis skur pa 'debs pa la nyes byas so /
translated: If one disparages someone who does not have the same view or who is not fully ordained, using this as a basis, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is the property of the saṅgha of fully ordained monks, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: zas kyi rnyed pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas kyi rnyed pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is the property of food, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gos kyi rnyed pa mi rung ba nyid dang / tshad las chung ba la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa mi rung ba nyid dang / tshad las chung ba la ni nyes byas so //
translated: If it is the property of clothing, it is an offense of wrong conduct if it is unsuitable or too small.

original: dge 'dun la log par bsngos so zhes zer ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun la log par bsngos so zhes zer ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one says, “It is wrongly dedicated to the saṅgha,” it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang zag gis rnyed pa gang zag gzhan la log par bsngos so zhes zer ba la nyes byas so //🔽gang la bsngos pa'i gang zag mi ma @45a * //
analyzed: gang zag gis rnyed pa gang zag gzhan la log par bsngos so zhes zer ba la nyes byas so // gang la bsngos pa'i gang zag mi ma @45a * //
translated: If one says, “It is wrongly dedicated to another person by the person to whom it was dedicated,” it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the person to whom it was dedicated is not human, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
translated: If it is an animal, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: If it is a minor preparation, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: The application is the same as the number of applications.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The application of the application of a minor offense is also a minor offense, a subtle offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dad pas ma phul ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dad pas ma phul ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is not offered out of faith.

original: log par bsngos pa bden na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: log par bsngos pa bden na ltung ba med do //
translated: If it is dedicated to the wrong person, there is no offense if it is true.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one whose mind is disturbed, or for one who is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du skur ba 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du skur ba 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not relying on all the aspects of denigration in all circumstances.

original: gnas mal stobs pa la sogs pa 'dul bar gtogs pa'i bya ba la gal te bstan pa nyid du dgos na gsol ba sngar btang ba'i don gyi las bya'o //
analyzed: gnas mal stobs pa la sogs pa 'dul bar gtogs pa'i bya ba la gal te bstan pa nyid du dgos na gsol ba sngar btang ba'i don gyi las bya'o //
translated: If it is necessary to explain the duties belonging to the Vinaya such as distributing bedding and so on, the action of the purpose of the previously made request should be done.

original: dge slong chos gos gsum ngan cing snam spyar yang yongs su rnyings pa la dge 'dun gyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las byas te ras yug chen sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong chos gos gsum ngan cing snam spyar yang yongs su rnyings pa la dge 'dun gyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las byas te ras yug chen sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “Monks who have only three robes and whose patched robe is worn out should be given a large piece of cloth by the saṅgha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

original: de ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be done.

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: “The bedding should be laid out, the gaṇḍī should be struck, and the monks should be summoned by having the announcement made three times.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur ba la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur ba la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba bya'o //
translated: When the entire saṅgha is present and has assembled, one monk should make a motion:

original: 'di ltar bya ste 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod bar bya'o /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod bar bya'o /
translated: ‘This is how it should be done. One should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
translated: “‘Honored saṅgha, please listen!

original: tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor 'di ni dad pa ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor 'di ni dad pa ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can te /
translated: This venerable Ājñāta Kauṇḍinya is faithful, good, and has a virtuous nature.

original: dge 'dun la yang chos kyis zhal ta bgyid pa'i las la brtsom pa la gsal /
analyzed: dge 'dun la yang chos kyis zhal ta bgyid pa'i las la brtsom pa la gsal /
translated: He is skilled in the work of serving the saṅgha in accordance with the Dharma.

original: des sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas sam /
translated: He has served the Buddha,

original: chos sam / dge 'dun nam /
analyzed: chos sam / dge 'dun nam /
translated: the Dharma, and the saṅgha,

original: yid du 'thad pa'i dge slong rnams la ma phul ba'am /
analyzed: yid du 'thad pa'i dge slong rnams la ma phul ba'am /
translated: He has not offered anything to the monks who are pleasing to the mind,

original: yongs sum btang ba ci yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: yongs sum btang ba ci yang ma mchis te /
translated: nor has he given anything away.

original: des de ltar phul zhing yongs su btang bas chos gos gsum dan cing snam sbyar yang yongs su rnyings la /
analyzed: des de ltar phul zhing yongs su btang bas chos gos gsum dan cing snam sbyar yang yongs su rnyings la /
translated: Since he has offered and given in this way, his three Dharma robes are worn out and his patched robe is also very old.

original: dge 'dun la ni ras yug chen 'byor par mnga' na /
analyzed: dge 'dun la ni ras yug chen 'byor par mnga' na /
translated: But he has a large cotton cloth that he has acquired from the saṅgha.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis tshe dang lan pa gyad bu nor la ras yug chen stsol to //
